40883847.review:
The TL,DR;
The game is clunky and lacks alot of depth to anyone with prior experience with any other rpg mechanically is very lacking pick the game up on the cheap if at all.

And so:
Story wise the game is probably its strongest point if you are willing to go into it with an open mind though it is nothing ground breaking, cutscenes play out as like a visual novel and this can be a drawback to some and I can concure that any scenes impact or weight of severity and impact is lost in the still static 2d form.
The game itself is very rough around the edges, with little need to look at most of what the game would like to call the "in-depth" side of things like the weapon and combo elements. If you are going to go into a JRPG then this probably would not be my choice.
All of the areas are copy pastes of several linear designed areas and dont really offer much for you.
The rediculious amount of items is mared only by their irrelevance for 99% of the game and so make for little more than throw away slots, the weapon combos also lack any real thought when all you have to do is look for which ones follow a launch and then which ones do the most damage. 90% of the time all you are looking to do is hit as many targets as you want and then use Fairize and up your dps insanely fast and boom. 
Once Taira has the option to heal for you then you have little scare of dying and even using the unique idea of "world shaping" to give yourself a challenge, this actually ends up amounting to easier grinding and as such looses any idea of difficulty. 
The fighting is somewhat clunky with overly repeated voicelines and unskippable cutscenes during battle and while the Fairize music does end up being catchy, you cant sweep everything under the rug of an overly catchy tune. 
Grinding elements of the game are overly tedious and the maths behind several of the attacks just comes out as completly wasted as an attack. 
The animations are all reasonably smooth if lacking a little fluidity when it comes to the run animation but its overall fairly well done and the same goes for the music.
The biggest issue I have with the game is that it feels like it sacrificed any depth of its mechanics for lengthy grinding on meaningless stats. It's like having a mile long swimmingpool thats only an inch deep and this also then leads me to want to just put the game down after finishing it.
Grab the game when its on the cheap and just switch your brain off. 
Dont get me wrong, you can enjoy this game then all the more for you but the lack of reward for learning up and trying to dive deeper into mechanics for me left me feeling and wanting more from the game.
- 4/10

40691334.review:
Japanese turned based RPG about the battle good and evil. Heroes called Fencers collect ancient swords called Furies. Fencers have a bond with their Fairies, magical creatures with special abilities.
It is my second JRPG after Valkyria Chronicles, so any comparison will be to Valkyria.

[b]PROS:[/b]
- Pretty, colorful, anime style visuals.
- Awesome combat animations for special moves and magic skills.
- Multiple options to develop your skills: invest points in combos, magic, abilities or stats.
- Great voice acting (English version).
- Funny moments, cute characters.
- General Japan vibe with ramen and whatnot.
- Interesting mechanics of "world" shaping which adds bonuses and handicaps to levels.
- Parts of soundtrack are really cool (especially Fairize themes).
- Works smoothly even on average PC. Good optimization.

[b]MEH:[/b]
- Story is OK, but it's a little cliche and simplistic.
- Characters are diverse and funny, but they lack depth.
- Some soundtrack songs become a little annoying, i.e. the "comedic moment theme" and "embarrasing moment theme".
- Gameplay is too easy for initial ~10 hours, but becomes a little too difficult after ~20 hours and requires some moderate grinding.
- The world is supposed to be fantasy, kinda 17th-18th century style. But someone decided to add modern guns and some defensive robots with lasers to this mix.
- Some assets are re-used: parts of dungeon designs, simplified dialogue portraits etc.

[b]CONS:[/b]
- The controls in third person real time dungeon view are clunky and annoying (keyboard and mouse).

Despite some grinding moments and partially annoying controls I had fun playing Fairy Fencer F and will definitely play some more JRPGs in future :)

[b]GAMEPLAY 7/10
GRAPHICS 8/10
AUDIO 8/10
STORY 7/10[/b]

39688880.review:
Muy divertido. Al principio parece un poco generico, pero las personalidades de los personajes hacen que sea muy disfrutable, y a mitad de juego te sorprende con un buen giro que hace que el protagonista y casi todos los personajes cambien bastante y se vuelvan aun más iteresantes. Y por budda si no estuve todo tenso y compenetrado en la ultima batalla!!! fue epico, memorable y un climax excelente
El sistema de combate si bien es repetitivo es muy agil y dinamico, por lo que no llegas a cansarte del todo nunca y logra mantenerte atento constantemente devido a la administrasion de recursos y espacios, aunque en las siguientes vueltas soles estar tan roto que esa parte de desafio desaparece un poco, aunque entiendo que es para que puedas completar todas las rutas y objetivos secundarios sin perder tanto tiempo. 
El sistema de levels tambien me parecio muy bueno. Si bien siempre existira una opción más optima que las demás con cada personaje, el juego no tiene problema en dejarte hacer lo que te venga en gana con cada uno, permitiendo que todos adquieran el rol en el combate que tu consideres mejor, y a mi parecer todo juego que te diga "Podés hacer lo que quieras con tu vida" se merece unos cuanto puntos extra.
La parte grafica va en cada uno. Si te gusta la estetica anime 3D, es hermosa. Si no te gusta y decidis jugar el juego, o te acostumbras o la aprendes a tolerar.
La musica es MUY buena, aunque puede llegar a cansar un poco despues de haberla escuchado tantas veces. Eso si, las canciones con letra estan utilizadas de manera fantastica y refuerzan los sentimientos de cada momento de manera sublime. De hecho, varias de ellas las tengo en mi algunas listas de musica personales.
Mi recomendación es que al menos lo pruebes. Puede que este un poco caro, y que de historia principal no tenga tantas horas, pero tiene mucha rejugabilidad y por lo menos a mi me encanto. Y si sos de los que les gusta presumir completar el 100% del juego y los logros, vas a tener para rato y va a ser todo un desafio. ^,^/

39556042.review:
Перед описанием игры хочу сказать, что в стиме есть ремейк данного продукта, в котором не просто улучшенна визуальная составляющая, но так же доработаны уровни, и самое главное - 2 альтернативные сюжетные линии. (Fairy Fencer F Advent Dark Force)
А теперь к самой игре:
•Это - обычная jrpg, очень похожа на другие игры от Compile Heart, но в то же время она уникальна, есть механика прокачки персонажей, за снаряжением же можно особо не гоняться.
•Где-то 50% времени - сюжетные диалоги и вставки, они разбавляют геймплей, не давая ему наскучить.
•Она избавленна от вечного гринда (достаточно по разу зачистить каждую пачку мобов - и уже будете куда сильнее, чем должны), игра не требует знания каких-либо основ в архетипах персонажей, уровней, боссбатлов, так что если только начинаете играть в jrpg - эта игра будет идеальной.
•В плане сюжета и персонажей - игра явно показывает себя лучше, чем добрая половина других jrpg. Кроме того, имеются концовки, сводящие гг с девушками, однако тут же и минус: одно из условий выполняется практически на старте игры, т.е. не выйдет просто загрузиться и перепройти пару уровней. (Если играть в ремейк, то там рутов куда больше, и перепроходить игру на совершенно другие сюжетные линии - одно удовольствие)

39265869.review:
If you were truly searching for the most standard of the JRPGs, something that has everything the medium already did but didn’t try even a little to put our something new or memorable, a title where the protagonist would be your average lovable goofball, the side characters the most basic standard heroines and stock personalities, you’d probably be happy to get Fairy Fencer F. It’s not that it is inherently a bad title, rather if you bought a Neptunia game you’d get the same combat system with some sort of substance put into it.

What Idea Factory did with this game was releasing just the bare minimum: the dungeons are linear and uninspired, ever more than Neptunia I mean; the characters never bother to be surprising or entertaining; the plot plays exactly like you imagine from start to finish; the combat is also pretty bare. Everything gives the feeling that this game was made out of obligation rather than because a team of creatives had and idea and came together to release this idea to the world.

I enjoyed my time in Fairy Fencer F, but I can’t help but think that despite being light-hearted, mindless fun I could’ve gotten better from similar titles.

39123182.review:
So I played this game for a few hours now and decided to make a review.
This review will be updated while I'm progressing in the the game.

[06. Jan. 2018]

The game itself is fun, I like the turn based fighting and the animations are pretty cool as well even though it's pretty old + it originaly was a console title.

I can not say much about the story yet, it seems to be ok but nothing too special, but who knows maybe it has some pretty hard plot twiest to it :)

There is only one HUGE problem that I have with this game, and the problem is, that the DLCs are completely unbalanced!
As soon as you put on DLC armor you're pretty much in god mode and you can't be killed anymore.
WHO THOUGHT THIS WAS A GOOD IDEA? IT'S LIKE PAY TO WIN! ... IN A SINGLE PLAYER!

Maybe someone has fun playing a game where you can't lose, but I don't really like it...

But as long as you dont use the DLC stuff you'll be fine, even though some of the Armors look pretty cool :)

SUMARY

PROS:
 - Nice turn based fight system
 - decent story
 - Nice animation
 - english dub isn't to bad :)
 - The is a loli jew in the game called Lola, you'll know what I mean as soon as you meet her

CONS:
 - DLCs are totaly unbalanced!
 - Not all dialogs are voiced (I don't know if it's only in the english version or in all versions)

EDIT 01 (14 Jan. 2018)

I dug further into the story and gameplay, and I gotta say I'm absolutely in love with it!

38916802.review:
This is my review for Fairy Fencer F. The game is a JRPG with multiple endings, node based exploration, visual novel styled conversations, and hidden characters. I enjoyed the game quite a bit but must admit a bias towards the game type; I have all the Neptunia games on both Console and on Steam plus others from Compile Heart enjoy the style that Fairy Fencer F was presented in; a brightly colourful, endearing characters, and wild romp of a game. The game is not entirely happy and cheery, but it would be something I would recommend playing if you want a break from the gritty grim dark edgy genre that is in vogue right now. The game sets out to do the things it is made to do, and it does them well. It does not try to be something it is not, so keep that in mind when purchasing it.

The Good:
The characters are well developed with rational arcs and believable actions and intentions. The story is a heroes journey with some subversions and twists on the trope and is set in a unique post-apocalyptic world. I found it overall an enjoyable one. The graphics are colourful and in the anime style. The main game takes around 20 Hours to complete but there are multiple endings to add on to this, for the price of admission I think this is a fair price. The game has skip functions to speed up battles when grinding and end visual novel sections when replaying, this helps alleviate tedium that other JRPG's fall victim to. Combat is satisfying with abilities and animations are very well done; you can also unlock all kinds of costumes for your characters. The voice acting is delightful and one of the characters has a Canadian accent, which pleased me greatly.

The Bad:
There are some railroad battles where you are meant to fail, even if you manage to defeat the enemy, which I always dislike. Mood whiplash occasionally occurs when the tone shifts rapidly from comical to tragic and back, these moments are few- like the mass graves part. There is excessive grinding to unlock all the powers and reach maximum level, this is not required to beat the game but is required to see all the endings.

The Ugly:
Pippin, seriously what the hell is he?

38886583.review:
Okay.  This is the sort of game that Valve REALLY needs to have a better rating system for.  Officially I’d give it a neutral or slightly below neutral. Four out of ten so to speak.  But the question is "Do you recommend this game."  The answer is no.  If I had paid full price ($30 at the time) I would have been furious.  Definitely would have been a return.  I paid $3 on a Steam Sale and am satisfied enough to say $3 worked for me.

Truth be told there is a lot of decent stuff in here.  The art work is very good even if the animation is... well the animation is somewhere in between Visual Novel and Harmony Gold if you understand the reference.  Actually, most of the bits in between dungeon crawling (and some during D.C.ing) are very much visual novel style.  The afore mentioned Dungeon Crawling is average.  Similar to the Atelier series.  Combats are good.  Turn based with free movement.  (No grids or anything.)  The leveling system is... I'm on the fence about is.  There seems to be a lot to it but there’s also not a lot of control over it.  Purely leveling gives you stat bonuses that you have no say in.  There is a secondary XP system to raise weapon stats.  You can change out fairies and EQ but there’s mostly stat upgrades in them as far as I have seen.  So that bit COULD be better but could also be way worse.

Buuut then you have to deal with the story and the characters.  Thus far I have seen three main characters that do most of the talking and a half dozen cameos that had not a lot to say.  The acting is... frankly I can't tell if these are amazing actors/actresses doing a stellar job trying to save unsalvageable lines or mediocre actors doing their best with... unsalvageable lines.  So far as the main three characters I have thus far seen...  Frankly, I have never in my life seen a story in any medium go to such great lengths to make me hate every protagonist.    I was truly disappointed to find the lava in the second dungeon was just the edge of the map and not something I could jump into to shut them up.  I THINK this is intended to be comedy.  But it fails on every level.  Then it invents and constructs new levels to fail on.  Then I think they may hire some contractors...

I am, in fact, quitting playing fairly early in the game because I simply cannot face another cut scene.  I think there is a good game in here somewhere.  If only we could change the past and drop every bit of dialog and plot and completely redo the story line.  Okay the actual story isn't that horrific.  It's pretty standard JRPG stuff.  Light and dark deities sealed off after an ancient battle before the dawn of time.  Blah blah.  But, it is conveyed by three people I have no interest in spending any time with… Okay, I have an active desire to avoid them… So the story sort of falls flat.

Short version, if you can put up with the never-ending tirade of motivation to hate the characters and thus the story and, by extension, the world they live in, then the game is not so bad.  My recommendation:  Do not pay full price.    

And, to the Devs:  I know you guys worked really hard on this.  Believe it or not you CAN tell.  But somewhere along the line…  *sigh* The review has to reflect the final and whole product.  Better luck next time.  8)

38879773.review:
I love their Neptunia series so had high hopes that another turn based RPG from the creators of that would hit similar highs, yet the end product is just boring.

On the plus side the humour found in that other series is present and accounted for. No fourth wall demolishing here but the characters inject plenty of in-universe humour into the story and it was pretty cool to learn more about people. Some scenes and ideas can drag on a bit though, like Fang's abrasiveness to most people he meets.

Unfortunately, the combat that makes up the majority of the experience is just dull. Characters have special attacks, but using them takes away SP you need to either use items or leave the dungeon to restore, which resulted in me saving them for the bosses or healing. Especially due to the amount of enemies you can run across in any given stage. This left just normal attacks, but these are very limited as well. Neptunia's combo system for normal attacks was a lot of fun with the choice available from the start. Here you get one attack per turn until you pump earned WP into adding additional slots. Even when you do have more attacks the tactics come down to figuring out which damage type the enemy is weak to and then using nothing but that on them. No switching between different types during the battle or readjusting combos between fights. There also seems to be an unnecessary split between physical and magic special moves, but since each character is generally more proficient with one over the other it can lead to some moves just never seeing use outside of maybe curiosity.

Then there is the grind. You start off with very little as the game uses two experience systems. The first is the standard XP that grants boosts to stats on level up. The other is WP, which is a resource you can spend to unlock various things of characters. Stuff such as aforementioned attack slots, new specials or boosting stats further. The ability to choose is nice but so much WP is needed to give characters the same amount of options those in other RPGs would have at the same point without a WP system that it can drag earning enough to unlock sufficient options. The big selling point of the game - fairy partners you can assign to characters - ended up being little more than the equivalent of accessories that gain experience from battles too. Not exactly the clever twist on RPG mechanics I was hoping for and just adds another grind to the game.

It's kinda a shame, because when I got to the bosses and felt free to actually go all out with specials and items (especially once I'd used WP to unlock a variety of options) there was an element of fun. They had significant special moves and multiple health bars in most cases so indulging in those hard hitting moves or making use of buff techniques made me feel more involved that mindlessly hitting the normal attack command. I just don't feel like the payoff of those boss battles is worth the grind though all the common monsters on the way.

At this point I feel like I've been pushing on just because it's an IF/CH RPG and not getting anything back out of it.

This is my favorite game on steam, and one of my most favorite games/franchises of all. The game is high on fanservice, which is great for some, but even if  you don't enjoy that, the story and gameplay should make up for it. I would highly recommend picking this game up and giving it a try!

36852171.review:
Fairy Fencer F es un videojuego estilo JRPG (Japanese Rol Playing Game) con un toque de Visual Novel y un sistema de batalla basado en turnos con movimiento.
En cuestión de historia; esta es un poco normal y genérica, nada deslumbrante, a diferencia de los personajes los cuales están bien desarrollados, te encariñas bastante con ellos y sus personalidades. 
En cuanto al apartado gráfico, el juego al ser un JRPG el ambiente debe ser bien recreado y este juego lo hace bastante bien 　 
Dentro de la jugabilidad, las batallas están bien hechas, con combos desbloqueables, organización de tu equipo, diferentes estrategias, una gran variedad de habilidades entre los personajes jugables.
Su banda sonora depende mucho de los gustos musicales de cada persona sobre todo si le agrada este tipo de SFX o no
En cuanto a durabilidad; para tener el juego a el 100% se necesita invertirle mucho tiempo sobre todo si se quiere completar las misiones tanto principales como secundarias, tener los personajes en máximo nivel, desbloquear y conseguir todos los objetos etc.

Lo Positivo:
-Bastante contenido para finalizar el juego por completo.
-Buenos personajes.
-Suficientes habilidades y combos por personaje.
-La habilidad única de cada personaje jugable es bastante diferente por lo cual se pueden hacer diferentes formas de juego y estrategias con cada uno de estos.

Lo negativo:
-El juego no está en español, así que para las personas que no saben inglés se pierden de una gran parte del juego como lo son los diálogos.
-El movimiento en las batallas llega a ser un poco limitado (aunque para ser de batallas por turno está bastante bien)
-Una historia no tan buena, la cual pudo haber sido recreada de una mejor manera.
-Desde cierto punto de vista el juego se puede llegar a tornar un poco repetitivo.

En fin, a este juego le doy un 8/10, es bastante entretenido, y más aún si te gustan los JRPG; bueno para pasar un rato :y entretenerse con un tipo de juegos RPG algo diferente.

35365135.review:
104 horas me tomó completar el juego con todos sus logros... que viaje.

A ver a ver, primero empecemos por lo bueno.
*Fairy Fencer es un juego cuya historia trata literalmente de un cuento de hadas (fairies) pero con un tinte de parodia.
La trama y la ambientacion es tipica de un cuento de esos que te leian antes de ir a dormir cuando eras un niño (o varios mejor dicho por todas las referencias) pero con la diferencia de que el caballero de ojos azules es un vago sin ninguna ambicion, ni dinero. La princesa en apuros, una masoquista dominatrix que trata a todos de sirvientes. La nerd, una friki de las hadas con intensiones pervertidas. Y asi muchos otros personajes bastante desviados del esquema esperado de un tipico cuento para niños.
Con todo esto se desarrolla la historia dando lugar a situaciones de lo mas comicas.
*En cuanto al gameplay esta bien pulido, con animaciones pintorescas (y salteables gracias a dios).
*La dificultad es ideal para aquellos que como yo son re casuales en los rpg por turnos.
*El apartado artistico es muy bueno aunque los escenarios se los nota un poco simples comparado con el detalle que tienen los personajes. Y la musica es perfecta.

En cuanto a las contras...
*Se le nota que esta mal optimizado, pues para el poco detalle que tienen los mapas deberia correr mucho mejor. Igualmente en este tipo de juegos con 24fps peasant style lo jugas tranquilo.
*Blur blur blur y mas BLUR... cuando estas grindeando para conseguir los logros hardcore en donde tenes que matar 10k de monstruos, que te pongan un blureado antes de empezar la pelea, cuando salteas la animacion y cuando termina la pelea se vuelve literalmente un dolor de cabeza. Por suerte no soy yo pero hay mucha gente a la que le agarran mareos por el tema del blureado y en el juego no existe una opcion para desactivarlo. Muy mal ahi por parte de los devs.

Por ultimo, no se si ponerlo como un punto negativo,  pero existe un logro ("We're In The Money!") en el que es practicamente imposible conseguirlo con el maximo dinero que conseguis por peleas aun con todos los boosts.
Ese logro claramente esta puesto para que les compres el DLC Surprass Your Limits que te desbloquea 3 dungeons donde cada pelea te aumenta un lvl en toda tu party y te puede llegar a dar hasta 12 veces mas oro del que conseguis sin dicho DLC. Asique si sos de los que les gusta completar los juegos te recomiendo pagar el dolar que cuesta ese dlc porque sino el tiempo que te toma es INHUMANO. Aun con ese dlc te va a tomar 12 horas de grindeo asqueroso.

Con todo estos pros y aun con sus contras considero a Fairy Fencer F como un juegazo.

35138146.review:
Not really the best position on the jRPG market. 

First of all, the storyline / characters are TERRIBLE. The main character has absolutely no depth whatsoever, he's a totally cliche "let's save everyone / reluctant hero" type of guy without any backstory and real motivations (half of the game is about the main character wanting to get good food to eat - seriously?). Out of the main cast, probably only Tiara has some real backstory going for her and even that isn't too well fleshed out. 

Second of all, all the story is presented in a Visual Novel, "talking heads" style. There are no cutscenes, even ones rendered with the in-game engine, so basically every scene, even the most dramatic / important ones, are just talking heads.

Third of all, the combat is simply repetitive and boring. The locations are totally empty, there's nothing in them besides monsters and the occasional treasure. No story, no setting nothing. Plus, they all look and feel more or less the same. The ratio of fun fights to dreary fights is strongly in favor of the second - especially since there are not that many  monster types and the later variants do not really add a new mechanic - just more firepower. 

The leveling system, based on a typical double resource XP (autolevel) / WP (invest in skills) is somewhat fun, but the fact that you need to grind the boring and repetitive fights to get any real number of WP makes it a chore.

Overall, I've had much more fun with the Legends' series, with the Tales' series, hell, even with The Last Remnant and Final Fantasy XIII. If you want quality jRPG entertainment, I'd suggest you start with those.

34638152.review:
tl;dr It's a neptunia game reskined with stereotypical light novel story. I'm going to spoil it so  people don't bother playing it.

This game has an interesting turn based battle system that lets you customize your combo attacks. It tries to be fresh with the seal unlocking side plot. Other than that, the attractive and colorful character design are the selling point for this game.

Now that we are done with the half decent elements about this game, everything will go downhill. The most glaring aspect that you will notice at the first dungeon is that the control, CG models, map, and battle system are all ripped from Neptunia games.  You can say that it is natural because both games have the same developer, but I would argue that it reflects the effort that are put into this game.

The story is not amazing, it is rather generic and overdone. A boy adventuring with a fairy, and later friends, to save the world. An overdone plot can be done well and subverted but this game done none of them. Now, I am going to move to the characters because, no matter how generic the story is, the characters are the downfall of this game.

The main character is the typical teenage wish fulfillment light novel protagonist. He is lazy and doesn’t want to do anything, but at the same time he is talented and dependable. A bit perverted; therefore hated by girls, but at the same time romantic enough to make them interested in him. So yes, he is everything that the story demands him to be, not relatable and realistic at all. The other cast are as tropey as the main characters, ranging from tsundere girl, chunni girl, genki boy, fan service girl, butler guy, to some random mascot character; because every games need a mascot character. Most of them are just appearing to join the party and throw random jokes mid game. Most of them can be omitted with the only consequence that the game will be boring because there will only be the  main guy, fairy, and tsundere girl.

The plot actually tried to be subversive by introducing time travel; however, none of this opportunity to redo the plot was dedicated for exploring the characters. It is just giving a second chance to the main character to do better, while also making the gameplay longer. Now imagine all the problems that I mentioned warped up perfectly with a Japanese dub that is recorded with a quite low quality mic (yes, the English dub is actually better sounding), I hope you can relate to my claim about how there is not much effort put in this game.

I will not suggest people to buy this game, especially if you are a jaded RPG player.

34243169.review:
I didn't really like this game a lot.
It had the good premises of a (maybe too) simple-drawn turn-based JRPG, and it has a lot of customization capacities (at a first glance, but in the end you'll stick to the same 2-3 attack patterns..), but it adds really nothing to a market that already in the '90s was at its finest.
Since Fairy Fencer F it's a new game (2013, PC version 2015) we could expect much many things. The graphics are colorful and light-hearted, but too simple and not in that retro-way à-la Ys that we all love, grown up with games such as Final Fantasy IV, Chrono Trigger, Ys, and the later sagas like Golden Sun.
It's like an in-between an old graphic and a new 3D one, and it fails in both.
The gameplay is way too easy, even if it is highly customizable. Maybe it's -too- customizable, like in upgrading everything.. you end up grinding and using the same things over and over.
Uematsu is not here, and even if everyone praises the voice acting and so on, the soundtrack is really adoidable.. like one of those games during which you prefer to put on some EDM on your old computer.
So, a combination of poor graphics, overgrinding in recycled dungeons and a general lack of depth and length hasn't made me a fan of this series, although I'll give a try to the other Neptunia games for PC.
Overall, easy and repetitive. I'm gonna borrow some lines from an Italian review I read some months ago: "each of the dungeons, no more than ten, is made up by a single corridor in which you can collect one or two items and fight the same enemies; going through these areas is so exceedingly boring that the gameplay becomes pathetic".
Can't recommend it.

34205090.review:
Until it went all [spoiler]time travely[/spoiler] on me, I was pretty entertained. The gameplay was solid and, while the grind was a bit much at times (also making me tune out a bit), I liked the characters and how combat worked. Combat wasn't hard by any means and got easier and easier as the game progressed, which seems counter how a game should work.

I started making every dungeon have no MP regen and magic off, and would forget healing items and just power through bosses anyway.

You are also only really going to use 3 or so characters unless you -want- to spend your time grinding everyone up. (I at least unlocked each party member's ability to earn EXP while not in combat).

I think, though, the main "plot twist" that suddenly extended the game upset me along with the need for a billion points just to earn another attack.

Can not really recommend, even on sale. The game is just kinda "whatever."

33600646.review:
This game is in my experience is pretty decent but there are any flaws that brought this game down. 

Pros: 
-A not too generic cast of main characters
-The progessing system is interesting
-The story seem pretty normal but the interesting cast of charaters enhanced the story
-At least this game aren't like Neptunia series where it reuses dungeon so many time that it irritated me 

Cons:
-The combat is very stale, nothing new is being add to the combat that already been done multiple times. The only somewhat special thing about the combat is the "unique" mode that each character have that either booster their stats for a negative effect or special effect such as allowing u to see the enemies' stats. But even so, u hardly ever gonna be using them and it for a multiple reason (which will be explain slowly) the first obvious one is because it waste 1 of your turn
-The combat is also rage inducing. The miss and hit system is horrible. Unlike other well made rpg. Missing your attacks happen but it's not that frequently. For everyone who play rpg, u know how annoying it is when a missed attack ruins everything but it not happen often so it kind of ok. Not in this game. The chance of missing an attack is so high. I've misses my attack more than i hit the enemy more than ever. It's ruin everything for me multiple times in 1 sitting. Either missing an enemy and leaving them with sliver of hp and then they kill my unit or heavily wounded them making u waste resources to heal them. Or just simply misses and extend an easily winable fight to another 5-6 seconds. Comback to the  1st point. Because u misses so much. Activating the character's unique ability is just making it worst. The unique ability usually making your character do more dmg for the cost of either costing more mp or losing defend stats. And because u misses so much, in the end it doesnt really change much. U just get a nagtive effects for no reason at all. The battle in this game is basicly comes down to "Don't miss your attack"
-The beginning of the game, by that i mean the first like 10 hours or so (which is where im at, not sure about the rest will update it when i feel like playing more) doesn't have any strategy to it. All u do is just spam normal attack or using skills occasionally for more burst dmg. Buffing skill is pointless because u are wasting alot of mp that u could have just put it into dmg skills and it gonna ended giving u more dmg at the end (and also because u misses so much, and u cant miss with skills). This quickly become boring along with it very generic battle system making it a sleep inducing progress
-Unessarily back tracking. At the end of the dungeon, there are no way to exit it but to back track to where u came from. There are literally no reason to do this but to waste your time for no god dam reason. The monster gonna chase u again and force u into battle with it boring battles of "praying that your attack will not miss". U can't instantly run from the battle but instead have to go to the edge of the "limitted zone" to do so. Which will take up at least 3-4 turns. So have fun wasting even more of your time
-The enemy AI is horrible. It's will focus attack your Leader unit which mean u can't use a range attacker as a leader or else it's will get burst down. If they are not in range to attack your leader, they will attack a random unit in there range(and also try to move closer to your leader sometimes). At the current moment of me playing, there are no taunts or anyway to direct the monster to focus your tank. So the battle is again comming down to "not to miss your attack, and the enemy not attacking your range/dps units". Basicly a RNG fest. Sound fun doesn't it
-The grind is horrible. It's so bad. Even at the start of the game u already have to grind. Your characters gonna misses even more if they're under level (it's already so bad when that at the same level). So have fun try and grind after grind
-The boss have so much health. Even for me who equiped the op weapon from the dlc, it's still take so long for the boss to die. When u get a solid play going and u know that there's no way for u to lose, u still gonna be stuck with the boss that have a ginomous health pool. Combo it with it stale and boring combat system. It's making me so bored that i have to change to the resolution to extremely small and just spamming Enter button while watching some youtube videos until the boss died. (also have even more fun when u misses your attacks alot of as well)
-The obnouxious music that plays when u Fairize ( this comes down to my taste). Holy Shit it's so bad
-The story is very, very generic. I know i put it in Pros but it doesnt matter. Credit goes where it's deserved 

In general the game likes to waste your time (and lots of it for no reason). And it just very boring at the moment. May get better later on but it doesn't matter if the game can't hook me in after 10 hours of play time (also u may wonder that my play time on steam doesn't match the one i said in this review. I played the game while in offline mode)

I may have forgotten some. But that it's for now

I have yet to play the remaster version (may do it in the future) and i hope that it fixes these issue

There maybe many grammatic errors and spelling mistake. I don't feel like checking for them. Sorry

33398417.review:
[/b]推荐买Fairy Fencer  F Advent Dark Force，ADF版包含这一作的大部分剧情，而且增加了新的要素，画质更好。[/b]


下面是评测正文。不含剧透内容。
作为第一款完整通关一周目且二周目后的JRPG，且是第一篇评测。


    首先给这款游戏定位，这是一个纯萌豚向游戏。没什么特别，没有色情内容，是正经的日式刷怪升级推剧情的游戏。而且剧情上也没什么特别的亮点，就是常见的光明黑暗两大势力对峙的故事，有三个结局。没有BANDEND。不过作为减压游戏还是值得一玩的，剧情轻松闲适，战斗也没什么紧张，就是回合制，BOSS前都有存档点，输了可以重来。
    缺点也非常明显。
    技能非常少，男主大约七八个技能，刷到后面，看着很腻。而且到后期，技能甚至不如平A来的伤害高。非要说的话，Tiara有很多AOE技能倒是刷图必备。男主多数高伤害技能是单体攻击。由于前面提到的参数不平衡，男主技能基本用不上了。能用上的只有一个扇形的AOE，以及一个combo特别的多的用来开启Fairize。
    说到Fairize，讲真这套变身系统真是/strike]奇尬无比/strike]非常帅气，每个变身都有15秒左右，不允许跳过。主人公抛出武器，武器刺穿腹部，散发出万丈圣光，镜头一转，主人公全身变出盔甲。
    变身之后会播放中二的变身曲，原来boss曲就听不到了。（这一点在ADF版里得到了调整）
    总的说来，
    就是。
    Ethel真的是太可爱了。买人设送剧情的游戏。

33398393.review:
If you liked neps you'll like this.

[h1]Story: 7/10[/h1]
Fairy Fencer F follows the story of Fang, a scruffy young man in search of his next meal.  He initially gets told about a rumor: the one who can remove the Fury from the ground will have any wish he desires granted.  Through a series of unfortunate events, he gets duped into traveling the world in search of other Furies in order to revive the Goddess.

Personally, the story made me laugh so hard I thought I was coughing up a lung at one point.  The only thing honestly keeping me from giving this a 9/10 is [spoiler]the goddamn time travel arc[/spoiler].

[h1]Gameplay: 5/10[/h1]
The gameplay is nothing to be too excited about.  At a certain point it's mostly just a bunch of button mashing to either force an avalanche attack or avoid it in order to get through battles faster.  

Similar to Hyperdimension Neptunia, your characters start in a formation (which can be edited) and the game creates the turn order based on the AGI stat.  However, unless you use a skill or a magic attack, all attacks are single-target only as opposed to multi-target.

Also, with a system like mine, I should not have frame drop at all and it occurs quite often, either while skipping through text or when loading in a dungeon.  Specs at the bottom of the review for an idea.

[h1]Music: 9/10[/h1]
From Compile Heart's and Idea Factory's other titles, I was surprised to find the soundtrack within the game files itself, which is part of why I'm giving this a 9/10 (who doesn't like free soundtracks?).  The music during Fairize especially surprised me the first time I heard the tracks.  Other than that, unless I was grinding levels or quests out, the music was always turned on.

[h1]Length: 9/10[/h1]
If you're like me and try to obsess over achievements, you're guaranteed to get a lot of play time out of this.

Even if you aren't, my first playthrough still ran me 39 hours, short breaks included.  If you go on the general rule of thumb of $1 per hour of gameplay, you're still beating it at full price (although maybe wait for a sale anyway.  It's on sale during all of the major holidays).

[h1]Overall Score: 7.5/10[/h1]
[h1]Personal Score: 9/10[/h1] (because I laughed hard throughout and cried at the normal ending, despite what I mentioned in the story spoiler).

PC Specs:
Intel i7 6700k @4.0GHz
32GB DDR4 RAM
Gigabyte Radeon R9 270x

33317566.review:
TL;DR: 8/10 If you think you'll like this and want to buy it, don't. Buy advent dark force, if you are hesitant about or don't like JRPGS, this won't change your mind.

Kind of dissapointed I bought this one since advent dark force was on sale as well and I could've gotten that :(

The story is preety good. Some of the characters will grow on you, and some you'll learn to hate while others you will not care for. However be careful which characters you begin to like and use as your main force in battle because hearing them shouting the same 3-4 lines in combat will make you hate them preety freaking fast. 

Speaking of, the combat is a turn based active combat system, which means you take control of one of your units, walk up to the enemy, do some button pressing, to either just mash the buttons and deal a bit of damage or make combos using launchers and pursues to deal a bit of damage with a cherry on it. If you play on medium or above difficulty you will like come across a steep difficulty curve in the latter part of the game, which means that you haven't grinded enough. I almost got my party whiped twice at 2 specific points where I didn't understand why the enemies were so tanky. At first you might think that you should split your party, having one ranged and 2 melee, a tank, a dps and a healer but don't bother, the enemies attack randomly and using abilities is just pointless, the mana bars empty faster than mcdonald's on a "everything is 90% off" day. take my advice and just get 2 melee and 1 ranged pure physical combo gods. Max out their combos and physical damage and give them launchers and purusers attacks. That's the best I've found so far. Also just keep Fang in your team, he becomes very powerfull, very quickly. The combat also has this "tansformation" Thing where you can, after taking or dealing a bit of damage, have a big song and dance after which the character puts on some new clothes and gains bonuses to stats and access to a special ability that takes 40% of their total HP and a bit of mana to perform. But aside form 1 specific character which is really good, I haven't been using these abilities since a good old combo to the face does the job most of the time.

The graphics are nothing to write home about. Late ps2, early ps3 era graphics with simple dungeon design that won't force your brain a lot. There's a bit of platforming in the dungeons but nothing too hard. Weather this simplistic design works to it's advantage or not is up to personal prefrence, really. 

As to what really grinds my gears is that I can't skip the fairization animation (or at least I don't think you can, I haven't dug deep into the config menu to see if you can or not) or the animation for the ultimate abilities and after casting each around 100 times they really start to weigh on my enjoyment. Also, I'm not really sure how the magic system really works, I maxed out one character's magic damage and took all it's abilities and cast them but they were mere specks of damage to the enemies meanwhile combos took at least half of any normal enemies HP bar and took less time to cast. 

But regardless, if you are looking for a traditional jrpg to play just for the nostalgia of playing a jrpg similar to the early final fantasies but with a more updated and simplified combat and upgrade system and ps2 graphics then you should REALLY buy Advent dark force, otherwise if you want to experience how Fairy Fencer F was before advent dark force, though I don't know why you would, then this game is for you, otherwise if you don't like jrpgs or are unsure of them, don't bother.

33245286.review:
tldr: JRPG with turn based combat, heavy grinding and plain story. I don't recommend buying it.

This game is an anime style JRPG with turn based combat and a visual novel-like story telling, just like the other games "IF" makes.
The problem is, in this game everything is boring. The story is bland and painfully boring, the combat is just button mashing and grinding.
The thing that really bothers me, is that they try to spice the combat with status aliments and elemental strength/weaknesses but you don't need to worry about that at all, just smash normal basic attacks, because that's the most effective way to clear the enemies and proceed.
I realy like turn based combat, but this is the bad type of it. 90% of the im i was like: "just get over with it" or "let me finish this game already".
They even added weapon weaknesses. When i saw that i was like "cool! something original" but 5 minutes later i realised its just like the case with the elemental weaknesses, you just don't have to care about them because the game is way too easy and the fastest way to clear the game is to smash the enemy with normal attacks.


[b]Con[/b]

[list]
    [*]Way too grindy
    [*]The combat is boring and silly
    [*]The story is bland
[/list]

[b]Pro[/b]

[list]
    [*]The japanese voice acting is pretty good 
    [*]Harley's bikini ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
[/list]

Thanks for reading my review and i hope i didn't angered the grammar police.

32737200.review:
I am unsure on how to start with this review, the game does so many things in a transparent, simple surface design intention in both story and gameplay mechanics to a point where it would seem like a terrible game on paper. Yet, after fully completing the game, I would argue otherwise!
(By the way, completing the game is pure insanity. Thus I would suggest you refrain from even having that slight idea on this game or any other title from the same studio!)

people tend to compare this game with another title by the same studio due to their similar mechanics, the Hyperdimension series. I will not be doing that, instead I will try to judge this game as it is. Also, again I state, even though most of what I say here will probably sound unappealing, check on the bottom of the review for there I will try to justify why I believe that is not the case.


Story: (Might contain spoilers)
All JPRGs have a storyline. Some are good, others are horrendous. This one is leaning towards the bad, unfortunately. It is basically just "There is a goddess of good and a god of evil, they both are in a state of hibernation. We must revive the goddess of good by collecting some stuff and so on!" You can basically tell where this is going by now. There is nothing that interesting about the story and it is rather transparent to be frank. 
Most of the story is presented in a Visual Novel fashion of storytelling. If you have played a visual novel before you would immediately understand what I am referring to. If not, however, it is basically just showing a 2D picture of a character whom is supposed to be conversating, with animated mouth movement and maybe the occasional one hand raising up, and that is it. It was intentional to have the story be a Visual Novel, but it felt lazy in a way. Also, there are only a hand full of 3D animated cutscenes, so yeah...

Characters: 
One of the strong points of this game, yet not strong enough to compete with other titles, I dare say. Since this is a JRPG you would expect a large party of characters, and you are correct. except, in terms of character development, only three are affected. And the rest are just there. When inspecting each character individually, they are all one-dimensional. Each one has just one unique trait and personality, that is it. Yet when together, the interactions and dialogue are truly great! I do like the comedic side of this game and how these one-dimensional characters were able to bring that sense of comedy to life.
I won't explain character traits here. But believe me, one look at a given character says it all.

Overworld: 
There isn't much to speak of here. the overworld is basically menus with pretty pictures. In town, you click the button on screen to access the inn, shop, whatever. world exploring is just looking over a map and choosing a place to go to and you instantly teleport there. That place you went to is where the game is. As in, where you can move freely and do your combat and whatnot. Unfortunately, even though these places can be forests and deserts, but when carefully looking, it is your typical standard dungeon. In other words, gameplay is only shown in dungeons. 

There is one pleasant thing about the world map, though. You have the option of stabbing swords on the ground (Sounds odd, I know) to gain some buffs into the dungeons you wish to visit. Example, stab a sword that grants bonus exp but reduced defense next to dungeon "X" and there you go!

Mechanics: 
very few commands when exploring. There is movement, press "B" to jump, press "A" to attack/interact. As for combat mechanics. It is a turn based battle in 3D. Your character has a small space for you to position him/her. After choosing, you pick his/her action. Whether it be basic attacks, magic or status elements. 
The game does a huge plus by introducing a fusion mechanic at the beginning of the game. Hooking that player fairly early. As for difficulty, the game is very easy. So easy, in fact, that I did not bother with learning combos until maybe a few quests prior to finishing the game’s storyline.

Music:
There aren’t much. But for what there is, it is rather pleasant. I do like most of the songs in the game. Maybe two or three I would consider listening to outside of the game. And to the game’s credit, the songs in some way does fit the aesthetics.

Visuals:
3D Graphics are slightly higher than a regular PS2 game. Visual Novel art is pretty. Nothing more to that.

Overall:
Critically, this game does almost everything averagely. and that will disappoint so many people. But it is that very reason why I loved this game. It is Average with good character interactions! With all the newly released games and their "Super amazing next gen gameplay mechanics!" and whatnot, it was very relieving to have a game that you can just enjoy without putting much effort into it, Plus the combat was easy. Thus, it was overall a very relaxing experience for me!
I do hope that I was able convey my point in this review.

Critical review 5.5/10
My personal review based on how much I appreciate the game 7.5/10

Edit: It is said that Fairy Fencer F: Advent Dark Force is the remade better version. I haven't played it mayself thus I cannot commentate on that.

32479901.review:
8/10
While I have not played Advent Dark Force, I believe you should buy that instead of this. I believe you should buy that instead because it has more content and basically has the same story as this game or so I was informed.

Now that I said that, here is the review of this game.
    The story itself is good. It has 3 different endings so you it has some replayability. My first full game walkthrough took about 27.
    Here are the good things:
        1)The combat is slightly more complicated than Neptunia and slightly better than the first 3 Rebirth series. The core gameplay is the same as Neptunia like the turn base and being in range to attack the enemy. The way this game does that differently is you get your skills differently and your damage isn't based on you weapon(Kinda). The way you get your skills is instead of just leveling up and unlocking it, everytime you fight an enemy you get WP. This WP can be used to unlock new skills or improve your damage/defence/amount of attacks you have.  You also cannot buy weapons for your characters to imrpove their damage. With WP you can unlock different weapon attacks like let's you have a sword and you unlock an axe attack, during battle when you use the axe attack your sword becomes an axe for only that period of attack.
       2)Great soundtrack.
   I do have a few complaints I have about this game. Well this part are all spoilers so read at your own risk. 
       1) Some things are just left unanswered. [spoiler] After the main character travels back in time, one of my party members suddenly became a bad guy and it was never shown why he became a bad guy. All they said was it may be a side effect of the singularity but it was never confirmed. They should have clearly said why he became a bad guy.  [/spoiler]
       2) Forced platforming[spoiler] Before you can reach one of the bosses, you have to do some platforming. There is an item that if your lucky, one of the old bosses you fought will drop it which makes this platforming section easy. If your unlucky like me, you have to make a jump perfectly just to get the boss. If you fail, you get to start over from the entrance of the map.  [/spoiler]
       3) Once you beat the last boss, you have to start a new game. It just asks you if you want to save the game then takes you to the main menu. Once you press continue, you go to new game +. They should have made going to New Game + an option.
   After all said and done, this game is still a pretty good game which is why I gave it a 8/10.

32094331.review:
Really good RPG. I find these Asian RPG's have a really fun combat system, google it if you don't know what i mean, and this one executes it really well. 

Most of the playtime for your first playthrough will most likely be cutscenses though. There are a lot of cutscenes. However, they are usually narrated and add to the story quite nicely. Usually.

Some things are not explained well and you will probably miss a good amount of things on your first playthrough however new game + does not increase the difficulty so you can breeze through that in almost no time with skipping the cutscenes.

Some big cons are available though:

-the grind for certain side quests is absolutely huge. Like unbearably huge and it will make you agitated as fuck.

-sometimes your characters will bail on the fight and you will be left with just one or two people who you have trained and the fight will get a little harder

-there's only like 8 characters and some of them are just flat out useless. I'd say there are 4 usable characters however you obviously don't get to start out with them all

-the cutscenes are really nice but after you skip them all in your second play through the game becomes really short, especially for how long the cutscenes on your first play through made it feel

31711480.review:
Another day another RPG that is made by the same developers who did the hyperdimension series. I will be reviewing the game on a pro/ con style and end with my final conclusion.

Pro:
      Great story. The story is full of laughter and moments that are sad or shocking. Those last two are very notable since the game is a cutesy RPG so dealing with the concept of death of a beloved character is very sudden. It really helps attach the player with the characters and plot.

     The characters are all likeable. The main party members are very memerable with their crazy dialog and unique personality. Each character is special and tied with the story, they all play a pivital role to and their personalities remain constant to a degree.

     Music is phenonenal. Each track is very nice especially the sad tune since that really tied with the overall mood at times but there are other songs that i enjoyed which begs the question....why is there not a sound track that can be purchased on steam.

     The level design is for the most part varied. Some levels are pretty much palet swaps. The rest of the levels are unqiue since they have a gemic such as a windy level or lava, or forest. The one set back is how the second half of the game uses the stages already visited to because of time travel which feels lazy but it is whatever.

con:
       The grind is real for those who want those achievements like getting 100million gold.

        Unlocking secret characters like lola has to be done every playthrough even if on a previous playthrough you have gained all the furies.


Conclusion:
        The game is great. Great characters and story that make the game very lively. The rpg elements work well since every level up makes you feel much more stronger. It is debatable on whether it is better than the hyperdimension seres but it was a blast to see how things worked out. I reccomend the game to any rpg gamer.

FFF is a game made by the Nep Neppy's and it's battle formula and play style are very similar.  Those who enjoy JRPGS and enjoy derp here and there, will overall enjoy FFF.

I enjoyed this game overall and it had a great story and alot of groans and facepalms.  I only went for one ending but I'm overall happy with it.  In terms of story, I felt it had a shout out to Final Fantasy 8, however, it was FF8 done RIGHT and I was pleased with the ending unlike how 'whipped' Squall becomes in the end.  I'll need to view the other endings later.

Pros:  Fast pace action
Colorful characters each with their own personality.
Decently long rpg (40 hours)
Tight controls
Great story overall
Had its derp.

Cons:
Similar battle system to Neptunia so nothing overall refreshing.
Lots of button mashing for attacking.  Attacks were more common than skills.
Gold was a grind fest which is why I didn't unlock Lola speaking of I had to actually grind gold in order for the Main Story to proceed.  Glad there was NO inns to recover, you recovered when you returned the world map.  Even with bonuses gold was still a hassle i was lucky to amass maybe 1200 in a dungeon and when you need 20,000+ to proceed with the story let alone equipement...that's a lot of battles!
Poor crafting system and item drop rate.

In end, glad the fairy Eryn didn't say "HEY LISTEN!" with the tutorials she spatted out.

Overall good game and I enjoyed the story.

Tiara is such a waifu <3

Fairy Fencer F is a fun turn based jrpg but is somewhat a hit and miss at parts.

Featuring:
[list]
[*]Lazy food loving Fang & pompous fairy partner Eryn.
[*]Tsundere/Masochist maid like Tiara & loyal fairy partner Cui.
[*]Hot-blooded idiot Galdo & mother figure fairy partner Marissa.
[*]Laid back Fairyologist Harley & master cook fairy partner Bahus.
[*]Mysterious Veteran Pippin & butler like fairy partner Soji.
[*]Cold hearted kill fest Ethel & easygoing spokesperson fairy partner Karin.
[*]Heroic(?) classy Sherman & robot type fairy partner Ryushin.
[*]Extremely stoic Apollonius & serious fairy partner Ceguro.
[*]Handyman Moola loving Lola.
[/list]

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Good Keyboard/Mouse & controller support.
[*]1080p + 60fps.
[*]Good PS3 port.
[*]Multiple stats to upgrade/moves to learn for each characters.
[*]Multiple endings.
[*]New game +.
[*]Japanese VO.
[*]Good amount of jokes.
[*]Good soundtrack.
[/list]

[b]Neutral[/b]
[list]
[*]Fanservice isn't for everyone.
[*]Loses itself a little though the story but catches up towards the end.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]

[*]Fairy designs are hit and miss depending on which one.
[/list]

7/10

The powers of fairize aren't as great as the game made it seems, they barely increase their powers about 1.25x which is hardly anything. Abilities can be build and levels don't really determine if you have a stat increase. STAT Increase (WP) is by a different system like gaining gold to use on your skills. Wish there were a way to chain all three characters with 100% success rate or some other damage magifying abilities. The grinding is tremendous in this game just like any JRPG but its fun and won't leave you bored for long. Maps are used repeatedly throughout the storyline with changed enemies of course. 29626997.review:
Эта игра тоже самое, что и Нептунии, только тут есть и мужские персонажи.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=853581280

Шутка. Игра часть вещей заимствует из Нептуний, а часть добавляет своих. Один разработчик все таки.

Графончик прост, в стиле Непок. 

В наличии 6 основных персонажей и 2 скрытых. 

Боевка идентична Непам, так же выставляем комбо для персонажей, и также можем трансформироваться, но на этот раз не в Богинь) Тут есть прокачка оружия.

Понравилась система влияния на данжи через мечи, которые какие то параметры повышает, а другие понижает(+30% exp и -10% физ. дефа и тп). Очень напоминает “планы” из Нептуний, однако тут их разнообразие гораздо больше.

В озвучке узнаются знакомые голоса и звуки из Нептуний и Агарестов, а они качественные.

Музыка тоже вполне радует слух. Нравится мне, что при трансформации героев изменяется музычка. Но самая классная музыка в Башне Шукессо. Среди музыкантов даже засветился Нобуо Уэмацу, который написал музыку к играм серии Final Fantasy и другим.

В менюшке можно менять внешку одежды и одеть 1 аксессуар. Вот выбор аксессуаров нормальный, а внешек одежки катастрофически мало. Всего 3 на ГГ, при этом 1 дефолтная и 2 DLC. На большинство женских персонажей так вообще 1 дефолтная, 1 DLC и 1 потом можно будет купить в магазинчике.
И это все? Серьезно? После Нептуний это очень печально.

Крутить персонажа в меню можно, но в Нептуниях можно было крутить по гораздо большим направлениям. Почему тут этого нет не ясно. И не удобно то, что при увеличении персонажа нельзя менять внешность. В итоге приходится тыкать туда сюда, чтобы сменить каждую внешку и потом увеличить.

По сравнению с Непами сюжет тут не только комедийный, но нашлось в нем место и драме. И по канонам в наличие несколько концовок, а именно три. И получить их всех легко без всякого гринда “Шары” из Неп.

Игра очень легкая и выбора сложности тут нет. Серьезно даже напрягаться не придется. А если вы не можете вальнуть какого-то босса( такое вообще то бывает в этой игре?), то все решается просто фармом/гриндом. Все враги и боссы закликиваются на изичах. А вот зато среди ачивок разработчики превзошли себя, влепив ачивки на фарм 100лямов голдеца( привет Неп-Неп) и убийство 10 000 врагов(привет FF 8). Это они так сложности добавили или что? Ведь их получить не сложно, а просто муторно и долго.  Кто вообще выдумывает подобные ачивки?!

ДЛС данжей у нас всего 3. И они 1 в 1 как обычные данжи только с врагами более высокого левела. Поэтому смысл в этих данжах только в гриндане для ачив.

Башня Шукесо аналог колизея из Нептунии. Печально, а я ждал огромного данжа башню для фарма и исследования.

В целом неплохая маленькая jrpg-шка с шуточными диалогами и драмой, но слишком простая и однообразная. Однако играется приятно, разработчики явно смогли найти Инь-Янь при создании игры.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=851960714

[b]Моя оценка[/b] 6 из 10, ждем дополненную версию Fairy Fencer F Advent Dark Force, которая принесет больше сюжетных веток и там таки будет выбор сложности!

29154657.review:
"It is like playing one of these animes"
Pensa num Chrono Trigger ou Grandia
Troca quase todos os diálogos por cenas de visual novel.
Dubla todos os diálogos em jap. 
Coloca as batalhas e uma exploração de dungeons em 3d como no sistema de batalha dos dois citados. 

+ detalhes no battle system:
Party tamanho 3. 
Deixa a pessoa movimentar os personagens durante a batalha.
Combos, combos, combos: 9 tipos de arma, cada um com 10+ golpes diferentes que tu equipa no x, y, a   e combina pressionando sem timing para até 3 estágios durante o turno. Com chances de encadear um outro personagem no combo sem gastar o turno desse outro personagem.
Ou usar skills e mágias elementais que acertam mais de um inimigo, e são extremamente vistosas.
Faz cada personagem ter no minimo uma  transformação a la power rangers/digimon/sailor moon. 
Mostra a ordem de ações e permite troca com os membros da reserva a la Final Fantasy X 
Cada personagem ainda tem um comando especial.

A história relativamente clichê mas cheia de pequenas reviravoltas que mantém ela interessante. Mais interessante é que existe um foreshadowing para cada reviravolta na história. O enredo ainda dá um misdirection em algumas cenas. 
Apresenta o protagonista sendo acordado (como todo jrpg) pela personagem "cute/imouto" (como toda vn) só que na cadeia.  Apresenta a heroína principal drogando o protagonista e fugindo.
Brinca com o fato de que existe um harem com 4+1 personagens femininas jogáveis, mas existem 6+1 personagens masculinos. Isso excluindo os npcs recorrentes.

Bonus points:
O elenco, só para citar 3:
O protagonista é o estereótipo do mandrião com os olhos semi cerrados. Ganha um buff ativável que dá 1.5x + dano por abrir os olhos completamente mas gasta "mana" para agir.
O bichinho de pelúcia com um afro e uma espada fincada na própria cabeça. Que age como um nobre tiozão cavalheiro. 
A Kuudere que só fala Satsu "Matar" a la hodor, e a fada traduz para frases mais completas.

O opening e a trilha sonora (Nobuo uematsu).

Minus points:
A versão para ps4 tem mais rotas e opções de customização.
O jogo em si não é grind. Mas conseguir 100% das fadas, quests - principalmente coletar os cristais para as que aumentam o ranking, e obter todas as skills é grind.

29058064.review:
-GAMEPLAY-

> Overall gameplay is close to the Hyperdimension Neptunia specifically Re;birth 1.
> Recommended to be played using a controller.
> Fairy Fencer F is a turn based role playing game.
> Features up to 3 active members in the party.
> Switching of members is allowed during a member's turn.
> "Weapon Boost" system allows players to make adjustments to a character's stats using "Weapon Points(WP)" which can be earned through battles.
> Support characters known as "Fairies" are collectible throughout the game. This support characters can be equipped to your party members and can give them passive skills and stat boosts according to the "Fairy" you equipped to them. Of course, 1 "Fairy" per party member only. They vary from Rank C being the lowest and Rank S being the highest and they can level up to level 10. The number of passive skills they provide and the boosts they give to stats increases as they level up.
> The conditions in the dungeons in Fairy Fencer F can be adjusted using your "Fairies". The system is called "World Shaping" But first, your "Fairies" must first go through the "Godly Revival". A little bit of storytelling. In the lore of Fairy Fencer F, there was once two deities that have fought each other for a long. The Vile God and the Goddess. The two sealed each other using multiple "Furies", which are magical swords that contain "Fairies" and gives the user immense power, and they both are now in a state of a deep slumber. When you enter "Godly Revival", you will see the statues of the two along with the "Furies" stabbed through them. "Godly Revival" allows you to remove this "Furies" from either of them using the "Fairies" you possess. Each "Fury" stabbed in the deities have their own passive skills and conditions for "World Shaping". The "Furies" stabbed through the deities have their own ranks and in order to remove them, you have to use a "Fairy" of the same rank as the "Fury" you wish to remove. 
> In order to change the conditions of a dungeon, you have to stab the "Fury" that went through "Godly Revival" near the dungeon whose condition you want to change. No "Fury" must be near another. The area of effect of the "Fury" increases as they level up. The higher the level your "Furies" have, the better.
> Each party member has their own unique skill called "Special Command". This "Special Commands" does not require SP(or mana in Layman's Terms) in order to use. Some provides additional damage at the cost of using SP per attack you execute. Some allows to take down any foe, except bosses, in one hit.
> Each party member has combos which are set of attacks you can execute in your turn if you used the "Attack" command. This are customizable. The number of attacks in a combo are upgradeable up to 3 through "Weapon Boost".
> Each type of monster in Fairy Fencer F has their own weakness in weapons and luckily, the weapons of your party members can transform to different weapon types according to the attack they do in the combo. When a monster is hit with a weapon that is its weakness, there is a chance that an "Avalanche Attack" may occur. "Avalanche Attack" allows the player to execute the combos of the other active members to one enemy using only the turn of the active member that attacked the monster that triggered the "Avalanche Attack".
> Dungeon crawling is the main play of the game. You get to walk through different dungeons in the map of Fairy Fencer F. Some maps are are simply re-color or re-organized versions of the other maps in the game. Dungeons in the aren't that long so it really wouldn't consume much time for you to walk through them not unless you are grinding or hunting or item collecting.
> Quests are offered in the game. This won't affect the story whether you do them or not. It's a different story if you want to get the achievements. The Quests are offered in "Guillermo's Pub" and this quests have their own ranks from Rank E to Rank S. You start with Quest Rank E and after clearing a few quests of that rank, a promotion quest appears and if you do that, your Quest Rank steps up.
> "Synthesis" is also a system present in Fairy Fencer F that allows the player to craft items and equipments using items that are required. The "Picture Gallery", which presents the artworks, CGs and backgrounds of the game you have previously seen, and "Sound Gallery", which presents the BGMs that you have heard in-game previously, are unlockable through "Synthesis".
> A location called "Shukesoo's Tower" is present in the map of Fairy Fencer F. It is a collection of floors that features their own set of monsters to battle and their own rewards to give. It has 40 floors in the main section and 40 floors in the DLC section. The DLC section features super high leveled monsters which are a challenge to those who are grindy enough to face them. The height of "Shukesoo's Tower" depends on how many "Furies", which is also the same as "Fairies", are stabbed on the map. The more "Furies" stabbed on the map, the more floors will be available in "Shukesoo's Tower".
> The storytelling is done through using visual novel presentation. It also, although rarely, features an in-game animated cutscenes.
> New Game+ carries over all your stats although you have to recollect all your members again and you have to remove the "Furies" again in the "Godly Revival".
> The game has 3 endings. Each of them are relatively easy to get. 

-STORY-

> Once upon a time, a hungry young man named Fang is loitering around a city to find some food. In his search, he discovered a sword that is stabbed on the ground that was said to grant any wish although many have tried to pull it but no one was successful. Out of desperation, he pulled the sword and effortlessly, he removed it from the ground. A Fairy living in the sword named Eryn appeared before him and told Fang that he is now a Fencer for he was able to remove the Fury from the ground and it was now his task to recover the 100 Furies scattered throughout the world. Fang refused and decided to leave Eryn alone. One day, Fang was caught for stealing food and was thrown to jail. After 3 days, Eryn rescued Fang and went out the prison until the guards found him. Eryn powered the Fury and Fang fought the guards and defeated them easily. After the fight, Fang still declines the role as a Fencer until Eryn declares she has no recollection of her memories. Only the task of collecting the Furies to revive the Goddess and her name was all she can remember. Forced by conscience, despite declaring he has none, Fang decided to help Eryn get her memories back as repaying for her rescue. Now, they set on a journey to reclaim the Furies and revive the Goddess and bring peace to the entire world. Of course, they will face hordes of monsters, encounter villains who wish to revive the Vile God, handle a masochistic rich girl, fight an edgy edgelord, resist a hottie fairyologist, fight hunger, hate on a damn pretty boy, contemplate on what the heck is one of their party member for the rest of the game, look for ways for money to get those info of Furies from that cute kid who is obssessed with money, spend hours of level grinding, search google for walkthroughs and guides, do multiple playthroughs, skip everything in New Game+, do everything all over again. BUT! Those things will not stop our heroes from collecting the Furies. Join the Fang Gang in their quest for the Goddess! Stay tuned in FAIRY FENCER F!

-GRAPHICS + PERFORMANCE-

> Graphics are pretty basic. They may not be the most beautiful there is but they fit quite nice in the game.
> The game itself has low requirements in order to be played HOWEVER knowing Idea Factory+Compile Heart, optimization is not good. Fairy Fencer F places the workload on the processor.

-CONCLUSION-

> I am near the character limit of this review.
> Recommend the game? Yes

29048232.review:
Esse jogo é simplesmente excelente!

O sistema de J-RPG dele é um dos melhores que já vi, tem muitas interações interessantes em combate como o "Fairize", que é uma forma de você se fundir com sua Fury, para ganhar um "novo poder"..
A trilha sonora! Esse jogo tem uma trilha sonora excelente! Mesmo hoje, meses depois de eu ter zerado, eu escuto muito algumas delas, elas simplesmente se encaixam perfeitamente na ambientação e no contexto da história!

Sobre a animação, pelos trailers mesmo já da pra ver que é sensacional! Os traços dos personagens são simplesmente maravilhosos!

Sobre o enredo, eu achei ele bem desenvolvido, já que até mesmo chega a contar um pouco da história de background de alguns personagens, sem contar que existem, se não me engano, 3 finais!

E claro, como todo bom fã de RPG, nesse jogo, você consegue fazer um grind maravilhoso até o level 999, isso mesmo 999, através de uma DLC que te permite ir até este nível e te desbloqueia mais 3 regiões para upar!

Sem contar que o jogo possui tanto interno, quanto pela Steam, seus próprios Achievments! E bom, são bem desafiadores e divertidos de se fazer ! xD

Jogo 100% platinado como um grande fã de carteirinha que me tornei desse jogo! 

Super recomendo a todos, não irão, de forma alguma, se arrepender!

28499900.review:
Fairy Fencer F is the typical Idea Factory/Compile Heart JRPG. If you've played any of the main series of Hyperdimension Neptunia games, then you know what this is. I'll give it a recommended rating, but it's a very close call. If you enjoyed the Hyperdimension Neptunia series, then you'll probably like this. If you disliked the Hyperdimension Neptunia series, then this game probably isn't for you, but may be worth it depending on why you disliked Hyperdimension Neptunia. If you never played the other series, then it's really up to you whether or not you want to take a risk on a comedy JRPG with a plot written by a pubescent middle schooler.

Pros:

-Most of the characters don't look like middle school girls, so people won't judge you as much.
-The scenery style and color looks slightly less like cotton candy vomit than in Hyperdimension Neptunia.
-Animations and models look good.
-Voice acting isn't awful.
-Can be run on lower-end machines if you edit the files to remove shadows, or sometimes with no editing at all.
-Additional playthroughs are much quicker, and you can skip cutscenes, so you don't have to dread New Game+.
-All endings can be obtained on one playthrough if you save at the right time.
-Great soundtrack.

Cons:

-It's Hyperdimension Neptunia in traditional JRPG clothing. You know it, I know it, IF knows it, and the people judging your taste in games know it.
-Grinding is necessary to unlock certain characters on the first playthrough.
-Some of the plot and much of the dialog is cringey, but you should expect that at this point.
-Combat is very easy, even on the first playthrough. Even more so if you grinded to unlock certain characters. This follows an apparent trend with JRPGs becoming increasingly easy these days.
-Characters are largely one-dimensional, and all plot-twists are revealed within the first half of the game.
-Battles against bosses and villains is the typical "boss in battle is a giant monster but is human in the field". Many of them are recolors, or appear as regular monsters with a recolor later in the game.

If Steam used a numerical scale, I'd give Fairy Fencer F a 6.5/10. It's not a very long JRPG, and it's certainly far from being the most entertaining or well-written, but it isn't awful and that's saying something in a market that is flooded by cringe-inducing games and television series that operate on the assumption that if it's anime, somebody will buy it.

Fun game with some annoying game designs. Story is not very deep  but satisfactory and characters are mostly likable along with some humorous dialogue. Gameplay is fairy simple but rewarding once you unlock combos for you and your teammates. 

I would warn players not to partake in too many side-quests though. For one, it is easy to get extremely overpowered (especially if you are using dungeon modifiers to increase you experience, gold, etc). Plus the side-quests become unbearably grindy and completely rng based. To make matters worse, to unlock new side quests you need to finish specific 'Important' side quests that require a ridiculous amount of time and luck to forage all the necessary stones. It is seriously some of the worst grind I have seen in a game. You will enjoy the game much more if you ignore those horrible time wasters and stick to the main quest.

28404850.review:
The game wasn't bad, but I give it a cautious recommendation.  If you're looking for smooth difficulty in a JRPG, look elsewhere.  More on that later.

I found the story to be decent, got a few laughs from it and generally enjoyed myself while playing.  Combat is simple, if not a bit easy; you set up combos for your basic attacks(shortly after you start you unlock the ability to exploit weaknesses), use skills/magic, and use a mechanic called Fairize which gives you a boost to your stats, starts a side song, and unlocks a high damage but risky ultimate move.  The cast is not too uncommon for a JRPG, especially if you're familiar with Idea Factory's other games, and whether this is a good or bad thing is up to you.  Art style is not bad, it is the same style that IF uses for their other games(along with how overworld exploration is handled) and mixes JRPG elements with a bit of a VN style for talking.

I give this game a cautious recommendation for a reason though.  While I find it rather solid, there's things that bother me a lot.  The first, and most blatant thing, is how the difficulty is.  Overall I didn't find my journey to be too difficult, and this is including picking up what side Furies(equivalent to a sidequest) I could.  The game is MOSTLY easy, save for several sticking points at seemingly random intervals where the fights are more difficult than anything else in the area(or next area), and that's not even counting area bosses.  Second, a certain major plot point makes it feel like you're playing the same exact stuff again without a change.  Third(this one is more a personal gripe), it felt like the game didn't know where it wanted to go to end until sudden railroad, not as much a buildup other than certain macguffins.  Last, I felt that characters didn't develop as much as I think they should have.

As I've thought more and reflected, I'm going to stick to my guns and give the cautious recommendation.  Will I play it again?  Maybe if I feel like going back to it later, but the postgame stuff doesn't interest me too much.

A história é boa, o personagem principal é diferente do habitual, ao inves de ser aquele cara que quer ser um heroi ou seja lá o que vc ta acostumado, ele não passa de um desmiolado simplista que so pensa em comer e se envolve com a trama do jogo por acidente, com o desenrolar do jogo ele vai lentamente mudando e desejando ajudar por acabar se envolvendo com os outros personagens.

Adorei o sistema de batalha, adorei 90% dos personagens do jogo, todos são bons e usaveis, não tem aquela coisa de um ser tao mega mais forte que o resto que vc se sente obrigado a manter ele na pt, simplesmente use o que vc acha mais massa e pronto.

Em suma, eu gostei tanto desse jogo, que sinceramente coloco ele no mesmo patamar que outros grandes jogos que podem ser achado aqui na steam como os 2 jogos da serie tales, mesmo graficamente sendo inferior.
