18836521.review:
Честно признаюсь, что мало чего ожидал от этой игры. Чего по сути можно ожидать от создателей нептунии? Ну гриндилку с лолотемой и большим наличием гэгов или смешных моментов. 

Был приятно удивлен. Прежде всего в этой игре есть сюжет! И он не так уж плох. Конечно это не шедевральная драмматургия, но на фоне той же нептунии это безумный прогресс в повествовании и  в самой истории в целом. Мы спасаем мир... Да да да, какой там раз уже? Весь сок в том, что главный герой не хочет спасать мир, он хочет пожрать и поспать, спасение этого мира он в гробу видел. Но так уж сложились обстоятельства, что наш главный герой был привязан по сюжету к фее, да причем не простой,а... (хотя если будете играть, то сами поймете по сюжету что в ней такого особенного). Кое как данная фея уговаривает нашего ГГ начать помогать ей под предлогом потери памяти, да и вообще того, что она освободила его из заключения (где он оказался за кражу еды, ну я же говорю, что любит наш ГГ поесть) и за героем должок. По мере развития сюжета ГГ конечно привязывается к своим спутникам и в итоге сам уже не прочь повлиять на мир в лучшую сторону. 

Боевка в принципе не сильно претерпела измения по сравнению с нептунией, но они есть. Основные отличия заключаются в использовании оружий разного типа во время боя и прокачке вашего персонажа и его спутников на своё усмотрение, хотя всё равно в итоге все выучат всё. Вместо формы CPU мы теперь используем Fearyize (что то вроде слияния с феей), что добавляет нам сил в бою и порядочно, усиление вплоть до 4-5 раз. Ну и нет шкалы защиты у монстров, зато есть просто куча здоровья, у некоторых вплоть до 10 полосок хп (привет игровым автоматам 90-х!).

Персонажи достаточно разнообразные и забавные. Мне лично больше всего запомнилась Ethel, которая была молодой убийцей неопределенного возраста и происхождения, однако её склонили на путь добра за печеньки) С ней будет множество забавных сцен.

В целом игра проходится часов за 20 и во время первого прохождения я вообще не гриндил толком. Главное знать как в игре использовать бонусы на экспу и очки для прокачки способностей. В игре три концовки, которые немного отличаются друг от друга, но не то, чтоб очень, романтическим содержанием только по сути, с кем наш ГГ останется в итоге или предпочтет быть вообще один.

В целом достаточно крепкая и на удивление хорошая игра с забавной и местами милой историей, которая однако имеет пару адовых ачивок (любители идеальных игр готовьтесь к куче гринда). 8/10. Ну и всем желающим посмотреть на прогресс по сравнению с нептунией рекомендую.

18716655.review:
Though a bit cliche, Fairy Fencer F has its plus points. If you enjoyed games like Neptunia of Mugen Souls, then you won't need to read reviews to see if it will be worth it. Just watch some gameplay and you'll know if you want to.

The game features a Fairy Link system, giving you more personality in your custimization of your character(s). If you want to have a tank, mage or maybe a strong damage per turn. The only real walking you'll be doing is in dungeons, so you don't have to sidetrack the towns in order to go everywhere before heading out. The final part that the game offers is its "Gods Revival" option. By using existing Fairies you can upgrade them once with a unique ability and World Creation stats used to powerup and powerdown your dungeon experience. These mechanics make for a unique experience, but offers only so much.

But what's [i]good[/i] about the game?
It has some great soundtrack to accompany you through your experience. Every type of dungeon has its own unique BGM and you are welcomed with more than 1 battle track. The game is also easy to understand. The battle mechanic isn't hard to figure out, but unlike Final Fantasy X; which uses the same Turn Order for battles, there is little to take advantage of. The story is lovable and you get to enjoy many faces that develop (sort of) over the course of the game. It also takes advantage of the "cliches" of games. The side events are also very Japanese with their slapstick and airheadness and ecchi.

And what's [i]bad[/i] about the game?
Like mentioned often it suffers from cliches. If you know a bit of gaming you'll be able to foresee certain events. The game also features a cast of 6[spoiler]/7 to 9[/spoiler] playable characters. If you are going for completion you'll use 2 of those at any given time meaning you have 1 spare seat left. The game also suffers from the lack of difficulty. You can get behind big time, but you can train yourself back in the game, but once you get ahead by a lot you'll breeze through the game with little to no difficulty. [spoiler]New Game+ also leaves you with EVERYTHING so it will be even easier.[/spoiler] The game also features a huge world map that won't be used in any way [spoiler]and instead of more dungeons you'll get to play every dungeon twice, thrice or even four times.[/spoiler] The battle music will also get on your nerves since they aren't memorable.
Lastly the biggest flaw for the game is its shortness and cryptic level. If you go for a straight playthrough you can beat it in 15 hours, no problem. If you want to go for 100% you'll have to consult a walkthrough because the game is not going to tell you anything about any unlockable or (hidden) items. [spoiler]The game has a lot of missables and I mean a lot, you'll probably end up playing the game twice or thrice to get everything + the 3 endings.[/spoiler]

By the end if you read it you'll notice more bad things than good things, but that's because bad things stay with you better. I had a good time by the end of the game. The flaws are noticeable and could have been removed, but it's not hindering your experience. All by all I think it's still pretty fun to play. It's not New Game+ worthy though. The final verdict: It's just fun, nothing special but fun.

18690101.review: I'm kind of a hard core RPG player and just like anyone who plays RPGs I always have my skepticisms about a game I pick up. Being an enthusiast about Anime didn't have anything to do with my review. I will say that this game is incredibly detailed. The developement of the characters was meticulously thought through and the interactions of the characters don't change for the sake of story developement. All characters are very different and very in personality. The idea of time and it's affect on the world when the particular sequence appears is actually quite accurate. Any change in a timeline can have the potential to change everything about the time stream that you currently travel which is why I believe it was a well thought out paradigm of the story. With the inclusion of the choice of Good or Evil makes this an interesting blend and includes several even more interesting character interations. Players don't necessarily have to grind to finish the game, but it does certainly help. The idea of overkilling enemies has always been a thing for me and with the DLC added to the game, adds the possibility of total annihilation. Getting certain materials to create new weapons, armor, items, misc. items, and other synthesis materials is difficult but if it were easy then it wouldn't be worth the effort. The synthesis items are much stronger than what you can buy and If you farm the materials then it is worth that much more. I would say to be careful about the boss battles when reviving the God or Goddess. If you have the DLC it is easier than normal, however once you reach a certain rank they will start getting though your armor so don't rely on the DLC to last you the whole game. It wont. Overall I recommend this game to any and all RPG enthusiasts out there even if you don't like Anime. It is a rich story full of spontanious and often hilarious conversations. I enjoy the game and I hope anyone who has just gotten or even just thinking about getting it will too.

18658192.review:
[h1]Fairy Fencer F is a game I spotted the gorgeous cover art for on the Playstation Store many moons ago but never actually got around to playing.[/h1]
[b]Overall[/b]
As I'm sure you've noticed from the plethora of other Steam reviews for Fairy Fencer F, Fairy Fencer F is extremely easy to compare to the other recent Compile Heart/ Idea Factory port, Hyperdimension Neptunia. This is because they are, effectively, much the same game. I didn't actually realise this untill coming to play Fairy Fencer F and only took interest in it due the aforementioned cover art.

I don't believe that Compile Heart/ Idea Factory have too much intention of copy/ pasting their old games, they've just got an engine they like and a design formula that works for them. That and they don't really like to spend effort making many new assets so they use alot of already existing enemies. Further evidence for this belief of mine is Omega Quintet on the PS4, which utilizes a higher version of the engine (or they're pushing it, at least) to make another [i]very[/i] Compile Heart/ Idea Factory game, which again is not as good at Neptunia.

[b]Enough rambling about the devs, on with the show[/b]
Fairy Fencer F is a fun game, certainly not the most fun I've had out of a game, but enough fun for me to play it, complete it  and leave it with happy feelings and no intention to 100% it. 

That being said, I expect achieving 100% in Fairy Fencer F wouldn't be particularly difficult, as there's very little to do in it.

Extremely little, infact, to the point where the midway plot point which originally comes across as a potentially totally awesome bit of story telling starts to feel like a "We were running out of time!" cry of help from the developers, and it's quite a shame, as Fairy Fencer F is qute enjoyable to play.

With almost no post-story content aside from a tower I found completely by accident and grinding the randomised treasure chests in dungeons, there's very little backing the game. I'm not, of course, saying that a game cannot stand on it's own two legs without extra stuff to do, it's just that having extra stuff to do gives it more life, more playability and more things to keep you, as a player, interested. The tower isn't even what it sets itself up to be, it's just a menu with a list of set fights to go through. So yeah, basically, there's nothing post story unless you like luck roll grinding for hats.

[b]So, why is there a man in my Not Neptunia?[/b]
Fang is, bluntly, wicked. He's great, he's brisque, a bit gruff and does what he likes, all the while making a show of being uncaring while actually being a good guy deep down. I guess that makes him a tsundere. I love me some tsunderes. Much of the first chunk of story is Fang pratting about while going on a quest to save First Girl's memories, and "gradually" warming to Second Girl. There is a Third Girl who is by far and away the best, but I'm assuming time cuts didn't give her a look in.

Fang has a mate, as well, who is basically his goofier self in large shorts. There's also another man and potentially his sister that you need to have to NG+ to feasibly get unless you grind all the nothing like a madman.

[b]This music, though[/b]
I'm making a section for this on it's own because the music is fantastic. The opening video music is awesome and much of the actual gameplay music is also fantastic. A quick bit of searching led to the discovery that the music was composed by Nobuo Uematsu, the man who did the Final Fantasy music, among many other brilliant soundtracks. Sadly, halfway through the game the cool battle music is replaced by slightly boring battle music, I can only assume this is to reflect Fang being serious, and the game being boring from this point on for a while, but never mind.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The battle system is a carbon copy of Neptunia 2, as is the dungeoneering and shopping. The only differences lie in the stat bonuses and ability unlocks being reshuffled to the Fairy Upgrade system, which allows for some mild character ability customisation and is fairly cool, and the aesthetics of the game. Visually, it's quite nice. the dungeons tend to be more detailed than that of Neptunia and alot of the tilesets are completely different, making it feel like a different world, which it is.

The story is short. Really short, but could have been brilliant, so I was quite surprised when I realised that, yes, I really was nearing the end of the game, and about to fight the Final Boss For Real, and yes, his head is hilariously tiny (I was crying laughing at him and his tiny head in this serious bit of story).

[b]Conclusion[/b]
You may have noticed that I used the word "potentially" alot, that's because the mix of nothing aside from story, the story being very short at that, Fairy Fencer F comes across as a potentially brilliant game that just didn't have enough time spent on it, which is a massive shame. Furry Fencer F is still a fun game to play, it's just not as fun as it could have been. Fairy Fencer F isn't a bad game, though, it's just not what it could have been. I prepurchased the game for half price (~£11), and that's about how much the game is worth.

Yoshitaka Amano and Nobuo Uematsu seem to be involved (artist and musician for Final Fantasy I-VI), maybe in a more minor way. Still, you can see some of their influences. I'm not sure if the other DLC would be worth it.

これも性癖が絡んでくる上にかなり人を選びますが冒頭のアリンちゃんの「バカー！」には最高に萌えました

・ハーラーさんのおっぱい

・ティアラ様のお嬢様口調

・情報屋が幼女


- 微妙だった所

・難易度が低め
メインイベント一筋で追いかけるぐらいが丁度いいぐらいになってます、寄り道してレベルを上げようものなら一気にヌルゲー化します

・シナリオの尺
ストーリー自体は個人的にとても楽しめましたが、尺が足りなかったのかいきなり幹部級クラスの対峙していきなり血祭りにあげてしまったりと少々急な感じが否めなかった

・戦闘が単調
ほぼスキルや攻撃パターンが固定化してしまうので、序盤はキャラクターの成長などもあってめっちゃくちゃ楽しいですが終盤に向かうにつれてマンネリ化してしまうのがひしひしと感じられた

・FPSが地味に安定しない
フレームレートが可変じゃないのか、エフェクトの処理等で60から1でも下がると一気に30まで落ち込み、戦闘中はそれを何度も繰り返すのでPCにとっては地獄なのかもしれない、ちなみにハイエンドPCには縁のない話である

・会話パート時の戦闘表現の紙芝居感
すごく紙芝居、この辺はカットシーンとかで表現したほうが絶対良かったと思う

・実績が鬼
死にそう。

・グラフィック
PS3からの移植だからね、仕方ないね


結構良くない部分が目立ちますが、それでもストーリーや立ち絵はめちゃくちゃイイので、ブヒゲーとして割り切ればすごく楽しめます

逆に戦闘をメインに楽しみたいという方にはオススメできません、だって正直そこまで(ry


ちなみにPC版は初心者用アイテムDLCとシュケスーの塔DLCがデフォで収録されており、シュケスーの塔は二周目からお見えになれます、やったね


まとめてしまうと、ブヒゲー大好きでおっぱいが好きでお嬢様に罵られるのが好きで幼女prprしたい方[strike]とティアラ様に踏まれたい方[/strike]にオススメできる一品です

18563465.review:
After reading other reviews, I realize that this game could have been amazing if it hadn't been created in Neptunia's shadow. Personally, I didn't care for the HDN games and never got too far into them because the story/characters didn't really interest me.

As for this game, I really loved the characters (except Sherman, more on that later), the artwork is fantastic and it had a nice concept. Even the english VAs aren't too bad though some of the deliveries are poor and the fairies don't have voices in the english option without a workaround. The major downside is the game play.

There's a mechanic in the game where you pull out swords from either the vile god or the goddess using the power of fairys. The furies allow you to obtain abilities and add bonuses to dungeons.

Here's the thing though..Whether or not you pull the furies out of the beings has no impact on the story at all. So the games main mechanic and purpose is basically just pushed off to the side and when you do pull out all the furies you get a wimpy boss that's no different than the end boss.

In fact, If you want any challenge to the game, try not pulling out the furies after the first required to open new dungeons. I had actually skipped the tutorial telling me about world shaping and it didn't occur to me to put more than one fury into the ground until Zepla valley and the only reason I even bothered to at all was for achievement purposes.

That's right. The game is extremely easy if played how it was intended. My first play through was long because I read the story and I ended up playing through two more times because I missed a subevent for a fury piece required to unlock the second to last fairy. These three play through took me at most 30 hrs...So why do I have over 80 hours of play time? Freaking button mashing the last floor of Sudokoos tower while watching tv for the steam achievements.

Yeah. That's right. I did it for the achievements. If I had picked this game up on the PS I wouldn't have cared but seeing those last character achievements locked just bugged me and since I knew I wouldn't be playing this game again I made the dire mistake of saying "what the hell" and deciding to just unlock these useless grindy, boring waste of time achievements.

Now, as for my dislike of Sherman. His role in the story is useless. [Spoiler]He is revealed to be the games main antagonist but he could be replaced by Bernard and the story would've been better. It's revealed that the Vile God's descendants destroyed his family so he attempts to take over the vile Gods powers for..what? It would've been far better if he had joined Fang in his mission to protect Tiara and revive the Goddess. On top of all that, somehow being rid of the vile God for good turned into only resealing him and both God and Goddess end up as they were at the start of the story.[/spoiler]

Overall, if you want to pick up this game, do it from a bargain bin and do it for the story and characters. Nothing else. I got this game when it was on sale for 55% off and I'm glad I did because it's definitely not a 30 USD worthy game.

I really wish this story/concept had been done in a Tales of Series style. I would also love to play these characters again in a better game, perhaps a sequel.

18527539.review:
@gravitationaltim 's review is the best possible review of this game. For better or worse. Read it carefully.

[quote='gravitationaltim']I can't say this is one of the better JRPGs on Steam, given that most JRPG players demand a certain level of depth and character development in their games, but nonetheless I would still recommend it.

It's a very well designed game, in that all the art, animations, menus, and customizations are well polished. Most people that catch me playing it think it looks really cool, and you get that feeling while playing it too. The dialogue is often funny and the characters will even surprise you, but it's still as a whole a kind've hollow experience.

It's easy to become overpowered, the monsters and environments aren't very diverse, the story is pretty generic with no real revelations or challenges, and sometimes the characters seem bored and flippant about everything that going around, not to mention the bad guys aren't very interesting or intimidating. Depth is certainly not the games forte, but I didn't end up minding it too much.

It's actually kind of nice to have nothing invested sometimes, the characters almost seem aware that they're in a silly JRPG and the developers put in plenty of missables/grinding/extras for people hoping for more of a challenge. There's so much fun small stuff packed in, like all 39 of the furies you can collect having something to say about current events, or buffing/debuffing areas to grind more efficiently. Lots of cool ideas with the battle system, even though it mostly doesn't matter since you can blow away anything in the main game after level 40. Even though the characters aren't going to have any complex problems or feelings, they are all colorful and enjoyable, I ended up liking everyone and having a hard time choosing my party.

If you really dig playing RPGs and don't mind a bit of repetivieness and grasping plot points, it's a really fun game. I feel like I've been negative, but I really loved it quite a bit (obviously... my hours)! I stopped playing just to write a positive review, and now I'm getting back to it...[/quote]

18498511.review:
This game is the very definition of a lot of Japanese RPGs since 2005. Mediocre and completely soulless. It's not bad and it's hardly good either. It's average, ordinary, undistinguished, middle-of-the-road, lackluster, forgettable and other synonyms related to second-rate.

Characters are common stereotypes found in many Japanese media directed towards teenagers such as in animes and mangas. Here's some examples:

1) The "hot-blooded but borderline mentally ret-rded" MC.
2) The "cutesy but sometimes annoying" female lead.
3) The "tsundere pseudo-noble lady" rival of female lead to be the best girl.
4) The "one who exist solely as fanservice" supporting female lead.

There are a few more characters but if you're familiar with animes and mangas, then you can guess for yourself what kind of character they are. Don't bother getting attached to them either. All of them are one-dimensional. ALL OF THEM. 

Story is juvenile and uninteresting as it has already been done countless times in other JRPGs. A completely average main character "accidentally" became the hero. He gains the responsibility to save the world by collecting "something" to "free the God(dess)". Main villain appear, so does other unimportant and boring side characters, hero formed a party, went travelling, stuff happens, some "plot-twist" happens, hero got defeated briefly but the power of friendships/love gave the hero strength to defeat the "real" villain and the end. In other words, been-there-done-that. No effort was put in the story at all. I personally lost interest during the middle of the story and pretty much rushed through the ending. Sorry to say it didn't get any better. In fact, it got worst. Oh, can't forget the fanservice. Think of the poor basement-dweller players if we didn't get any fanservice.

Combat system was acceptable, for the first hour at least. After that it's down hill. Despite having a number of different types of combo to execute like in Xenogears (one of my favourite JRPG of all time) and Radiata Stories, most of them became obsolete as players are forced to use only a specific amount of those combo in battles. And no, you can't change them during battles. Meaning you have to use the exact same fighting animation on every battle. Throughout the WHOLE GAME! Magics and skills are useless as normal attacks are more efficient. While you can transform into a stronger form in battle, it gets tedious doing so in every battles. Get use to the skip button 'cause you'll be using it a lot to skip the 10 seconds animation with the super cheezy song every time you transform. 

Look, I could go in detail why I don't recommend this game but that would be a waste of my time. Just trust me on this, if you're expecting a masterpiece with a engaging story, memorable characters and a fun gameplay, look elsewhere. If you're really desperate in playing this mediocrity, at least buy it on sale. Don't waste money paying full price for this.

NOT RECOMMENDED

18486784.review:
Для меня игра стала одним большим плюсом и живительным глотком воздуха в эти серые дни. Fairy Fencer F проходится с большим удовольствием и легкостью. Она увлекательна,  и 40 часов игры пролетают просто незаметно. Тем, кто не любит длинные японские ролевые игры, но любит их в принципе, кто хочет просто расслабится (как я после таких игр, как Record of Agarest War Zero) эта игра отлично подойдет. Без выполнения квестов и прохождения дополнительной башни, так вообще выйдет чуть ли не в 2 раза короче. 

Сюжет трогательный (в игре несколько концовок), музыка выше всяких похвал, персонажи лаконичны, насыщенный боевой процесс и подготовка к нему. В Fairy Fencer F есть все, что необходимо для любой хорошей JRPG.

Так хотелось бы продолжение, но скорее всего анонсированный сиквел станет лишь улучшенной версией данной игры на PS4.

18463523.review:
So. Many. Laughs.

(TL;DR at bottom)

Short summary: This game is phenomenal in so many different ways between its character design, plot progression, and even the reuse of levels (Yes, this is actually a decently done well thing in this game!). Replayability is very high (as long as you have a guide with you, preferably on the first time around so you don't miss stuff set up for the 2nd playthrough). This game is witty, hilarious, fun, and I honestly found myself addicted and wanting to get everything. And I just normally don't do that. So props to the devs.

Breaking it down...

Plot: 9/10
I wanna give it even a 9.5, but when you consider how much further they could've gone, I suppose a fantastic 9 will do. The plot isn't really predictable at all. There are few twists and turns, and the entire thing will have you laughing or crying because feels. From a story driven perspective, amazing.

Combat: 8.5
At first, combat is dull. Grinding WP to upgrade your abilities/versatility can be a bit slow BUT once you pass that hump OHMYGOD IT CAN BE WONDERFUL TO DESTROY CRAP IN THOSE B.A. FAIRIZE THINGS. 

Waifu: 10/10
Just... Yes. I'm not even gonna write anything more.

Dungeon design: 6/10
This is the weakest part of the game tbh. They reuse dungeons and dungeon design for multiple places and it's dull. Despite my low score for this, nearly everything else outshines the reuse of the dungeons. I know I'm giving it a 6, but really I weight this section far lower than the others.

Character design: 10/10
And not just cause of waifus. Each character has their own unique personality and each one is lovable in their own way. Hell, even the shop keeper has a funny personality when you get new sub-events to talk with her.

Music: 10/10
Love that intro. I watch the intro video sometimes Just so I can hear it. Then again you can unlock a music gallery later <3

TL;DR: buy it if you like anime, funnies, and waifus. Also, use a guide so you don't miss stuff (cause you will otherwise).

I feel like if you're not browsing around the ONE town you can visit (and you don't navigate through the town, it's just a menu you browse through), then you're just making your way to the next dialogue event that you have no control over. 

Combat===
The combat seemed interesting at first, but as I started unlocking abilities, I noticed the only significant levelling up you really do is in the passive stat boosts. Skills seem lackluster compared to the basic combos you perform that have a chance to "avalanche" causing all of your other characters to attack as well. Buffs and debuffs feel like a waste of time to me except maybe on the longer battles. I noticed no difference in buffing a character's speed.

When walking around the world, you can try to engage an enemy with a Symbol Attack, but it gives you no advantage over just walking into them. You are guaranteed the first turn if successful (which you really get anyways so long as they don't successfully land an ambush on you - you can permanently negate all ambushes just by getting a passive). The only incentive to doing Symbol Attacks is the associated achievement that gives you permanent stats.

Crafting===
There isn't much to say about this. You make basic items that the shop eventually unlocks for you. There isn't much of an incentive to crafting. 

Money===
Once you unlock the Tower of Shukesoo (sp?) money is no longer a factor. You can repeatedly do floors for the massive gold/consumables/materials. You also start every fight with 100% HP and SP. This makes setting up a script on your keyboard to farm while you're asleep a little too easy (literally just repeating Up arrow and Enter). By the time you wake up, you'll have all the money you'll ever need, and enough WP to pick up all important skills. 

Loot===
Almost non-existent. I'm a completionist, so i like to check every nook and cranny for loot. 99% of the little loot stars (or whatever you call them - their equivalent of chests) provided consumables that I could just buy from the shop. There was never a piece of armor or an accessory hidden away that I couldn't just buy in the shop. There is no point going beyond the linear path.

Exploration===
Non-existent. As stated above, there is no loot worth getting, and no paths that lead to anything interesting. It's nothing but an accumulation of dead ends, and next zones. During your travels, every zone has exactly 1 return path, and 1 progression path. Every map is also given to you, which is readily at your fingertips. There is nothing that can cause you to take a dead end path except your own curiosity, which they do not reward. This game is the very definition of linear. 

Progression/Consistency===
As I progressed through the game, it seemed like they threw a lot of the comic relief and good character development out the window. Everybody just became buddy buddy, there was no internal conflict, and no character retained anything that made them interesting during their introduction. This bothered me the most. 

Overall===
There is a lot more about the game that bothered me, but I'm already bored of writing this. I loved the characters at first, but it felt like they stopped trying halfway through the game. I also feel like a lot of the game aspect was a bit ill-conceived. I would recommend this game on sale if you're bored, but not at full price.

18417077.review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Fairy Fencer F[/b][/h1] (Read on for the full review!)
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
While many find this JRPG to be on the easy side, it is still fun and varied, with an engaging combat system and a refreshingly good sense of progression.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+The Main: While the cliche "Just let me sleep/eat!" type, I am so glad he isn't an unsufferable whiny baby that never takes initiative. He isn't afraid to tell people off and doesn't opt into heroic deeds mindlessly.
+Combat: There is a wide variety of spells and skills, and the combo system is great.
+Art: The character portraits are varied, distinct, and well constructed.
+UI: It might not be the most minimal UI, but it is well thought out, looks nice, and has a lot of options for easy navigation (excluding page up/page down requirement.)
+Sound: Satisfying navigation sounds...and...come on, that music though.
+Dynamic: There are ways to change the difficulty, types of mobs, and rewards you encounter.
+Progression: Every levelup really feels like it makes you better, and there are so many things you can upgrade and level.
+Convenience: You can skip animations and dialogue with ease!
+Save Slots: Thankfully, as is standard, there are plenty to use.
+Settings: Plenty to mess around with.
+Tutorial: While at first a bit obtrusive in the "Try walking to walk!" sense, it is actually very comprehensive, and you will have zero holes in your knowledge of how to play. This also makes the game EXTREMELY kid friendly.

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1][b] I wish to state these are minor, except the last two.[/b]
-Story: Relatively generic, but it does have its good points.
-Dialogue: Tropes and lack of inspiration abounds. However, I like the references, and I think some of it is meant to be in the spirit of parody.
-Camera: It sort of moves on its own...slowly, and you can move it yourself...slowly.
-Performance: This is a VERY minor con, but there are ocassional slowdowns when loading an area, and expect to potentially wait a bit if you tab out of the game.
-Strategy: Or the lack thereof. Unfortunately resistances, normal attacks, and weaknesses are not differentiated enough to make you REALLY hurt if you don't plan, and often party positioning is of very little significance.
-Fodder: The regular mobs quickly become walking goodies and experience that pose little threat. As you progress, most of the bosses will also enter this category.

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/- While the level design in terms of art can be fairly varied, unfortunately, many assets or whole levels are recycled. So I'm a bit mixed on this one.
+/- Fanservice: While almost always tame (excluding harley...) it does exist.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]

Welcome to Fairy Fencer F...yep, that's a name! In Fairy Fencer F, the big bad and the big good fought a long battle ages ago and both were sealed as a result. In this world, the divine weapons they fought with/used to seal each other are called Furies, and are essentially inhabited by/an alternate form of Fairies. Those who wield the Furies and collect the Fairies to attempt to unseal the Goddess or Vile God are called Fencers.You play a Fencer called Fang, who likes Food.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]

In Fairy Fencer F, scenes and towns act like menus in a visual novel, while the overworld map is a literal map with interest points you can visit. Upon entering one of these areas, you can move freely. In battle, each character can move within a certain circumferance each turn, and you can select skills/magic from an easily accessible menu, or just hit enter to attack it normally. You can also use the menu for special abilities and to select items.

While the story is, broadly speaking, cliche, I like a lot of its finer points. An easy example is that while black force and white force waged war and both fell, it is up to you to do the work to unseal them, you get to choose who, and you get a share of the power from extracting the weapons sealing them. Likewise, the game allows a lot of variety in dungeons through "World Shaping," a feature that lets you alter the properties of the dungeons such as exp/item rewards, the mobs themselves, or outright give yourself certain buff/debuffs.

Combat is relatively fun, and the combo system makes it unexpectedly engaging. The downside to combat, however, is the almost complete lack of strategy required. You'll probably always win no matter what you do.

[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1]

So the graphics are a mixed bag. They're good...in a way. The art can have a lot of variety, and this includes the level design art, but the levels themselves can be outright rehashes if not just using rehashed assets. I think the UI is overall nicely done, but some of the elements could be a bit sharper or have a bit less/more going on. The character art is pretty great, actually, but...you won't see much animation. This is pretty much the common trend. "Nice enough...but."

I think that even with all of its faults considered, the graphics really are entirely fine, its just that in comparison to modern games it could use a facelift/seems dated. An easy example would be how much this game would benefit from better/higher res textures in the dungeons. Are they horrible? No, they look decent, just not good, and the quality itself is lacking...blurry/etc.

[h1][b]Audio[/b][/h1]

The audio in Fairy Fencer F has far fewer counterpoints than everything else. The music can be quite nice, as background ambience or high-octane bloodpumpers, but you're going to get a bit tired of hearing some things repeatedly. I find, unlike many games, that the menu sound hits the sweet spot between pleasant and assertive.

While I quickly switched from English to Japanese, I didn't find the voice acting to be especially bad in the English, but the voices themselves kind of took away from the experience for me. On the other hand, the Japanese voice acting was better than expected. The voices suit the characters, the timing, and the emotions seemed synced to where they should be in delivery. 

Overall the sound is good when you notice it, unobtrusive when you don't. I did have ONE issue with it: there is a very jarring popping sound that randomly occurs.

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b][/h1]

This is a fairly solid JRPG, great for a dive into a new world, and good for fans of the genre, but not for those who really want to be challenged. If you like easy or story-based games, or even just having a little fun while unlocking/collecting things, this is a good choice. Great as a genre introduction or for young kids.

I will repeat: If you want to be challenged (Dark Souls, SMT, Mother, Valkyria Chronicles, etc.) you should definitely look elsewhere. Otherwise...I think it is worth the full price.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

18401821.review:
I grew up on the old classic JRPG games ( Legend of Dragoon, Breath of fire, Star ocean ) and since the ps2 era I have been looking for decent RPG games as they seem as rare as unicorns these days.

I bought this game on a whim, was on sale and I just recently been watching alot of anime again and decided "Why not?"

Very happy I did, really brought back some memories for me, the classic turn base combat with over the top moves that have cut scenes. The classic hero line ups ( hotheaded boy, cute girl, geek girl etc ) and just that lighthearted playstyle that puts a smile on your face. 

The music in this game shocked me also, I really loved the music in this game!..and not just the battle music too or the transform epic rock music thats voiced. but the back ground music of the game areas have a really good sound too and some voiced in japanese. really makes you enjoy just walking around or just grinding more.

The story of the game overall is ok, not amazing in truth. I did play it in English so maybe it did not get its full Japanese justice to the story as it was intended, and the game is not very long. But it has very good endgame content and choices/secret options in the game that changes the whole story ( such as in a second playthrough you get a playable guy I never got in first playthrough etc ) so there is replayablity.

I would 100% recommend this game to any JRPG fan or anime fan overall. I really enjoyed it myself.

18400743.review:
优点：
剧情比海王星强些，当然也只是强些的程度，毕竟海王星主要靠玩梗和吐槽。
提亚拉的人设我颇为喜欢。（我一直觉得RPG的人设优先级是高于剧情的）
东山大法好。
建模比海王星精致不少，确实有一点1080P的感觉了，战斗中变身后的几首歌挺有感觉。
游戏中的一些设计比较有新意。插剑改变地图的设计看起来很酷（但是实际上比式样书要麻烦不少）。另外积累点数升级能力的方式是我认为rpg中比较优秀的一种设计，因为可以让玩家自己定制升级路线和思考策略。
按键的图示终于改成了键盘图示，而不是海王星中的手柄图示，这样基本上不会发生按错键的情况。
缺点：
首先一上手给人的感觉是很糟心的。地雷社之前出过海王星，如果说海王星PC的按键设置还算凑合的话。我不知道这一作的默认按键怎么设置成这个样子，和海王星完全不同，简直反人类，跳跃是back键，武器连段的几个键和原来完全不同，而且是分开的，难道一个公司的作品不该把按键设计传承下来么。
然后是技能，数量少的惊人，不知道是不是我才玩了20多小时的原因，这上面的一种武器就对应一个技能，当然，精简一些技能，删掉一些无用的东西确实是有好处，但是我觉得这个游戏做的有些过头。至少一种武器应该留两个技能。还有我不知道这游戏-45%血量的大招的存在意义在哪里，是为了刷里面那个残血存活的挑战么，还是为了刷连击数。还有变身的时候非常羞耻，恩，真的很羞耻。
系统有些变化，但是大部分内容和海王星无异，但是恶心的地方是变本加厉了。首先是这游戏升级奇慢，根本不像海王星里面出式样书之后隐藏boss超高的经验值，搞得我现在觉得那个99等级的成就都遥遥无期。素材的出率也是比较玄学，我为了个狂风石连续跑了五次居然隐藏宝物一个都没出，当然可能是我脸黑。而且原来的成就1e金由历史获得，变成持有金，我简直想呵呵。总之厂商的意图非常明显，就是更加变本加厉的让你刷刷刷，消磨你的时间。我真是不知道厂商哪里来的自信让一个玩家玩50小时以上回合制游戏的。海王星重生2这个方向的趋势已经非常明显了，但是我想说，没有任何新要素吸引我去多周目，而单纯为了信仰和成就去一遍遍打通游戏实在是一种折磨，也是游戏设计的失败。

总的来说，当你不刷成就的时候，我觉得它是中规中矩的作品。刷成就的时候，它是粪作。
购买建议是，如果是经常经受rpg大作洗礼的非全成就党，可以买来玩玩，会有种很清新的感觉。
为了防止被日呆打死，给好评。

18397196.review:
เกริ่นนำ 
Fairy fencer F เป็นเกมแนว RPG ที่ปนแอ็คชั่นนิด ๆ ที่มีให้ได้กดกัน ซึ่งเนื้อเรื่องนั้นเกี่ยวกับการออกเดินทางของตัวเอก แฟงก์ เพื่อตามหาภูตที่จะแฝงตัวอยู่ในอาวุธที่เรียกว่า “ฟิวรี่” ที่มีหน้าที่ในการปลดผนึกให้กับเทพธิดาที่ได้ต่อสู้กับเทพแห่งความชั่วร้ายจนต้องถูกผนึกไปด้วยกันทั้งคู่ ซึ่งผู้ที่สามารถปลดผนึกให้กับเทพธิดาได้จะได้รับพร 1 ข้อที่ไม่ว่าอะไรก็ทำให้เกิดขึ้นมาได้ โดยตัวเอกสุดหล่อของเราก็มีความต้องการอย่างหนึ่งคือ “ขอให้มีข้าวกินฟรีไปตลอดชีวิตนั่นเอง” การออกเดินทางด้วยความคิดสุดกวนนี้จึงได้เริ่มต้นขึ้น!!                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
การดำเนินไปของเกม 
ตัวเกมนั้นจะแบ่งออกเป็น 2 ช่วง หลัก ๆ ด้วยกันคือการพูดคุยเพื่อให้เกิดเหตุการณ์และการตะลุยดันเจี้ยน ซึ่งในส่วนแรกนั้นเราจะต้องทำการหาข้อมูลเกี่ยวกับฟิวรี่จาก “โรโร่” ผู้เป็นนักค้าข่าว โดยทุกครั้งนั้นจำต้องแลกมาด้วยเงินทองนั่นเอง ซึ่งตรงนี้จะเป็นการดำเนินเรื่องหลัก แต่ก็ยังมีเนื้อเรื่องเสริมอยู่ด้วย เช่นกันพูดคุยกับแต่ละตัวละครและการรับภารกิจจากมาสเตอร์ในร้านเหล้า ซึ่งหลังจากที่เรารับรายละเอียดของฟิวรี่มาแล้ว ก็จะเข้าสู่ช่วงของการตะลุยดันเจี้ยน ที่เป็นพื้นที่ไม่กว้างมากแต่ก็อาจจะมีอยู่หลายแผนที่บ้างตามแต่ละสถานที่ ที่จุดสุดท้ายนั้นเราก็จะพบกับ ฟิวรี่ และการต่อสู้กับบอสเพื่อให้ได้มา ซึ่งหลังจากที่ได้มาแล้วเราสามารถนำมาปลดผนึกให้กับเทพธิดา หรือ เทพแห่งความชั่วร้ายก็ได้นะ เอาล่ะสิ แล้วจะเลือกทางไหนดีละทีนี้!! 


ระบบของเกม 
พูดจริง ๆ ว่าเกมนี้มีระบบของตัวเองอยู่เยอะ จนต้องมีการสอนกันเกือบตลอดเลย เล่นแรก ๆ อาจมึนงงได้ ซึ่งจะมีทั้งการพัฒนาตัวละครที่มีอยู่หลายทางมาก ทั้งค่าพลัง ,ท่าการโจมตี ,เวทย์มนตร์และถ้าที่จะใช้เป็นการทำคอมโบของเราในแต่ละอาวุธ เรียกว่าอัพกันได้ไม่เบื่อเลยล่ะ ยังไม่พอ ตัวเกมยังมี Challenge ให้เราทำระหว่างตะลุยในดันเจี้ยนที่ส่งผลต่อค่าพลังด้วย ในการต่อสู้นั้นจะเหมือนกับอยู่ในห้องขนาดหนึ่งที่สามารถเดินไปมาได้ โดยเราต้องควบคุมระยะการเคลื่อนที่และขอบเขตการปล่อยท่าให้โดนศัตรูให้ดี ซึ่งสิ่งที่น่าจะโดดเด่นสำหรับเกมนี้คือ การรวมร่างกับฟิวรี่ของเราเพื่อทำให้ตัวเราเก่งขึ้นชั่วขณะนั่นเอง เพียงคุณกล่าวคำว่า “แฟอะไรซ์” เท่านั้นเอง (แฟอะไรส์ ไม่ได้นะ ภูตในเกมฝากบอกมา หะๆ)             

ข้อดี 
-ระบบของตัวเกมมีอิสระในการอัพค่าพลัง ไม่ได้เก่งแบบตายตัว ทั้งยังมี Challenge ให้ทำ ทำให้ผู้เล่นสนุกไปได้ตลอด 
-เพลงประกอบการต่อสู้เร้าใจ บอสก็บอส ศัตรูทั่วไปก็ยังฟังได้แบบไม่มีชวนง่วง รวมไปถึงเพลงในส่วนอื่น ๆ ก็ดีด้วย 
-มุขตลกระหว่างดำเนินเรื่องมีอยู่มากมายและตัวเกมมีการดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องที่ดี 

ข้อเสีย

虽然有当年三公主的游戏体验，同时购买了所有DLC，所以节省了不少时间，到三周目也就35小时左右，感觉还是挺速度的。
       如果拿以前同系列比较，这作游戏已经越来越向着宅系发展了，剧情相对简单，没有以前游戏的剧情深度，也可能是为了适应现在的快节奏生活吧！
       游戏系统不算复杂，很快就能熟悉，妖精搭配合理后，越到后期越能体会到斩瓜切菜的爽快感。想全成就制霸，必须三周目，但总感觉是被厂商牵着鼻子走，毕竟如果没有DLC，三周目除了达成全成就，没有任何隐藏要素可以深挖，也就没啥动力能玩下去，这是厂商需要检讨的。当然了，如果买了DLC的三个练级塔，配上练级妖精，对于那些练级狂人来说还是挺过瘾的，毕竟999级还是需要战上几十个小时的。
       用了10个小时疯狂升到999级，都快刷疯了，刷级前当然要把两把S级精灵都入手，增加效率。DLC中包括三个练级场所，第一个场景可以刷到450级，第二个场景因为敌人分散，而且数量少，效率骤降，可以考虑刷到650级，然后直接冲第三个场景，从800级的敌人练手，期间大型敌人还是等到等级到了750再刷，提前刷必须先制攻击，不然很有可能全灭，到了800J，可以同场景插剑变换高等级敌人，还是拿小敌人入手，很快就能到999。但是别以为999级就是终点，其实1亿铜板的成就才是“不可能完成的任务”，我刷到999级，铜板才6700万，实在是刷不动了，整个过程太枯燥，唯独这一个成就开金手指搞定，哎，万恶的Compile Heart公司，这个成就设置是最无聊的。
       对于那些喜欢看剧情的玩家来说，这一作游戏强烈不推荐，想玩正统日系RPG，还是去玩其他游戏吧！

18334712.review:
The Good
- Excellent engine performance.  Solid 60 FPS at 1080p and not buggy.  Other than a little stutter on enemy load on level entry, it's flawless.  Other companies should strive to port games like this.
- Visually beautiful.  Characters, outfits, effects, it’s all really nice to look at.
- Character and skill advancement system has a good ‘hook’ to it to keep interesting.
- Music is wonderful.

The Bad
- Character personalities are extremely 1-dimensional.  There are no characters that I even remotely care for as they are cliché incarnate.
- Level designs are completely uninspired, and at no point do I feel like I’m exploring.  Enemy and item placements make no sense.
- Story is simple and boring.  There’s no sense of tension, which is likely due to the uninteresting characters.
- Combat gets ‘old’ in that it’s a bit grindy.  Battles are solved with generally the same strategy every time, fairize meter resets, and enemy formations are not varied enough.

It reminded me a lot of the Neptunia series.  So, if that’s a series you’d like, you’ll probably like this one.  I'm just sorry to say that it's not for me.  I don't think it's terrible, but it's just below "interested to play it".  Better character depth or interesting level design would be enough to push it over the line.

Not challenging with simple mechanics.
Doesn't overwhelm the player with complex systems and parameters.

No full 3d world map to explore and no towns to walk around.

18273814.review:
If you've ever played any of the Hyperdimension Neptunia games, you already know what to expect. You can skip reading this and pick it up as you will fit right into Fairy Fencer F.

Fairy Fencer F ditches the futuristic feel of the Hyperdimension games and returns to the more traditional scene. Countryside with shopkeeps and all kinds of taverns. It feels very Atelier-esque. Basically, Hyperdimension Neptunia, but set in the scenery of Atelier Rorona/Atelier Totori.

You play as Fang, a [spoiler]male[/spoiler] main character and meet [strike]Nep-Nep in red hair and wings[/strike] Eryn, a fairy that inhabits a weapon. Together you must find 100 other fairies to revive the Goddess and stop the Vile God from destroying the world

...you know, standard JRPG stuff.


While I joke about Fairy Fencer F being Hyperdimension Neptunia in a different setting, FFF actually does a good job in separating itself from HN. Sure there are Nep references here and there (Pudding!) but on the whole, FFF really does feel like it's own universe. 

If anything, the game sort of feels too short. It's about half of Hyperdimension Neptunia. Half the party members, half the dungeons, half the items and half the length to beat a playthrough. 

One thing FFF beats Neptunia over though, is a fully fleshed out combo system for attacks. While Special Attacks are rather limited (Each Character has around ~5 of these) the standard attacks can be combo'd with an insane amount of styles. Your weapon will automatically shift from a sword, to a gun, to a scythe or arrow depending on how you set up your chain attacks. Also, the EXE gauge returns in the form of "Fairize". Build up the gauge and Fairize to do double the damage.

Another thing that FFF does uniquely, is the Fairies themselves. I really liked this. You can assign any fairy you have to any of your party members, and each Fairy has different stats to boost the character with. Equip a Fairy that gives you bonus Fire damage to a member who specializes in Fire attacks to do insane damage. 

I wish there were more fairies though -- the game says you have to find 100 fairies to revive the goddess, yet I believe there are only around ~45 fairies you can actually obtain. They all range from badass dragons and monsters to cutesy fox girls and buff tough-talking dudes. They each have their own charm (they are all fully voiced too!) and I just loved collecting all of these different kinds of fairies.

I would have liked to of had an option to take fairies from defeated foes. Several enemies and baddies had some very fantastic and cute looking fairies that I would of liked to add to my roster instead of them just dying. Yeah sure the dude is dead, but I can take his cute fairy and make her my companion can't I? ;_;

I hope Fairy Fencer F gets a sequel. I'd love to play another one. It has it's own unique charm that's different from Hyperdimension Neptunia.  Heck, you know what would be even greater? A Hyperdimension Neptunia x Fairy Fencer F crossover. YES PLEASE.

[spoiler]Eryn best girl.[/spoiler]

18152759.review:
原題『フェアリーフェンサーエフ』
コンパイルハート製作のPS3ゲーのPC移植版。おま国。
ガラパゴスRPGなる、ニッチな層を狙ったJRPGシリーズの第一弾らしい。
[strike]あれ？それっていつものIFゲーじゃ・・・[/strike]

ネプテューヌシリーズと同じスタッフが作っているらしく、
基本システムはほぼネプテューヌからの流用。なのでネプに慣れてる人ならすんなり入り込めるかと。
イラストもネプシリーズと同じつなこ氏によるもの。つまり可愛い。

シナリオ面においてはネプシリーズと全く方向性が違い、
男性キャラの比率が多い・人がバタバタ死ぬなど話が結構重い・恋愛要素ありといった具合なので、
可愛い女の子がキャッキャウフフしてるのを期待してプレイすると裏切られる。
個人的にはシナリオ（特に中盤以降）はなかなか良かったと思うが、
尺が足りなかったのか展開が色々と早過ぎるのが難点。
敵の幹部級キャラが何の意味もないところであっさり退場したり。回収されない伏線も多数。

難易度はかなり低いので、IFゲー初心者でも問題なくプレイできるかと。
また、スキップ機能がかなり優秀で、イベントはもちろん戦闘演出やリザルト画面等ありとあらゆる演出をスキップできるので、
周回プレイもかなりテンポよく進めていくことが出来る。
ニッチな層狙いと喧伝してる割にはかなりライトユーザー向けなゲームという印象。

ただし、実績解除だけは苦行すぎて心折れた。
非常に入手が面倒な隠し妖聖、条件がわかりづらい上に時期限定のイベントをこなさないと仲間にできない隠しキャラなどはまだいいが、
特にひどいのはネプシリーズでおなじみの1億G稼ぐとかいう実績。あっちに比べて入手できる金が圧倒的に少ない。
3周クリアしても60万くらいしか稼げてなかったのを見てやる気が一気になくなりました。

まあやりこみは別にするとして、普通にプレイするぶんにはかなりプレイのしやすいRPG。
1周にかかる時間もそれほど長くないので、気軽にプレイ出来るのは良いと思います。
シナリオは結構好みが分かれるかな・・・

18097381.review:
If you're a gamer that is into the JRPG genre, turn-based battling, visual novels, beautifully drawn anime and background art and hours on end of quests, leveling, skill customization and fairies then Fairy Fencer F is for you. I can't remember the last time I power played an RPG as thoroughly as this one. 

I have gone through two playthroughs already and going for a third to get my last ending. Japanese and English voice acticing are amazingly done, though if you choose to hear the game in Japanese you will be treated to some extra voiced content when viewing some Sub-Events back in town. While the game is not punishingly difficult and never posing much of a challenge with the main storyline, there is a degree of challenge present in the sidequests to keep things from being a boring button masher. 

Word of advice to completionists not wanting to miss anything on their first playthrough, upon entering a new dungeon and viewing the cutscene, leave immediately and go back to town and accept Lola's quests as they are time sensitive. Try to fight every enemy you see at least once, inspect the maps throroughly to look out for diamonds containing possibly missable loot and obtain the Item Sonar ability as soon as you can. 

Overall I recommend this game highly to any JRPG fan that is into a good story filled with likeable characters with a great balance of drama, action and comedy.

18079755.review:
I can't say this is one of the better JRPGs on Steam, given that most JRPG players demand a certain level of depth and character development in their games, but nonetheless I would still recommend it.

It's a very well designed game, in that all the art, animations, menus, and customizations are well polished. Most people that catch me playing it think it looks really cool, and you get that feeling while playing it too. The dialogue is often funny and the characters will even surprise you, but it's still as a whole a kind've hollow experience.

It's easy to become overpowered, the monsters and environments aren't very diverse, the story is pretty generic with no real revelations or challenges, and sometimes the characters seem bored and flippant about everything that going around, not to mention the bad guys aren't very interesting or intimidating. Depth is certainly not the games forte, but I didn't end up minding it too much.

It's actually kind of nice to have nothing invested sometimes, the characters almost seem aware that they're in a silly JRPG and the developers put in plenty of missables/grinding/extras for people hoping for more of a challenge. There's so much fun small stuff packed in, like all 39 of the furies you can collect having something to say about current events, or buffing/debuffing areas to grind more efficiently. Lots of cool ideas with the battle system, even though it mostly doesn't matter since you can blow away anything in the main game after level 40. Even though the characters aren't going to have any complex problems or feelings, they are all colorful and enjoyable, I ended up liking everyone and having a hard time choosing my party.

If you really dig playing RPGs and don't mind a bit of repetivieness and grasping plot points, it's a really fun game. I feel like I've been negative, but I really loved it quite a bit (obviously... my hours)! I stopped playing just to write a positive review, and now I'm getting back to it...

18073792.review:
The essential question here is "do you like fairies"? Exactly! What's not to like?
That's why I easily can recommend this game for everybody. You can stop reading here and go play a game. Want to know more? keep reading

The game has fairy simple and straightforward story, the battle between good and evil, it's not particularly interesting but passable. Characters are not bad, even though some of them have seelie habits.

But most importantly a game is fun to play. How fun? In sprite of being very combat heavy it doesn't feel like it, mostly because dungeons aren't big and manageable in one sit.

Enough puns, let's get serious.
Onto combat itself. All characters have skills (unique to character), magic, physical attacks of different weapons styles and one special skill which can be used in fairisied form. All of those have range, hit count and power. String of attacks until you are hit by enemy is a combo of course and you'll get that tingly feeling all over after launching a good one, also you can trigger avalanche attacks and do aerial combos. All this makes combat varied and fun.

There is a slight balance issue, though. A game is supposed to be played at least twice, first time around it feels like you are underleveled most of the time, the second time that you are too powerful already. It could have been easily avoided by having normal and hard modes, imo. On the bright side, it being as it is, makes all playthroughs after the first one really fast.

And not so good part: some of those ingame challenges and some achievements are mean, unfair and unnecessary time consuming.

18066114.review:
This reveiew is based on one playthrough of the game.  Considering the achievements (of which many are rediculous), the game is expected to be played through multiple times (NG+).  

FYI : TLDR at the bottom.

[b]Storyline - 8/10 - [/b]Actually has a clearly explained plot line.  Some plot twists and variation of character. Very comedic.

[b]Character Development - 7/10 -[/b] The intereactions b/t characters is fun, energetic, and sometimes realistic.  Very few of the character's personalities evolve.

[b]Gaemplay - 6.5/10 -[/b] The bar for the difficulty lvl is set way to low.  It's not in the least bit hard.  I expected at least some challenge.  I'm not counting the lvl req'd DLC dungeons(which aren't plot related and aren't req'd to be completed or even played at all), that's a cop-out.  

At least fairies could be used to modify the stats of any given dungeon.  So if you just wanted things to be hard, you could make it so no spells/ablilties can be used, chars take dbl dmg, have reduced resistances, can't cure debuffs, etc.  On the flipside, +% exp/gold/WP/stats/droprate.  Most faires gave both a (+) & a (-).  Still didn't improve overall game difficulty.

Battles are easy to learn, manage, and fun to watch. Quickly becomes repetitive. 

Equipment was too easy to come by to bother making it with mats. Level growth was automatic boosts to all stats, and the only variation is via equipped Fairy and Weapon Points (WP).  Don't get me started on the player specific abilities, that is a sordid story rife with complaints.

On the plus side WP had a good deal of variation, but alot of the magic/weapon attacks seemed either useless or overtly interchangeable with 2-3 others.  Why would I want to use magic to cure a debuff if there is an item for it?   Nothing in the game denies the use of items.  Granted AoE dispell of all debuffs was nice, but characters were only ever afflicted with one at any given time.  Not mentioning most were temporary or lacked any sort impact on the battle.

It was fun to make a bunch of items I'd never need or use, though. (Max Elixirs, the AoE HP pots, etc)

Some people complain about the AoE targeting sensitivity being too high, but these people are just lazy. This is easily remedied by rotating the camera.

[b]Game Stability and Hardware Req'd - 9/10 - [/b] Game has low hardware requirements but remains nice to look at.  Art style and quality gel together well.  Objects in the world look like they belong and doesn't have any obvious/jarring visual errors.  

Loses a point for poor dungeon initialization programming.  Major FPS drops everytime a new dungeon is loaded, due to all the mobs being spawned simultaneously.  Major programming bug that should have been fixed prior to port.

[b]Voice Acting and Music - 9/10 - [/b]To my surprise, the english voice acting was superb.  I'll probably play through the game again with the original voices to see how it compares, but not anytime soon.

Music was enjoyable for the first 10hrs or so. By then you've heard almost 80% of the music you'll hear all game and they're just on repeat.  Was nice that one of the battle specific songs was swapped out halfway through.  It was seriously grinding on my nerves, by then.

[b]TLDR[/b]

Overall, I enjoyed the game.  The characters were entertaing to watch and the plot held together.   NOT worth $30.  I'd consider it to be worth $20.  

I still recommend it for the story and characters.  It was fun to play through and I will prolly play NG+ one time through just to see what it's like and what changes. 

[b]Note:[/b]  Despite seeing alot of reviews referencing the Neptunia series, I've only played a few hours of Rebirth and hated it.  There are similarities in gameplay, but the story here isn't a bland piece of s*** built solely for comedic effect and wrought with plotholes.  I do give kudos to the Neptunia series for actually presenting me with at least some gameplay challenges, though.

18013259.review:
[h1][b]OUI, mais...[/b][/h1]

Fairy Fencer est un bon JRPG qui ne manque pas d'atouts. 

Son système de combat est intéressant et tactique, sont histoire bien que très banal est compensé par une galerie de personnages certes cliché mais sympathique, soutenue par une ambiance Shonen plutôt rafraîchissante et le côté visual novel est doté d'un doublage de qualité. Pour la musique, les thèmes mettent bien dans l'ambiance et sont épiques quand il le faut. 

Oui mais voilà, si la première partie du jeu est très agréable, la deuxième laisse plutôt perplexe. En effet, dans celle-ci de par un truchement scénaristique, nous oblige a un New Game + déguisé avec une revisite des niveaux et du swap colors dégueulasse...  ont se dit alors, hum plusieurs options ici. Soit les devs ont dû couper court faute de budget, du genre : bon les mecs ont à même plus de quoi acheter du PQ, soit la deadline imposée aux devs était ignoble ou encore : bon on y va "Yolo" les gars maintenant...

Fairy Fencer passe donc d'un statut de très bon jeu à celui de bon jeu et c'est clairement dommage. Au vu du prix actuel, je vous conseille donc d'attendre les soldes, pour ce jeu qui reste malgré tout, un JRPG a faire sur Steam.

17988581.review:
A nice little JRPG, but nothing that will captivate you and keep you invested for a hundred hours.

It's very light on the story and character developement, and ultimately very generic and full of clichés, common anime tropes and fan service, but it's also very self aware and prone to break the 4th wall, which - combined with pretty decent english voice acting - actually makes for a mildly humorous experience every now and then.

Combat system is ok, but nothing special or innovative either. AND, most importantly :
[h1]Battles are EXTREMELY easy.[/h1]

I'm not talking about it being not challenging enough if you know what you're doing, no, you can literally kill everything in this game with one or two basic attacks. Including bosses, and you always act first. This is even more annoying when the game tells you via cutscenes that the upcoming boss is supposed to be super powerful and all, and then you almost one-shot them on the first turn, at which point the fight is interrupted by another cutscene that shows your characters inexplicably getting the crap beaten out of them. Followed by some [b]Cutscene Power To The Max[/b] they throw you back into the fight and you now proplerly one-shot the boss. It's really stupid and happens many times throughout the story.

Enemies do so little damage that it's virtually impossible to lose. I was surprised to see that there was no achievement for getting a game over. which I was only able to get after stacking various damage increasing effects on a dungeon (quadruple damage - for your party and enemies alike) and randomly missing my first attack against a boss.

And if it wasn't clear by now, there is no difficulty slider or anything. At. All.

The dungeon design is acceptable, but eventually reaches the pinnacle of laziness when they send you back in time halfway through the "story" and make you go though all the previous dungeons again, with the same enemies and the exact same bosses.



Fairy Fencer F is one of those generic low budget JRPGs that usually get scores around the 55-65% mark.
If you've really already burned yourself out on every other JRPG out there, you could probably grab this. but if you're playing your games for the story or the battles you're going to be disappointed.

17959762.review:
Alright. Review time. After quite a few hours with this game, I can safely go into detail about whether you should buy it or not, keeping it spoiler free.

If you are TL:DR then here's the nutshell version: I love it.

STORY: Again not going to spoil anything in the story and rather experience it yourself. However, in terms of how good it is...It can be slow to repetitive at times, and i think I skipped a scene at one point because I felt it was irrelevant. The story itself is okay with quite a few twists to keep things refreshing. Though I feel that the story may be the weakest element in the game, AGAIN not that it's bad, it's enjoyable, but it ain't exactly perfect. If it's worth something, I did tear up a bit at times from certain heavy moments. SADLY: You don't get to make any real choices, it's rather straight forward with only three endings. One you get from ignoring all subevents involving your party. And two for...just google it.

Characters: Most if not all of them are brimming with personality and are unique in their own way, including the Fairies in which our main characters possess. The protagonist thankfully is not the cliche brave and goody-to-shoes hero, rather far from it as you will see if you start the game. Each character is lovable and I remember their names well, and I'm bad at remembering names, so that's quite the accomplishment.

Gameplay: Turn based as one might expect. Nothing much to say. You can use basic attacks, magic, or special animated skills to attack your opponents. You may also customize combos in which to attack your enemies with. Each character also has a special ability with special effects for each individual. There are other elements as well which are quite refreshing, but I don't feel like going into detail since it would be explained in the game later.

Soundtrack: Fairly nice, especially when you use you VERY VERY powerful ability or 'FAIRIZE' as well. Though it can get a bit bland, but overall there are some tracks that stick out.

Voice Acting: FOCUS FOCUS FOCUS FOCUS!!! This is important! In my opinion i highly recommend you play this game with the japanese voice over in the options tab. The english dub is...there for those who really hate japanese, but I don't...find them believable like I do with the japanese Dub. The characters feel more alive without the english voice over, and the experience with the game fell a bit when I tried the english version for a while. Japanese is my recommended voice over.

Overall rating: I would at least give this game a 8/10. Still places to improve on, but I've played a solid 24 hours with it, and even if you beat the game, you can restart the story without losing all your progress and restarting. There is replay value depending how you do on the first run.

WARNING: I do not think there is an autosave for this game so before you leave and murderize your computer when you come back, always save. ALWAYS. I didn't lose any progress because i was paranoid as hell since the game leaves save points to help you do it manually. But you can also do it on the world map.

Hope this was helpful.

17872852.review:
I actually really like this game, it got the second Neptunia game out of my mouth.

In basic terms yes it is very similar but with good differences.

The combat system has changed the element of striking enemies into a selective area.
You won't get all your skills from just leveling it up but by unlocking them with these sort of "perk" points used to buff damage, defense, range, your Fairy form "transformation" and  giving you more combos, that's right you don't get your entire combo from the start.
1st The transformation has a subtle change, whenever you get hit or hit an enemy out of form you have a bar representing tension that will rise, after a certain amount filled up you nca fairize which does not cost anything and basically turns you into a badass, thing is it's not permenant, whenever you take a hit the bar falls hard, so no more permanent powerup.
Each character has an actual move specified to them Fang the main character can buff his attack and skills for an extra energy cost to each attack and multiplier to the cost of skills.
Tiara can put up a barrier around herself to reflect a large portion of damage but is unable to attack.
Every character can transform, you are all Fairy Fencers, you can all Fairize.
The story still has comedy but at certain parts the story can and will take a turn for the dark, people actual will die, somtimes you will even see it happen (as much as a virtual novel can without drawing an entire portrait).
There are psychotic crazed murders, some characters do have dark backgrounds.
You can now remove "furies" from two statues which will be used for world forming, which adds buffs and penalties to you like 30% more EXP and -10% Magic Defense, everyone and every mob deals double damage, or disable your skills, etc.
I think there are actually multiple endings which came as quite the suprise to me.
You have challenges for each character which will buff their stats like "Lone Fencer" Battle a # of battles alone.

Now lets get to some of the dirty bussiness.

There are indeed still copy paste monster if not at least less. 
Sometimes the game just comes out cliche and the timing of some things are inappropriate.
English has barely any lines for combat, you may be listening to "Fang/Pain don't hurt" I don't think any of us can figure out what the fuck Fang is trying to say, either way he needs a lesson in grammar.
I like the combat but I can see it getting repetetive for others and you still indeed need to farm extensively but at least world forming will help with that at the same time it seems more difficult to farm.
There are skills that become literally useless further into the game.

Lets get into some more nuetral grounds.
They indeed have removed your ability to change weapons for lore sake but they have replaced it with a system where you equip a second fairy next to your main fairy which resides in your weapon. Anyways this secondary fairy will give you stronger and more passive buffs the more you train them because they do indeed level and I believe cap at 10 though they do take a bit more EXP than most characters.

[h1]與ねぷねぷ系列的比較[/h1]

因為同樣是IF社發行、控肉社開發的作品，
所以把兩者放在一起比較也是很正常的。

兩相比較之下，FFF 感覺起來就像是半完成品，
無論是在劇情的方面，或者是系統的方面皆是，
甚至更可以說，FFF 根本就是ねぷねぷ的血尿版本。

為什麼會這樣說呢？請看以下評論（欸


[h1]劇情[/h1]

是個很典型的王道劇情。

主角是個萬中選一的救世主，四處收納後宮後把 BOSS 閃噴的故事，
拯救了世界之後再跟著正宮一起過著幸福快樂日子的故事。
用一句話簡單的敘述故事的劇情就是這樣。

本作的故事劇情屬於單線式，雖然在途中有給予玩家[b]不明顯[/b]的選擇路線機會，
不過唯一會影響的就只有閃噴 BOSS 之後要把誰變成正宮而已，
與ねぷねぷ會直接改變劇情路線的設定完全不同。

遊戲整體的劇情長度其實還相當的短，
就算是把對話全部看完（不 SKIP 開 AUTO 的情況下），
大概也花不到六個小時就可以直接破關。

在角色間的互動間倒是刻劃的不錯，
尤其是各項無厘頭的對話，根本就是本作的賣點。

作品本體在人物背景的刻劃方面不是很深刻，
還得要靠外傳小說來補完，算是個很殘念的部分。


[h1]遊戲機制[/h1]

[list]
[*]整體

根本ねぷねぷ，就各方面來說，
甚至連部分的怪也是拿ねぷねぷ的怪物模型來用啊...

[*]戰鬥系統

沒有搭檔的三人小隊，而且普攻只能單體，
對於習慣了ねぷねぷ系統的玩家來說相當的不習慣。
[strike]說好的普通就可以先手打噴全部怪咧[/strike]

雖然說陣前可以換任意的隊友出來代打，
不過通常會推到前線去的都已經是最強的隊員了，
除了要解挑戰提升素質外，基本上沒有什麼理由需要陣前換將。

[*]地圖系統

PC 版的小地圖在進入地下城的時候會自動全部顯示，
這點跟 PS3 版的有差異就是。

另外與ねぷねぷ不同的是，
FFF 地圖內的道具只能拾得一次，能夠重複拾取的只有隱藏道具，
這也讓挑戰中「拾取道具」這一項變成相當累人的事情

[*]合成系統

本作品合成系統的製作配方，在玩家拾取到關鍵道具後便會自動開啟，
以音樂盒做舉例，要等到玩家拾取到「黑色唱片」之後才會開啟製作，
如果只有先拾取到「聲音輸出單元」跟「高機體回路」的話，是不會開啟的。

[*]道具系統

不得不說本作品的道具其實還蠻雞肋的，
不但可以攜帶的最大數量有相當的限制，而且可以使用的場合還有限制，
再加上玩到後期學玩了各類治癒魔法之後，道具根本就是裝飾品。
個人第一輪打完最常使用的道具是回家羽毛，就可以知道道具設計有多悲劇了。

[*]妖精化

跟ねぷねぷ的女神化相似，開無雙後會提升素質，
不過可以開啟的條件是角色的「幹勁」程度要達到三格以上才可以開啟。

提升「幹勁」的方法包含擊中敵人的次數，人形狀態下被打，
降低「幹勁」的狀況包含攻擊MISS、回復生命、妖精化狀態下被打，
然後妖精化狀態下幹勁低於一格就會解除妖精化。

另外，每次的戰鬥開始時都要重新累積幹勁，
先手攻擊的話幹勁初始是兩格、普通遭遇是一格半、被突襲是一格。
[/list]

[h1]角色培育系統[/h1]

因為算是本作品的賣點，所以獨立出來評論。

在本作品裡面，提升角色的等級只會提升素質而已，
如果要讓角色或得新的技能或是特性的話，
必須透過擊倒地圖中怪物所獲得的「武器點數」來學習或提升。

獲得「武器點」的數量，基本上是以擊倒的怪物[b]數量[/b]為基準，
因為與怪物的等級無關，所以追求最大獲利的的狀態下就是，
ザワザ平原插滿 300%WP 跟怪物變化之後，進到第三張地圖，
來回不斷的刷地圖中間的兩組妖精，就可以相當快速的累積武器點了。


[h1]Fairy（妖聖） & Fury 系統[/h1]

另外一個做為本作品賣點的系統，由於牽涉的內容相當廣大，故分段說明。
[list]
[*]Fairy（妖聖）

在遊戲中可以獲得，與角色的武器搭配後會獲得共鳴效果，
除了可以提升角色的素質之外，
隨著妖聖的等級提升，還可以獲得其他額外的能力。

[*]Fury

憑依了妖聖的武器會成為 Fury，具有在世界地圖上改變地圖的能力，
前面所提到插滿 WP 跟改變怪物的方式就是要靠 Fury 進行。

另外世界地圖中的シュケスーの塔最高樓層的開啟條件，
是視地圖上有多少 Fury 而決定的。

[*]憑依

將妖聖憑依在 Fury 上的過程，透過ゴッドリプロダクト進行，
在夢中以[strike]海盜鬍子桶[/strike]方式進行，
根據憑依的武器不同，會獲得不同的地圖改造效果，
可以改造的範圍則是視妖聖本身的等級提升而有所擴張。
[/list]

[h1]系統[/h1]

跟ねぷねぷ相較起來優化不是很完全，在部分狀況下會有掉 FPS 的狀況產生。


--

[h1]總結[/h1]

7.3 / 10

因為ねぷねぷ太成功了，所以相較之下這作品就稍微遜色了點，
不過本作品的音樂部分倒是還不錯，對本作品加分不少。

最近好像要發售フェアリーフェンサー エフ ADVENT DARK FORCE，
定位上是本作品的完整版，
所以如果對本系列有興趣的朋友，可以考慮等11月05日去買 FFF ADF。

17812913.review:
Fairy Fencer F...

Quel jeu, chers amis, mais quel jeu !

Y a pas à dire, les p'tits gars de chez CH sont bons quand il s'agit de faire des RPG qui marquent.

Commençons par le commencement, au début étaient les Agarest. Puis sont arrivés les Hyperdimension MK, avec leur univers déjanté et broyeur de neurones au possible, versant dans le n'importe quoi le plus dantesque et le plus jouissif, tant dans le gameplay que l'histoire et les références. Puis un jour est apparu 3F (Fairy Fencer F).

Avec :
-Son héros plus japonais que nature, ultra-stéréotypé (le mec débraillé, qui pense qu'à bouffer, donc l'affinité élémentaire est le feu, et tous les clichés qui vont avec).
-Sa bande son très rock 
       Alors là les amis, laissez-moi vous dire que ça envoie. La bande originale de 3F est peut-être une des meilleures qu'il m'ait été donné d'entendre sur un J-RPG depuis... Les tables de chiffres avec des amas de pixels en forme de personnages. Non je n'ai pas connu cette époque, et oui, j'y ai quand-même joué parce que Nep.

-Son gameplay en apparence très calqué sur les hyperdimension, à ceci près qu'il se trouve être plus accès sur les combos et types d'armes que sur le remplissage de jauge pour attaque spé et guardbreak. Oui, question guardbreak on oublie, les boss ont juste UNE jauge de HP, pas de jauge de garde. Les combos ressemblent donc à du Hyperdimension, mais les affrontements n'ont rien à voir.

-Son système d'amélioration des armes, juste parfait, rien à dire. A ceci près que le skin des armes n'est pas modifié par certaines upgrades. Un tantinet dommage, mais personne n'est parfait, n'est-ce pas ?

-Son scénar, oh oui son scénar. Et là attachez vos ceintures, c'est rien de très brillant mais qu'est-ce que ça emballe ! L'idée de base est simplissime : Des Fencer s'entretuent joyeusement pour collecter des Furies dans l'optique dragonballesque de réveiller une divinité qui leur accorderait le voeu de leur choix. Alors non, pas de background hyper poussé avec une atmosphère mystérieuse et... Non. On se contente de suivre cette joyeuse bande de clampins à travers un monde donjon-rpg, avec une trame linéaire fourmillant de petits events en tous genres. 

Et Soudain, c'est le drame.
A partir d'un point critique du scénar, tout change radicalement. Les personnages ultra-superficiels au début font soudain preuve d'une profondeur toute autre, en particulier notre Fencer mal dégrossi et son appétit démesuré (pire qu'un ado, si si c'est possible. C'est un ado, mais affamé. Je sais ça fait pléonasme mais va falloir me croire sur ce coup les amis).
Et là, le jeu devient addictif, pour les quelques heures de scénar restant, pour aboutir à un final (se déclinant sur trois fins possibles) tout bonnement magique.

Quoi, vous avez encore des questions ?
 
Oui, ce jeu est une perle.
Non, je ne suis absolument pas objectif.
Oui, vous devez vous y mettre si vous aimez les J-RPG et si tout comme moi vous vous faites un devoir de tester tout j-rpg s'offrant à votre porte-monnaie.
Non, vous n'avez pas besoin de refaire vos stocks de café pour les boss, on est loin de la difficulté d'un colisée Hyperdimension.

Bon jeu à vous, et que la Puissance soit avec vous !

17780930.review:
Fairy Fencer F is an interesting game, it somewhat appears in the shadow of the Hyperdimension series and with the polish that those games had you should have high expectations for this one.

In the end those expectations are met. It certainly is fun and hilarious, you really cant go wrong with it, there is a pretty nice bang for buck with this title. 

Storyline: At first its pretty linear and well it drags you along with what seems like a cookie cutter story. Well things change and things happen which arent expected. The various endings are a bit lack luster though, they are bitter sweet but leave you wanting more. Though im not sure if this is getting a sequel, not even sure how they could do a sequel with the storyline this has. Its a lot more serious then hyperdimension but its still full of various jokes. 

Combat: The combat is very similar to that of hyperdimension's, by that i mean its got nice effects, nice moves, variation etc etc. Unless hyperdimension you have to earn the combats and the amount of attacks you can do, personally i think its a bit of a pain, it can become a grind fest. You control three charecters in this game.

The port: The port is good, no crashes at all, audio lag for a few seconds if you tab out but that fixes itself very quickly. Textures are serviceable, they could be higher res but i cant complain, they are good enough. The game runs at a solid 60fps. It uses the windows resolution system which means you can go nuts with the resolution options, you want 4k thats fine, want 8k yeah it works(suprisingly well with my 680 20fps at 8k isnt bad). 

Overall: If you like anime, rpgs, funny storys, bang for buck, multiple endings, hack n slash etc then this is a really nice game to buy.

Side note this game is optimized for a controller which honestly you guys need, many games work a lot better with controllers and this is one of them. it would be nice for it to be optimized for mouse and keyboard, id say that is currently the biggest issue.
