17454517.review:
《妖精劍士F》是一款不錯的日系角色扮演遊戲,本作同《超次元海王星重生》系列同出一門,因而很多細節之處都有相似的影子.
    本作的迷宮並不複雜,可探索性也並不是很高.同IF社其他遊戲一樣,本作的人物設定可圈可點,女主角Tiara是個小惡魔類型的女孩,讓人欲罷不能.
    遊戲的整體流程並不算長,然而多周目的設定給本作極大地延長了遊玩時間.DLC中也有新的地圖可供探索(雖然很變態),也可以使遊戲角色升到300級的上限.

Story/劇情  ★★★☆
就劇情而言,本作顯得有些無厘頭.但整體故事線敘事完整,脈絡清晰.流程不長,而中途反轉,也算是有些趣味.

System/系統  ★★★★
遊戲的戰鬥系統與英雄傳說系列一樣,都是走位回合制.站位對於戰鬥的成敗影響重大.
非戰鬥場景則是一貫的Galgame模式,自帶跳略機能,但是通篇沒有任何選擇支.(但有支線劇情)
與《超次元海王星重生》系列類似.地下城內的怪物種類單一,AI也很低,迷宮模組並不精緻,結構也是異常簡單,使人玩久了會產生一絲乏味的感覺.

Graphic/畫面  ★★★☆
3D部份也就人物建模做得不錯,場景和怪物都一片犬牙差忽,令人無法直視.
2D部份則完全是Galgame的套路,好在人設做得不錯.

Music/音樂  ★★☆
唯一給我留下印象的是變身時的背景音樂.

Total/總體   ★★★☆
一款具有鮮明IF社特色的遊戲,迷宮探索+Galgame類型的混合體.人設是最大賣點(其實我也是沖著緹亞菈買的).
總體上中規中矩,沒有太大亮點,也沒有太大缺點.推薦對人設感興趣的日呆玩家入手.

17453643.review:
As a lover of turn-based RPG, I was looking to test the waters in the JRPG sub-genre. Seeing this game on sale for 50% off and newly released, not to mention the great reviews of the game on console, I decided to take the leap.

Pros:
- Combat system is fantastic and a change of pace from your typical turn-based RPG
- Unique Story / Protagonist
- Great character customization in terms of combat and accessories
- Good intro / tutorial 
- English Voice acting is actually pretty good
- The port is well done and can be run on any computer without issue (I'm playing on a Macbook just fine)

Cons:
- No difficulty setting (this is a personal issue though I feel)
- Characters break the fourth wall / goofy (can be a turn off for some, story-wise)

Definitely worth the buy for any new / veteran JRPGers. Although I will advise to stay away from the item pack / fairy DLCs as they ruin the game. I purchased those and after realizing they were available from level 1 and made the game stupid easy, I haven't equipped them.

17452861.review:
It's a fun game.  But I find that it challenges your suspension of disbelief.  As you continue playing it, you start to realize that the story can dissociate drastically from the gameplay.

For instance...on the first playthrough, I one-shot a boss.  Cue the upcoming visual novel cutscene where the characters are wincing in pain and groaning about how strong the boss is.  I reaaally didn't get that impression.  

So my suggestion is that if you get the game...play the game and follow the story.  But don't play the game AND follow the story.  Treat the two separately, and I think you'll find that it's entertaining as a game and tells a fairly interesting story.  But if you treat the two as one unit, expect to lose some brain cells when the gameplay and story start hand-waving.

This game is a bit weird.  In an era of RPGs where you're able to allocate your stats as you see fit, this game sort of falls back to the traditional method of level-up = auto-allocate stats.  Granted, there is a way to boost your attack stats, but I dearly wish I could up my characters speed / accuracy.  Speed because I'd like to give a certain character in the party the ability to attack first.  Accuracy because there are certain attacks in the game that give 300% damage, but they miss really often.  

It turns out that it's not so much that they miss often but that the enemy has an easy time dodging them.  I figured this out when I used these techniques on low level enemies...whereas I would have a 20% hit rate on equivalent level opponents, At level 55, I had a 100% hit rate on level 30 mobs.

The only way to boost the speed and hit rate is to complete a set of challenges.  These require you to do weird things like jump around as the leader of the party or send the enemy flying so you can use interception attacks.  They wouldn't be so bad ordinarily, but I do have complaints about jumping 5000 times per character just to max out the challenge.

Personally, I liked playing this game a lot.  I just wish that I managed to get the Eryn ending first try.  I don't know what I did wrong to get the Tiara ending.

Oh yeah, I suggest turning on Japanese voices occasionally.  You'll find that all sorts of things are voiced that aren't in the English Dub.  For instance, the Fury Fairies.

Just finished my first playthrough! Takes about twenty hours, but that's if you rush it JUST a little - I was rather underlevel for the last boss, but JUST scratched by at low level 30. Only just, and that's with the DLC items.

 + The good +
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ Fun battle system.
+ Great OST
+ Characters are rather funny and some can get a little deep.
+ Story was pretty decent, with some decent twists here and there!
+ Transformations are pretty cool and make you feel powerful!
+ The skill system is nice and putting in effort feels VERY rewarding!

  - The Bad -
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
- Revisiting almost all the dungeons, at least ONCE or twice in the game
- Game can be short and beaten rather quickly; under twenty hours
- Varity of item crafting looks good, but I didn't feel pushed to make use of it


  In the end; the game is aimed towards those that like anime like things, with the game at times feeling more like a VN than a game itself. It's a JPRG that's fun to play!

TL;DR - If you see the game on sell and want a decent game to play? Get this. Very much worth it.

[b]Yes has Japanese voice option[/b]. Cast includes a few well known anime VAs.
Music by [b]Nobuo Uematsu[/b], concept art by [b]Yoshitaka Amano[/b]. Wow was I surprised when I saw those names in the opening credits.
Tons of fun, addicting gameplay. Doesn't take itself too seriously, good humor typical of anime culture. Random battles let you skip the victory sequence and you can go from encounter start to moving on the map again in about 6 seconds if you're one shotting them(take that PS1 era RPGs). Nice graphics, high framerate.
I'm really glad I picked this up.

Quick edit to add more about one of the above points - this is all around faster moving than is typical of JRPGs I've played until now. Every single combat animation down to basic attacks can be skipped by holding a button, going from world map to town and back again is so quick there's no moment of thoughtful hesitation before I do so, even going into menus and changing stuff doesn't seem to take as long for a screen fade as I'm used to JRPGs taking.

17445713.review:
Its good, a traditional JRPG with a few gimmicks such as a heavy visual novel approach (Tears to Tiara 3, Hyperdimension for example) and  extremely flashy encounters that you'de normally see on consoles.  Some of the best parts of this game, despite the combat being simplistic is how pretty it looks.  All of the spells, and abilities have their own little cutscene and  all actions happen snappily and quickly. The audio is good, the English dub is liveable but the Japanese dub is better (especially if you understand things that don't translate well).

The story is anime influenced and is more on the silly/moe side of that.  It is a fun story, nothing too serious and  slightly cliche at points.  The story is self aware of just how cliche it can feel, and sometimes makes fun of itself.  There is a deeper undertone but I doubt it'll matter.  Now get the boy his damn /FOOD/!  It is more cohesive then most straight up Visual Novels, but there isn't much choice as it only has 3 possible endings without much deviation in your activities.

As a PC port, it works perfectly.  And really that is the #1 criteria for any game that exists. The game only has resolution settings, including borderless mode.  That is pretty much all there is for PC related enhancements, everything looks crisper and cleaner then the console version so I can't really find anything to complain about this.   Its a fast game, the FPS feels smooth, the action is smooth.

Overall it is a fun game to play, especially at its current price of $15.  Its a competent port, and is pretty to look at.  Its a bit easy, so you won't enjoy this game if you want a challenge.  Nor will you want this game if you're looking for a deep engaging story that will make your brain think on all cylinders.  But if you want something light hearted and easy to digest then this games story will pass for you.  Thumbs up~!

17444987.review:
Als RPG und Fantasy Fan kam ich am Kauf dieses Games nicht vorbei, die Idee das es Menschen gibt mit der Fähigkeit sich mit Feen zu verbinden (genannt Fencer) und auf diese Weise unglaubliche Fähigkeiten erhalten sowie die ewige Schlacht zwischen Licht und Dunkelheit zwang mich regelrecht zum Kauf.
Bis jetzt fand ich die Story im allgemeinen doch recht schön und der Humor der durch die Charaktere dazu gemischt wird ist doch sehr toll.
Die Anime Grtafik schreckt zwar den ein oder anderen ab, sollte aber nicht als Störfaktor genannt werden, ich persönlich finde den Grafikstil des Games doch sehr sehr charmant um nicht zu sagen das ich solch Grafiken in Verbindung mit Fantasy RPG liebe.
Ich hab leider keine Untertitel Option gefunden, was ich leider schade finde denn ich würde das Spiel sonst mit japanischer Sprachausgabe und englischen Untertitel bevorzugen (und doch.. das bricht mir schon irgendwie das Herz).
Das Spiel an sich, so kann ich es zumindest erahnen wird wohl ein Grindfest, wie grindlastig es allerdings wirklich ist kann ich noch nicht beurteilen.
Man kann Dungeons Statusbuffs und Debuffs geben. Dies erfolgt dadurch das man mit Feen besetzte Waffen auf der Map um den Dungeon herum verteilt und so Dinge auswirkt wie z.B. ATK UP + MagicATK DOWN oder EXP UP + Money DOWN, was das grinden etwas erleichter oder erschwert aber das liegt an ein selbst, man muss das etwas überdenken und wissen was man wirken sollte und was nicht und dazu muss man erstmal wissen wie gut man mit den Gegnern im Dungeon zurecht kommt.
Momentan hat das Spiel ein paar sehr wenige Laggs für mich, wenn ich ein Dungeon betrete oder einen Map Abschnitt vorran gehe laggt es ganz kurz aber das lässt auch sofort wieder nach und zeigt sich auch nur beim betreten von Abschnitten, weder in Videos noch im Kampf oder beim laufen, dies kann allerdings auch an Win10 liegen sicher bin ich mir da allerdings nicht.
Ich persönlich genieße das Spiel in vollen Zügen und bereue den Kauf definitiv nicht.

17443296.review:
While not the most original RPG out there it does have its moments. They did a decent balance of humor with the story albeit very predictably. The ferrize thing though is just way over the top, but ignoring that and the fact they did it that way on purpose for the story and humor it is worth playing. I mostly enjoyed the interatctions between Tiara and Fang. And the side story with Apollonius wasn't bad, but I wish they did more with it. Don't get me started on the weird guy in the animal suit... Story wise the main complaint I had is the way the handled the main town. The conversations with the locals were all pointless and did not really endear you with the story, but personally I felt like I had to read it in case there was some subplot that would show up.... sadly they did not really take advanatage of that and no quests from any of the common characters ever occured.

Gameplay itself is pretty mediocre. Reason I say that is because really pretty much through 95% of the game I was just spamming attack + skip, ferrize + skip, attack + skip. This game definitely did not focus on strategy. Most of the time I got through battles without losing any characters because I just focused on stunning the monsters with combos so I would end up getting the game to trigger the event to get other party members to get a whack in. This even worked on bosses. I would generally advise not to buy the DLC that provides the armors unless you want to have two characters be nearly invulnerable for 60-75% of the storyline game. I'm telling you those armors are way overpowered! Don't get me started on the other DLC's where if you want the stat boost at all your characters are in towels?!?!

Now the one thing I really do have to say was a decent idea for the battlesystem and that was the combos mechanic. It really did let me choose a moveset that I could get the maximum amount of damage. The main problem with the combo system is due to how much time it takes to play thing game (and how much I was spamming skip) I ended up only using the same moveset over and over and ignoring any of the other possibilities because 90% of the time the moveset I chose for the A button worked, so there was no reason to choose any of the other choices. I never really used any magics at all except for healing as it wasted more time than it was worth in most cases.

Lastly the questing system at the bar is seemingly pointless. The amount of griding that is needed is rather sad. The rewards do not even cover the time spent on the task in many cases. Once you get to the C important mission I was stuck for a long time because I didn't check to see if there was a way to synth the ingredient.. figured I would pick it up somewhere.... wrong.

Bottom line I would rate the game as a C

Story C+
Gameplay D
Amount of Gameplay A-

If you're bored I would recommend it, but there are better choices out there such as "Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky, The" etc.

If you like Hyperdimention Neptunia then you will like this game, if you didn't like Neptunia's combat mechanics then this would not be for you. It's a lot, a lot, of conversations that are somewhat amusing, but the game does allow you to skip them if your not into the story and just like the combat or have already played through once and listened to the many hours of story already, it's always nice when games don't force the story on you (specailly when your playing through a game a second time). And the combat is Exactly like Hyperdimintion Neptunia which was an interesting idea, and enjoyable, but could be finiky aiming with controller and a bit less finiky but still finiky with mouse and keyboard.

Story seems like most JRPGs, amussing but pretty bad at the same time, kind of like good bad movies for example the first Mortal Kombat movie was a bad movie but good at the same time because it was that cheesy bad.

All in all if you like JRPGs you will probably like this, but expect to get a bit frustrated trying to aim a conal attack at two enemies every once in a while but otherwise enjoyable combat, expect amusingly bad dialog (and a lot of it), and expect to have to grind in the late game (not certain on that, but most JRPGs end up grindy mid way through).

The combat is what you would expect from a game VERY similar to the Hyperdimension Neptunia series (also worth looking into if you are not familar) so not much I can really say there. It's short, sweet, and very simple to learn. The English voice acting is done right, as what is expected from the developers of these wonderful games.

Overall if you are wondering if this is a product worth purchasing, then in all my hearts honesty, of my own opinion of course, yes it definetly is worth buying. As I have gotten farther on the PC port then I was on my PS3, I have come to realize how much I have missed out on when it comes to the overall enjoyment this game has to offer.
Now of course this game has it's faults (mainly which comes to combat for me) but they are for the most part what would you expect if you have played any other heavily anime styled JRPG. I also wanted throw out as an almost last note the game is very well optimized right out the get go like everyone else has been saying. Something that the developers of these games have been having issues with when it comes to their ports. Anywhos...

I'll quit typing here as I know due to the lack of reviews I actually write... I'm not very great at them. But I sure as heck tried my best! Haha anyways like I mentioned, in my heart this game is a gem. I almost want to say this was a very underappreciated game that never really did get the love it deserves. So please if you're interested do purchase this game, As I can promise you won't regret it;)


As always I hope everyone is doing well and living life the best they can! And I wish everyone the best! :) And of course thank you for reading!!!

(I hope my review did justice or atleast did okay for anyone who reads this by the way haha!)

17428154.review:
You can see my full review here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0AZ9A9Iazpg

Idea Factory, it seems that they can't get away from making there games similar to Hyperdimension in almost every aspect, at least that's what it felt like to me after playing several hours of Fairy Fencer F. The game is as Turn based JRPG that follows the standard premise for JRPG's but does a few things different from the sandard.

I'll start with the story, the idea is that two gods (The vile god and the Goddess)had a falling out and paralized each other with each others swords. The swords that missed ended up in the world, embedded in the ground waiting for a capable human to pull them out. When someone pulls one out, the Fairy within the weapon is bound to them at that moment and it allows the person to weild incredible power. These people then become Fencer's, people who can weild these weapons and the fairies within them. Almost every goal for a Fencer is to collect 100 Furies (The weapons with fairies) and pull all the swords out of the goddess and in doing so, they will be granted a wish. So yeah, it follows a very obvious premise to JRPG's, having Gods, a single corporation that turns out to be evil behind the scene's and so on. So the story isn't very original in it's idea but it does do a couple of things different then other JRPG's.

Next is the combat and if you've played any of the Hyperdimension Re;birth games then it's going to feel very similar, and by similar I mean it's the exact same as the Re;birth games. You have up to three characters on the battlefield and you move each one when it's there turn within a specific area. You can start off with a basic attack which will start your combo for that characters turn, but you start off with only one and have to increase your combos by aquiring them with weapon points. Just like Hyperdimension you can switch you attacks anytime you want for different one's which allows you to mix and match a lot of different attacks to find one's that go together. Your skills contain two catagories, Skills and magic. Skills are a combination of magic attacks with physical attacks and Magic is pretty self expainitory. Next is Fairize, this is your characters transformation allowing them to use the power of there Fairy to increase there stats and gives access to a unique skill. To access the transformation, there will a bar connected to the characters portait in the top right corner, when this bar fills up (By taking damage or dealing damage) and glows blue, you can access the transformation which gives the character an increase in there physical  attack and defense, but will start to decrease if you take damage. The transformation is nice but it can be turned off so easily that it'll barely last for a couple of turns if your getting beat and the increase in stats is quite minimal that you probably might not even notice the difference. Next, every character has a unique ability tied to them that they can only use, Fang has serious face (Well named there) which gives him a big increase in physical attack by 2.0 but his base attacks cost SP and his skills SP usage will also increase by 1.5. Tiara has a protective barrier that will only pretect her but can withistand really strong attacks and Harley has the ability to scan enemys and exposse there weaknesses. At the end of it, it's rather slick and fastpased, the animations look really smooth and the partical effects and skills look really good, the transformation could look better though.

The one thing I've always praised Idea Factory for is the art design. Be it with this game or Hyperdimension, the character models, the sceneary and the enviroment look beautiful and very well done. They're always so full of color and never look over designed.

On to the last thing that really kinda takes me away from the game and that is the characters themselves, I find it very difficult to stay interested in a game where most of the characters are so unbearable that I want to punch them in there face. I'll start with our main protagonist Fang, an egotistic, big headed, arrogent, slightly selfish food lover. It's difficult for me to find a place for me to start with him since I have a fair amount of problems with him. The things he's says seem only to elevate his own opinion of himself and has a distinct habit of down right insulting the other characters for no reason which makes it very difficult for me to feel anything for him when he acts like that. The rest of them have a habit of responding to a situation or each other in the most piculiar way that doesn't really make any sense, but some of them have had effort in putting personalities into them. It is nice however to see a male protagonist who isn't a cliced angsty teenager but the way they did it doesn't make him likeable in many ways, An example I can give for a good male protagonist in a video game is Yuri Lowell, I recommend looking for yourself why but I digress.

You may have noticed that I've been comparing this to Idea Factoy's other game Hyperdimension a lot and that is because it is practically the same game but with different characters and setting. The problem I find however, if I where to compare it to Hyperdimension, is that it doesn't have the charm or the personality that Hyperdimension has. That has many different characters with different personalities that suit there character designs for one, the other being that it just doesn't care, it will constantly break the fourth wall, refence other games and hardware, poke fun at the game industry and at animes. It has that charm to it that makes it enjoyable and fun to the point where you'll spend hours paying attention to the dialogue just to see what they'll reference next and what thing within the game industry they'll poke fun at, I mean come on, at the begining of Re;birth 3 they reference the Oculus Rift and Sword art online by creating a device called the "Nepulus gift" (Something like that) and having it looking exactly like the Nerv gear. The list goes on and one with what they'll do.

I digress, I'm here to review this game on it's own, I compare it to other video games to give you general comparison of what I'm talking about. On it's own however, without comparing it, it it's fairly enjoyable to a certain degree. The art style and character models are beautiful, the combat is fast pased and fun once you start getting more combo slots and skills and the enemy variety is nice, but there are a couple of things that I've been nitpicking about just because it's me and I tend to point out every little detail. So I can recommend this if you haven't played any of the Hyperdimension Re;birth games or if you want something that's a little more serious, but it can be enjoyable if you look past the small nitpicks.

Mais uma pérola da Idea Factory/Compile Heart! Para os fãs da franquia Hyperdimension, Fairy Fencer F é imperdível. Para quem não conhece os outros jogos, mas gosta de animes e personagens carismáticos, certamente amará esse jogo.

É um jogo fantástico! Uma história muito, muito interessante, com personagens que vão se desenvolvendo com o tempo. Muitas surpresas. Às vezes você vai amar um personagem e depois acabar odiando-no. Esse é um tipo de jogo que se você acompanhar bem a história, você irá se emocionar em algum momento. Torcer por alguns personagens, certamente. É um tipo de jogo que merece uma boa continuação.

A trilha sonora é simplesmente FENOMENAL. Assim como todos os jogos da Idea Factory, a qualidade do audio e das dublagens (em japonês) são impecáveis.

Vale cada centavo. Se você gosta de Visual Novels com um pouquinho de ação, não perca tempo e compre Fairy Fencer F. Se você não goste, compre também. Você pode gostar. Eu comecei assim. Valeu a pena!

17425778.review:
It's a turn based JRPG. This game is like Hyperdimension Neptunia, with a similar more tactical combat system. The port is very well optimized. You can clearly see, that the company learned from their last ports. If you liked the Neptune series, buy this game. You cannot be wrong with this one.

Characters are funny. The main character is a male, who is simple minded as they come.  

Be warned, this game is a grind fest, because you have to level up the fairies, you gather. This fairy component is a little bit like the Persona demon collecting and levelling, giving the characters some skills and added stats.

Includes hillarious conversations, fan service, cute characters. 

I wanted to play for under 2 hours, to test it. Now I am at 6 hours play time, and I will never refund it.

Ther are two negative points. 

They made the side quest system utterly useless, because you are not able to fulfill the level up quest. For these B-stage quest you need 5 elemental stones of fire, ice, lightning and stone. The droprate is so terrible and broken, that you need at least 20 hours of pure grinding, to fullfill that request. This part of the game needs definitly to be fixed. 

Another point are the boss fights. They are way to easy, because if you even try to grind these stones, the "bosses" are merely a one round easy hit, killing the immersion of the story. The bosses simple do not level with your party, so that they are basicly forgetable. The balancing is totally off.

17425647.review:
Extremely fun game and an enjoyable storyline if you played the Neptunia series you will enjoy this most likely.  The combat is smooth and easy to learn even though there are multiple things that influence combat.  The combat is also very similar to the Neptunia V or the Neptunia Rebirth series.  The game is not exactly short either my first play through of the game took 33 hours.  The game has 3 different endings which does also increase the replayability of the game.

Unlike in many RPG's you do not change your weapon instead as you play the game you aquire something called weapon boost points, these points allow you to customize your weapons stats increasing it's damage, magic attack, increase physical and magical defense how far your attack range is and couple other things.  With weapon boost points you are also able to get new skills, magic, abilites, and a few other things. 

Similar to the Neptunia Rebirth series there is a world shaping option as well which allows you to change mobs or items in dungeons however unlike the Neptunia series there is normally a negative that goes with the positive for example you will gain 30% more exp but you will have 10% less defense.

The characters in the game are all likeable and have personality and over the course of the game you actually see their personalites change which is nice to see.  The english voices are all well done and none seem out of place for the character.

The bad in my opinion

If just following the storyline the game is rather easy.

The game has 3 different endings which is good however there really is no clear indication ever of what path you are on basically if you want the other two endings you will either have to go through it with trial and error or look up a guide. 

Other than that there really is no negative I can think of. Fun combat, Lots of customization, Easy to play, Enjoyable storyline, Enjoyable Characters, Good english voice acting, Characters with personality, and fairly long.

Whoa, what a great PC port of a PS3 game. Runs really nicely and has zero snafus. The game itself is sweet!

[b]Review:[/b]
   Fairy Fencery F is a PC port of a Playstation 3 game with the same name, developed by Compile Heart who itself is a reiteration of Compile, the developes behind Puyo Puyo. This title is what many would call a JRPG seeing as you grind to level up so that in the end you can defeat the big bad while meeting colourfull characters along the way. 

   You follow the adventures of Fang, a derilict who just wants to find a free meal, who goes through dungeons to find "Furies" or swords which can be used to unlock a godess or demon that have been sealed ages ago. The encounters are viewable which is a big plus for me. In battle you control three members of your party who all have a special perk that can give them an advantage and a super mode which increases their defense and attack. There's really not much more to say seeing as this is your standard bread and butter of JRPG fare. 

   The game shares many many assets with the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. You see the same textures, enemies, and the game itself uses the same engine. Where it differs is the pacing, character design, and music score. I for one see FFF as being the project title that may have swung Compile Hearts around from making awful Neptunia games in to what are passable budget titles today. Make no mistake, with the visuals, shallow gameplay, and length of the game this may be considered a budget-esque title too. 

   All in all I really do reccomend this, especially for what I bought it for ($15). It really takes me back to the old days of JRPGs and how they had those simple charcter models and loads of anime cliches. 

~The best part about this is just how fast you can play this game. You can blast through all attacks and menus at the speed of light, it's just crazy. My last JRPG I played was Sen no Kiseki II and there you could fast forward too, but boy oh boy not like FFF. I am truly enamoured with the sheer speed you can blast through fluff in this game.~

They go on a journey and you meet another fencer in the first dungeon, but i wont go into detail as the story is one to experience for oneself. Just one quick word, ive only played a small amount of the story but its so gripping i cant stop, and have already played near 5 hours in the story mode (The ingame menu will tell you the total play time and this sessions play time)

The tutorial level comes quite quickly in this game and i for one love the combat system. Its turn based but each turn a character can move around a field in the map that has their starteing position as teh center of teh field. 
When your characters turn is in play, they can choose a variety of options, those being attack, skills/magic, items, wait and fairize. Ill get to attack a bit later. 
The skills/magic menu when opened has two submenus for skills and magic, skills being physical attacks. Many different magics and skills have different radii and fields where you need to line up the attacking area, which is in red, with the enemies you want to fight.
Huh? Whats Fairize you ask? Its sounds wierd but its where a fencer resonates with their fairy and thus their attack increases and special fairize skills are unlocked, oh and you get an anime-esque transformation sequence. And then theres also wait, Increases attack in teh next turn and makes you guard. A queue of who goes next is displayed on teh left side of teh screen.
Now we'll get to attack. which when pressed can start a combo, this cant be done at the start, but as you go thorugh the game youll learn how to execute long combos.

As you go through the game collecting furies, they will have fairies which you can equip to your characters, which increase stuff like strength of sword/glaive/knuckle/etc attack or increase attack of one element of magic, you know earth air fire water. There is a way to make fairies stronger, but its part of teh story and i dont want to spoil anything.

All thats left to talk about is options, in which you can increase bgm voice and sound volumes seperatley and there a japanese to english voice switch, which is english default, which is a nice addition that i like seeing in these sorts of games.

I highly recommend this to beginners of teh jrpg genre, veterans of rpgs in general, and anyone who wants a nice singleplayer campaign rpg expereince.

I'll be brief as possible with this review since this game has been out for some time already on the PS3. You should really look at those reviews on the game content itself.

What I really want to focus on is why this is a good PC port and why you should consider it.

+ It's reasonably priced (at launch was $14.99)
+ DLC is $0.99 a piece and totally optional to the core game
+ It runs at 1920x1080 (1080p) at 60FPS without issue
+ Works with my older gamepad just fine (Logitech Cordless Rumblepad 2)

Now I can't say whether or not the core game itself is your cup of tea; but I do want to say that many of the technical issues that plauged the PS3 version shouldn't be present here. At worst, it's a cleaned up smooth running PS3 port. At best, it's a JRPG that at least feels like it belongs on the PC unlike other half-ass attempts recently from other publishers/developers.

17403627.review:
Fairy Fencer F

TL:DR Summary;  
Don't believe the rating of the game - you need to make your own judgement call before buying. 
Don't like grindfests? Don't buy this game -  You like grindfests? then buy this game.

The characters themselves are created extremely well, to the usual highest of standards and fit well within the storylines.  Fang though comes across far too whiny in the early parts of the game though but at least, the other characters are hilarious especially Eryn and Tiara who no doubt will replace Nep as someones waifu. 

Tiara and Eryn both are amazing characters, the voice actors do really amazing jobs in capturing their often hilirious quirks, such as Tiara strange kinky responses when shes verbally assalted by fang.  Both character design is perfect,  the other characters are all fairly well balanced too but don't nearly stand out as much as Tiara and Eryn. 

A great game but has a really poorly designed questing system which forces the player into loading/reloading dungeons countless number of times in order to get rare drops in order to synthesis stones to complete rank quests, these quests are extremely grindfest and incredibly frustrating especially if you get unlucky with crappy RNG, and to make matters worse these Collector Quests just get worse as you rank up,  Rank C is pretty bad - I shudder to think how bad Rank B and A will be,  but these shouldn't be designed this way - Compile Heart you disappoint me here,  you're better than this to throw in a really unnessary grindfest in order to progress your questing. 

Some stones are somewhat 'easy' to find with Item Sonar as they as the potential areas are close to the entrance, like with the ice cave so the re-loading of the dungeon isn't so bad, but other dungeons on the other hand, the hidden treasure could be far away and that takes a significant amount of time finding the hidden treasure, and thats even 'assuming' its not a useless sprout inside.    Basically, if there is a DLC or any cheat/feature that clearly displays the hidden treasure on the map immediately without having to use item sonar, then this is clearly NEEDED in order to keep your sanity after your 1000th dungeon reload and you still haven't gotten your stupid stones yet. 

Clearly, this quest system just doensn't work very well at all, and unfortunately this heavily impacts the games fun factor once the tedium sets in.  Compile Hearts, please do not do this again with future releases - stick with the tried and tested methods that worked with the HDN series. 

As for the rest of the game, I haven't had any issues - everything else is good.  Good characters,  good story lines with humorous dialogue and the voice acting is up to high standards.   The graphics and drawing are on par with the HDN series.  

Whilst I honestly enjoy the game, and story - I just can't get past the mistakes made with the quest system, and thats the only - repeat ONLY reason for the not recommend review.   *IF* you don't mind a more hardcore approach to grinding and farming, especialy farming for stones so you can synthesis then you will enjoy Fairy Fencer F,  if your like me and have no patience at all these days for farming and/or get easily frustrated then I would do more research first before buying into this game.   

Closing statements here is that the worst problems that Fairy Fencer F suffers from are insane grinds require for portions of the game, especially in farming for stones and stealing quest items which have a very very low success rate.   Another minor issue is that halfway though the game, the difficulty unusually spikes with monsters doing alot more damage, plus you'll face more in battles + boss battles get more intense, I'll not reveal anymore information on this because it'll potentially spoil it for anyone reading, but the spike feels like it wasn't tested enough and makes an already grindy game, feel even more grindy. 

Alot of content is also highly missable, such as recruiting extra characters which first time around, is more or less impossible and really aimed at NG+ so expect to play through multiple times in order to unlock alot of the extras.  Finally, if anyone doesn't believe me about the drop rates being really bad - just check the forums yourself and read all the posts regarding this - Don't take accept anyone saying that they are 'fine' because they are clearly not.

Whilst reading through my review and reading through peoples responses, I think I came off as highly critical.  I make no real apologies here since everyone has their own right to post how they feel about any game they play, whether its a hateful comments or because they just really love the game and cannot stand any negativity.  However,  I think I was wrong to give this game a 5/10 and I will admit, that was a mistake - however, my previous statements I will still standby them.   

Overall 6/10

++ Slick combat system
++ Good WP system for developing characters skill and abilities
++ Cute and Moe Characters
++ Great Storyline and Dialogue
+++ Music Score by legendary Nobuo Uematsu 

- Highly missable content
-- DLC heavy
-- Too much emphasis on farming
-- Some side quests and synthesis feels grindy
---Major grindfest in certain areas of the game
---Collectors quests has a long and unnecessary grind

17403578.review:
If you have played and loved either of the Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth games, skip to part B. If you haven't, read on.

A) Fairy Fencer F is goofy, totally nonsense JRPG from Compile Heart, with the least (most?) likeable main character ever. However, because of its cute supporting characters, entertaining (if somewhat grindy) battle system, hilarious (sometimes hilariously bad) dialogue, and genuinely interesting story premise, I had a really difficult time putting it down last night. 

So you're Fang, an extremely lazy kid who by total happenstance becomes a Fencer, charged with collecting the Furies (magical weapons fallen to Earth) to unseal the goddess. Sounds simple, right? Well... not really. You also have the option to unseal her opponent, the Vile God (but who would do that, right?!) So the game doesn't seem to mind giving the player options in this regard, and it seems to be set up for multiple endings. 

To  keep it short and sweet, if you're a fan of well made JRPGs, cute things and mixed humour, there is no reason in the world you shouldn't like this. The port runs extremely well (*cough* Arkham Knight *cough*), so go ahead, pick it up and give it a try. The worst thing that could happen is you don't like it and refund it. BUT WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT?!


B) Get it. More of the same moe awesomeness and cheesy humour, with a male main character (more character variety in general.) Almost identical battle system. A little less refined, but it works well. You'll love it.

17399785.review:
As I write this the game is on sale for 15 dollars and I'd say it's a pretty good deal.

First off, it doesn't have any launch problems at all for me and it plays perfectly on windows 7. The Xbox3460 controller can be chosen as the input device in the configuration.

As far as the game itself goes, I like the following things:
[list]
[*]You can skip spell/attack animations at the touch of a button.
[*]Battle system is quick and fast. Battles with weak enemies don't drag on forever due to lengthy animations.
[*]Characters are fairly likeable.
[*]There's plenty of boobs going around.
[*]The graphics are very colorful.
[*]It's easy to use the camp menu to find what you need to.
[*]The skill system is fun and easy to learn. Gain WP to learn skills that are prerequisites for better skills.
[/list]

What I don't like:
[list]
[*]Characters usually have one modified portrait at most to represent their speech, and the game tries rather comically to make it seem like they're doing things, such as pushing an ally aside by having one picture shove another.

[*]This is obviously a fairly low budget game. A lot of art assets are re-used, like entire dungeons.

[*]The story is just the typical JRPG thing. A reluctant hero saves the world to restore the goddess of light so she can defeat the dark Vile God. It would have been nice if the joking scenario Harley claimed was actually the real story instead of this.

[*]The combo editing system makes little sense. When I go to the menu, I can't change anything even after learning a variety of skills for a character. Either this is a bug or the developers decided to introduce the system too early in the story (eg. it's something advanced I can't actually make use of yet).
[/list]

17398388.review:
so lets take the good first:

1: high quality voice acting, really nice.
2: decent options for pc.
3: ok control, mouse support is actually very well made considering its a port.
4: beautifull art style, as an anime/manga fan it was a very pleasent look.
5: semi catching music.
6: story seemed interesting.

now the bad:
1: only main story is voice acted, so it feels a bit off when interacting with the rest of the world that is silent (completely silent, not even a "hi there")
2: animation on the story line part is extremely simply done, or not done at all, it leaves much to be desired and you are almost better of not watching it while enjoying the conversation due to this. should have put in a minimum effort here.
3: main character is a complete douc he, he is childish and annoying, he feels like a 8 year old, which gets tiresome Fast.
4: combat controls are sticky, and feels unpolished, the movement in combat to get the right angles are a fiddle which takes the enjoyment down.
5: the camera view is very zoomed in, both moving in dungeons and in combat, and the angle of it (even when changed) are not good for the control scheme.
6: combat in general feel boring, sloppy, and extremely easy to the point of pointless (didn't find any difficulty scale stuff; but the combat setup wasn't good).
7: dungeon "background" graphic was horrible; i do not mind the model graphic and animation of combat move, but base ground etc. was very bad.
8: gameplay felt dull, unfinished, and badly made.

i wouldn't recommand this game as a game.
if it was a "story" or an "anime" i might recommand it, since as such a media i think it would do well.
but because of how bad the combat controls, combat feel, the flow, and the camera was, the overall gameplay experience was really bad.
i find that kinda sad because the story itself seemed interesting, although the main character was just too much of an 8 year old douc he, which i found tiresome very fast.

maybe for young children it would be a great game, since gameplay feel etc. is something which isn't as noticable for them to be entertained; or for people that just want a story and don't mind the very childish beheaviour of the main character.
but for people that play a lot of games and like the game experience i wouldn't recommand it.

PC로 이식하는데 넵튠 리버스 시리즈 PC판보다 좀 더 심연을 기울인거 같습니다.

기본적으로 넵튠PC판에선 창모드와 전체화면 이 두개였지만, 페어리 펜서에선 Borderless 라는 즉, 상태창을 없애는 기능까지 있더군요 추가적으로 넵튠에선 없었던 PC판 마우스 커서가 있었습니다.

1080p 해상도와 60fps는 PC로 이식하면서 당연하게 될 것들이지만 PS3때 유저로선 정말 마음에 드는 부분입니다.

다만 아쉬운점은 역시 키셋팅인거 같네요. 패드 유저들에겐 편한게임이지만 키보드 유저들은 카메라와 UI 조작을 따로 해야하기 때문에 불편할 수 밖에 없습니다.

스토리는 흔히 있을법한 내용이지만 적어도 저는 넵튠 시리즈보다 더 몰입하면서 플레이 할 수 있었습니다.

17397947.review:
捧腹的段子，萌萌的妹子，回合制，这是一款中规中矩的JRPG，仅凭借tsunako萌得令人窒息的画风就可以吸引一批日呆死宅忽略粗糙的画面和无趣的刷刷刷，仿佛被洗脑了一样的败下去。死宅，人傻，钱多，速来。
游戏的画面即便对于一款2013年的主机游戏来说也实在是太寒酸了，不过...你不会告诉我你是因为游戏画面才买这游戏的吧？立绘和CG才是重点啊！！！JRPG从来都不是以画面为主打因此我可以接受，但是莫名其妙的优化导致实际体验的时候简直感觉自己是在用PSP玩这游戏，相信应该会得到修复。本作的战斗系统其实还是有点内容的，和海王星比起来有更多的技能解锁和装备搭配，妖精卡牌的系统也做得挺细心的，不仅可以提升能力，连独立的语音都有，给了玩家更多一个刷刷刷的理由。值得一提的是英文的配音听起来居然挺带感的，所以不妨也可以试试用英文音轨练练听力让耳朵怀怀孕什么的。
总而言之，如果你是一个JRPG爱好者，想要在杀时间的同时还能有可爱的妹子养眼，buy it now！如果你没有女朋友，每天幻想少女砸穿你的天花板和你展开拯救世界的冒险，buy it now！如果你想追求真正的画面，剧情的双重体验...我认识一款游戏叫《仙剑奇侠传6》

有了这把剑，要女朋友有什么用！

17397733.review:
At first, I thought it was a slow RPG compared to the Neptunia games. But you actually have to build your way up with the Weapon Boost system. The mechanics are a lot deeper than I initially thought, and this is the type of RPG I like when it comes to that. Combat significantly improves the moment you start practicing the Combo system. It saves a lot of SP in the long run. Then there's also the Fairy system, which is essentially stat boosts and effects. It's simple and useful. I think the most advance would probably be the World Shaping. So far, I only used it to get more WP at the cost of double SP usage, but I didn't need to use SP anyway. If anything, it's helpful for grinding.

Voice acting, they're both great. Though, there are parts in the English dub where they don't even voice, but are voiced in the Japanese voices. Thought that was weird, but it's whatever.

This is definitely a recommend for JRPG fanatics that love deeper mechanics.

17394838.review:
《女神的追忆》地雷社脑残粉速入！
《妖精剑士F》是地雷社在2013年发售的PS3游戏，属于PS3末期游戏了，画面是神次元V的画面水准。所以移植后的效果，体验下了基本上是PS3水准。游戏内有日语和英语语音，由于是美版直接移植过来，所以字幕只有英语（很无语...）

游戏引擎想必地雷粉已经很熟悉的了，是用的海王星的引擎打造的，所以战斗方式也和熟悉的海王星回合制战斗方式非常类似。玩过海王星的玩家应该会很好上手，人剑合一等于变身相当于女神化。游戏怪物都不太强，基本上都是靠等级压制就能赢。然后武器系统由于是妖精就是自己的武器，所以有点与众不同的地方，再加上可以和妖精卡牌已经各种组合得到一些能力，还有卡牌用于插在地图上增加某些方面能力让这个游戏要素变得丰富。

剧情方面，日式游戏大都已剧情为大卖点，作为专为废萌游戏制作的地雷社，本作也在剧情上下了一定功夫，剧情属于那种中规中矩正邪大战，拯救世界的主旋律。欢乐是这个系列的主题，一路伴随着中二吃货的男主，还有M腹黑型的大小姐，和各种性格丰富的人一起很容易一口气玩下去，绝不很枯燥，在后面的成长中也能看到男主是一步步变得成熟。最后一段插曲《女神的追忆》让这个游戏在不完美中，追忆下去，一直到刻在自己心底。

这游戏继承的是PS3的内容，自然没有尚未发售的PS4新增的剧情。所以对于游戏结局来说可能不尽完美（甚至感觉故事都没说完...），当然这个时期发售，就是告诉你们，想要玩完美的剧情？OK，快入PS4再买一份FFF重制版，故事还没说完呢！

游戏音乐，里面的几个插曲非常好听，其实包括了上面的所提到的艾琳的角色曲《女神の追憶》及缇亚拉角色曲《時のゆりかご》。人设是つなこ,海王星和约炮画师，质量都是非常有保障的。

要说购买建议的话，如果你有PS4，或者打算入PS4的话，建议可以直接等到11月入这个PS4的游戏，那才是完整版！如果只有PC的话，感觉自己是萌豚就入了吧，当然壕可以完全无视这段话。

17394387.review:
It reminds me of Final Fantasy: Crystal Chronicles from the Gamecube. Not quite the same, but similar playstyle with similar battle mechanics and loot drops. I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys turn based JRPGs. If you like Final Fantasy games, I would also suggest this to you.

+Good Humor
+Fun Combat System
+Fairly customizable (In terms of powers/items)
+Good loot system
+Fairly Challenging Gameplay
+Somewhat interesting story
+/- Decent graphics albeit a bit outdated
-Repetitive

Overall I would give this game a 7.5/10

It's definitely one of the better JRPGs on steam as of 2015, but it won't blow you away. The first 10 hours or so are awesome and going further it tends to be more of the same. That's not a bad thing, but if you get bored easily you may want to look elsewhere. For $15 this game is definitely worth it, but if you were going to pay $30 I'd wait for it to go on sale.

17394136.review:
Welcome to a guilty pleasure, with a fair amount of "beat the carp with a wet fish" to boot.  Amusingly dynamic art during dialogue, and a jiggle engine (in case I wasn't subtle with my review).

On 1/2 off sale? totally worth it.  Full price...eh, maybe?

EDIT: Now that I've actually spent some real time on this thing, here's a better overview.

This game has relatively interesting battle mechanics and character advancement, without getting high off the smell of it's own flatulence like SquiEnix loves to do.  (Un)Fortunately, it is a loving testament to Shonen.  For those of you who aren't familiar, Shonen can be summed up as the (metaphorical) pre-pubescent boy navigating the hazards of middle school.  I felt the game was relatively well done, especialy for Shonen, and it managed to mostly avoid the obnoxious pit-falls of the genre.

Until the Thing. I forgot that modern Shonen also brings forth The Thing - the vaguely anthropomorphic not-an-animal which exists only to irritate the ever living hell out of anything with two brain cells to rub together.  An example of The Thing?  Exaclibur.  This Thing is of the same quality and pointlessness.

Oh Japan...

pros:
+jiggle engine
+relatively complex combat system
+dudes breath too
+Fairly interesting characters and story, despite being a collection of over-used cliches
+jiggle engine
+English voice acting doesn't make your ears bleed
+neither does the Japanese voice acting now that I mention it

cons:
-jiggle engine
-dudes don't show as much flesh as dudettes, creating a dearth of man-meat
-jiggle engine
-crushing sense of shame and guilt
-EXCALIBUR

Phenomenal port of Fairy Fencer F. The game supports 1440p, 4k, and ultrawide resolutions. There is a 60fps lock, but you can unlock the framerate via the FairyFencer.ini file. Really optimized compared to the Hyperdimension games, with combat being largely the same except that you have to develop your combos with Weapon Points that you obtain from battles. Dungeons are distinct so you won't be traveling through the same copy/pasted levels. Overall a great RPG.

Bottom line: Hyperdimension with fairies and a male lead.

Superb outta 10.

17391262.review:
นับตั้งแต่ที่ Idea Factory ประกาศว่าจะส่ง "Fairy Fencer F" ลงสู่ PC ผมก็เฝ้ารอวันที่จะได้สัมผัสเกมนี้มาโดยตลอดเพราะส่วนตัวผมเองนั้นค่อนข้างที่จะถูกโฉลกกับเกมจากค่ายนี้ (อาทิเช่น Agarest และ Hyperdimension) อยู่พอสมควร ดังนั้นเมื่อเกมเปิดตัว ผมก็แทบที่จะไม่ลังเลเลยสักนิดที่จะสอยเกมนี้ (ในราคา -50%) เพื่อที่จะมาทำ Review ให้ได้อ่านกัน

"Fairy Fencer F" นับได้ว่าเป็นเกมที่ค่อนข้างจะคล้ายคลึงกับเกมหัวเรือหลักของค่ายอย่าง "Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth" อย่างมากในหลาย ๆ จุด ไม่ว่าจะเป็นระบบต่อสู้ที่เป็น Turn-based (ที่เน้นการ Combo ด้วยการรัวปุ่มเหมือน Hack & Slash), ระบบ Quest และ Dungeons, การที่คุณสามารถปรับแต่งโลกของเกมได้ หรือแม้แต่ลูกเล่นเกี่ยวกับการแปลงร่าง ดังนั้นจะเรียกว่าเกมนี้เป็นพี่น้องของ Neptunia Re;birth เลยก็คงจะไม่ผิด

กระนั้นก็ไม่ใช่ทุกจุดของเกมที่ถอดแบบกันมา เพราะ Fairy Fancer F นั้นจะมีเนื้อหาเกี่ยวข้องกับคนกลุ่มหนึ่งในโลกแฟนตาซีที่เรียกว่า "Fencer" โดยพวกเขานั้นจะใช้อาวุธที่เรียกว่า "Fury" ในการต่อสู้กัน โดย Fury แต่ละอันนั้นก็จะมี "Fairy" สิงสถิตอยู่ภายใน (อ่านถึงตรงนี้ผมคงไม่ต้องอธิบายเพิ่มล่ะนะว่าชื่อของเกมนี้ได้มาเยี่ยงไร) โดยภารกิจของเหล่าตัวเอกนั้นก็ไม่ใช่อื่นใดแต่เป็นการพยายามรวบรวม Fury ที่กระจัดกระจายอยู่ทั่วทุกมุมโลกเพื่อจะปลดปล่อย Goddess (หรือ the Vile God) ให้เป็นอิสระ ผมไม่แน่ใจว่าเนื้อหาของเกมนั้นจะมีหักมุมกันสามสี่ตลบหรือไม่ (แต่โดยส่วนตัวเชื่อว่าไม่น่าจะมี) กระนั้นจุดขายของเนื้อหาก็อยู่ที่ความเป็น Comody และความโมเอ้ของตัวละครนั่นล่ะ ซึ่งถ้าคุณชอบการดำเนินเรื่องแบบ Agarest คุณก็คงจะชอบเกมนี้

และเจ้า "Fury" นี่เองก็คือปัจจัยหลักเลยที่ทำให้เกมนี้แตกต่างไปจากพี่สาวของมันอย่าง Re;birth เพราะในเกมนี้นอกจากคุณจะพัฒนาตัวละครด้วยการ Level Up ได้แล้ว คุณยังสามารถที่จะปรับแต่ง Fury เพื่อเสริมพลังหรือให้เหมาะกับรูปแบบการเล่นของคุณได้ด้วย แน่นอนว่าการที่จะพัฒนาตัวละครและ Fury นั้นจำเป็นที่จะต้องอาศัยการ Grind อย่างหนัก ถ้าคุณไม่ค่อยถูกโฉลกกับเกม JRPG แบบที่ต้องทำอะไรซ้ำ ๆ เป็นเวลานาน คุณก็ควรจะเลี่ยงเกมนี้ แต่ถ้าคุณคุ้นชินกับมันดีอยู่แล้วจากเกมของค่ายนี้ คุณก็คงจะไปได้สวยเลยทีเดียวกับ Fairy Fencer F

โดยรวมแล้ว "Fairy Fencer F" นับได้เป็นเหมือนกับร่างวิวัฒนาการของ Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth ที่ดียิ่งกว่านั่นล่ะ เพียงแต่อาจจะไม่มีทุ่งลิลลี่ให้ชมกันก็เท่านั้น ถ้าคุณชอบ Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth คุณก็คงจะต้องชอบเกมนี้ด้วยอย่างแน่นอน

คะแนน 8 / 10

ข้อดี:
+ ระบบต่อสู้แบบ Turn-based ที่ให้อารมณ์แบบเกม Action
+ "Fury" ที่มีความสามารถหลากหลายและสามารถปรับแต่งให้เข้ากับรูปแบบการเล่นของคุณได้
+/- เนื้อหาสาระที่สนุกสนานเฮฮา ชมง่าย ฮาง่าย ไม่ต้องคิดเยอะ

ข้อเสีย:
- มี FPS แอบหล่นให้เห็นนาน ๆ ทีแบบหาสาเหตุไม่ได้ (แต่ในจุดนี้ผมต้องขอหมายเหตุว่าอาจเป็นที่เครื่องผมเอง เพราะไม่เห็นใครอื่นกล่าวถึง)
- เป็นเกมที่อาศัยการ Grind หนักมากตามสไตน์ JPRG ที่ดี คุณจึงจำเป็นต้องอดทนมาก ๆ ในการเล่น
- แน่นอนว่าหลังจากนี้คงจะมี DLC โผล่ตามมาอีกเพียบเป็นหางว่าว

สรุป:
ถ้าคุณชอบเกมอย่าง Agarest หรือ Hyperdimension Neptunia นี่คือเกมที่ผม Recommend ให้แก่คุณว่าควรเล่น แต่ถ้าไม่แต่อยากลอง ก็ไม่ใช่เรื่องเสียหายที่จะลอง เพราะมันเป็น JRPG ที่ดีมาก ๆ เกมหนึ่งที่คุณจะหาได้บน PC

ゲーム自体には罪はない。面白いし、おすすめできる
だが、このゲームは日本から購入できない、いわゆる[b]おま国[/b]タイトルの一つであり、日本の会社でありながらこのような日本への差別を行うアイディアファクトリーの姿勢は理解できない

日本ではPCゲームはマイナーな存在だと言われてきた。しかし、デジカによれば、[u]Steamユーザのうち4～5％は日本のユーザ[/u]で、さらにValveによると2014年の日本円決済と日本独自の決済方法への対応以降、日本における収益が86%も増加したという
そして、[u]日本のSteamユーザの購入額は、世界上位10カ国に入る[/u]という事実も明かされた。[b]日本は既に、巨大なマーケットの一つに成長している[/b]のだ。

PCは日本でも広く普及し、PCゲームも確実に普及が進んでいるのに、あえて時代に逆行するようなことを何故行っているのだろうか?
我々はPCゲームがやりたいのだ。日本からの購入が規制されたところで、PS3やPS4をわざわざ購入してコンソール版を購入するか? 答えは否だ。なぜPC版が出ているのに、コンソールハードを購入しなくてはならないのだ?

Re;Birth1では海外から日本語字幕対応の要望があったという。日本語に完全対応し、国内からの購入も可能にすれば、海外プレイヤーにも、我々国内プレイヤーにも、アイディアファクトリーにも利益をもたらすだろう
今からでも遅くない。アイディアファクトリーには今一度考え直して頂きたい。

17389845.review:
Some first impressions from my first hour of playtime regarding the port and comparability to Hyperdimension Neptunia:

First off, the game runs smooth even on my old toaster card. This is likely due to it being more CPU intensive to begin with, but even then I am seeing no hiccups with my i5-4460 and my HD5750, running Windows 10 Pro x64 - in other words, the game runs smoothly at 60fps (which is the default lock as per the .ini file, but may be unlockable).
There are no in-game graphics options to speak of besides resolution and a fullscreen/windowed/borderless toggle, but then you'll hardly need more, seeing the game's artstyle and heavy reliance on animated 2D backgrounds and sprites. Further graphics settings may be available in the .ini file again, and AA can be forced via your graphics vendor's control panel regardless.
Settings for controls, sound and so on are all there, including manual button remapping for your gamepad (which should help with getting non-standard Xinput pads to work), and Voice, Movie, Effects and BGM volumes have separate sliders, as they should have.

From a gameplay standpoint, the game is close to Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth, which it supposedly shares the engine with. If you've played Neptunia, you'll find it easy to get into the systems, though even after an hour of playtime, there are differences and additions in Fairy Fencer F. 

Those differences include the Tension meter that raises/lowers your stats in combat and allows you to transform at a certain point (whereas Neptunia gave you more free reign with transformations), "boosting" weapon stats, learning new skills and what not through using them to earn and assign points, attaching Fairies to your characters for added perks, switching weapon styles to increase certain parameters like crit chance, speed and the likes, and Character Challenges which reward you with stat increases for various gameplay milestones. 
These challenges also encourage cycling through your party members, as some of them demand a character to be the party leader or do things only the leader is able to. It is a nifty system I'm looking forward to explore more in-depth, as it should keep things fresh (if a little grindy in the higher ranks, I expect).
Overall, the gameplay system at least feels more complex in terms of customization and late-game options than Neptunia (though take my judgement with a grain of salt - I'm not that far in yet).

The story and characters up to now seem like a good combination. The character dynamic between the protagonist and his fairy partner are funny and lighthearted, which reminds of Neptunia, but appears far more grounded and less preposterous than Nep did. If Gamindustri felt too wacky and over the top to you, Fairy Fencer F might deliver a more enjoyable experience.
The basic plot is very simple in theory: Collect all the Fury weapons and revive the Goddess, explore dungeons, talk to people in towns (again, more grounded than in Neptunia, though very similar in execution), and fill your protagonist's stomach.

The art design and music are straight-up gorgeous, as would be expected from the team behind them (which includes Nobuo Uematsu as composer and Yoshitaka Amano on the art, two big creatives that made Final Fantasy so good in its glory days). Fairy Fencer F offers some top-notch, high quality art in the typical J-RPG/Anime style. 

Overall, I am pleased with my purchase, and will continue playing it.

17389488.review:
I have played and platinumed Fairy Fencer F on the PS3, and this review is based on my playthrough of that, and what I've seen for this port's optimization. I'll edit the review if I see the need to as I playthrough the game.
This is going to be very simple pros and cons to get straight to the point, and make some comaprisons with Hyperdimension Neptunia, since that's what a lot of the people buying into this are expecting.

[h1]Characters[/h1] 
Fang, Eryn and Tiara are fantastic comedy-centered characters. However, these are the only characters that will give you the same feel as Neptunia. Not only that, but every other playable character is almost completely insignificnt. (Minus a betrayal or two.) The voice acting is fantastic; both Japanese, and English. The art and character sprites are much better than in Neptunia.

[h1]Dungeons[/h1] 
The dungeons aren't copy pastes of eachother. That's right, did going through the same exact landscape OVER, AND OVER in Neptunia get on your nerves? You don't have you worry about it for this. Some of the dungeons are far more expancsive as well. Regardless, however, many still aren't the most visually appealing.

[h1]Combat[/h1] 
Almost a copy-paste of Neptunia's system. There are some differences, such as the tension gauge, which is used to Fairize (Essentially the characters transformation, like that CPU forms in Neptunia.). You do not equip weapons, because each weapon is bound to the character it is equips on. Instead you power up your character with WP you gan through battle.

[h1]Grinding[/h1] 
The grinding in Fairy Fencer F is much worse than Neptunia. Although the game does not pose very much difficulty, you'll still be killing the same enemies OVER AND OVER to amass WP, to power up your weapons. WP is earned maybe 2-3 per battle, and is used to dictate your weapons Physical attack Power, to its Range, special attacks, normal combo attacks and even the amount of hits it gets in a combo. It also gets to the point where a single power up can cost 1000 WP. So get ready for the grind train when you go to play this.

[h1]Story[/h1] 
It's pretty generic for jRPG games. Sealed dieties that split their power in the past. Hero finds a "fragment" of the power and continues on a journey to unseal the "goddess", while the badguys try to unseal the "demon lord". You'll basically fight one badguy at a time sent by the enemy organization until you reach the end of the game. All threee ending are lackluster. Once again, it's Idea Factory, and Compile Heart's characters that make the game. 

[h1]Optimization[/h1] 
They overlayed the buttons for default keyboard use; which they didn't do for Re;Birth's steam release. This makes it much easier to get used to the mapping. There's always full controller support as well if you're still having trouble. There's much more mouse support than Neptunia. YOU CAN MOVE AROUND WITH THE MOUSE. REVOLUTIONARY. I haven't had too many FPS issues, as I did with Re;Birth (Mainly Sister Generation) but, I'm newer to computer gaming, so I don't have much experience with FPS issues in the first place. Most of the DLC comes with the product. Of course, these are originally free DLC in the first place, but at least you don't need to go download them one by one like I had to do on the playstation store. It looks like they'll release the paid DLC in the future as well.

[h1]tl;dr[/h1] 
It's definetly a different experience than Neptunia, but you'll see the similarities. The grinding made me want to break the game disk; but now that I baught the game on steam I'll experience it all over again. 
However, it is most definetly worth the money.

17388713.review:
หลังจากที่ได้ลองเล่นแล้ว รู้สึกว่าตัวเกมPortมาได้ดีมากครับ ภาพสวย เล่นได้ไหลลื่นมากๆ
(ก็ขอวิจารณ์ไว้คร่าวๆนะครับ ไว้เล่นไปไกลแล้วจะมาเขียนเพิ่มอีก)	

          มาว่ากันที่เนื้อเรื่องของเกมและระบบการเล่น (ไม่สปอยไรมากครับ) ซึ่งเนื้อเรื่องนั้นเกี่ยวกับการออกเดินทางของพระเอกนามว่าFang เพื่อตามหาภูตที่จะแฝงตัวอยู่ในอาวุธที่เรียกว่า “Fury” ที่มีหน้าที่ในการปลดผนึกให้กับเทพธิดาที่ได้ต่อสู้กับเทพแห่งความชั่วร้ายจนต้องถูกผนึกไปด้วยกันทั้งคู่ ซึ่งผู้ที่สามารถปลดผนึกให้กับเทพธิดาได้จะได้รับพร 1 ข้อไม่ว่าจะปรารถนาสิ่งใดก็สามารถขอได้ทุกอย่าง โดยพรที่พระเอกนั้นต้องการขอก็ไม่ได้อะไรมากมายนักขอแค่มีข้าวกินฟรีไปตลอดชีวิตก็พอ ซึ่งก็เหมือนเกมRPGทั่วๆไป ตีมอน ทำเควส เก็บเวล หาเงิน หาของ ซื้อของ มีชุดเปลี่ยน มีเครื่องประดับให้ใส่เสริมความน่ารัก (มีชุดว่ายน้ำและชุดผ้าขนหนูด้วยนะ) เนื้อเรื่องในเกมดูแล้วเข้าใจง่ายและระบบการเล่นนั้นเล่นไม่ยาก (ก็ระบบการเล่นคล้ายๆเกมNeptunia) ถึงแม้ไม่เคยเล่นเกมซีรีย์นี้มาก่อนเลยก็ตาม ก็เข้าใจได้ง่าย เพราะในเกมมีสอนและบอกเกี่ยวกับระบบพื้นฐานและการกดปุ่มต่างๆไว้หมดแล้ว ไม่ต้องกลัวหรือกังวลว่าจะเล่นยาก อย่างไงก็มีภูตErynสุดแสนน่ารักคอยให้คำแนะนำบอกกล่าวเราตลอด

[h1]ระบบของเกมที่น่าสนใจ[/h1]
-การรวมร่างกับFury(อาวุธเทพ)ซึ่งสามารถดึงพลังออกมาได้มากสุดชั่วขณะหนึ่ง(ถ้าใครนึกไม่ออกก็ประมาณสวมภูษาเวทย์ในเรื่องMagi) 
-การติดตั้งภูติเมื่อติดตั้งภูติแล้วจะได้สกิลมาด้วยจะได้ค่าพลังและความสามารถพิเศษของภูตินั้นๆมา(ถ้านึกไม่ออกก็ประมาณใส่มิทามะในเกมTOKIDEN) 
-Challenge ถ้าเราทำได้ตามเงื่อนไขก็จะได้รับสเตตัสตอบแทน ซึ่งมีประโยชน์มากๆ
-มีการเสริมพลังอัพสเตตัสค่าพลังต่างๆได้ตามต้องการ เลือกสกิลที่จะใช้ได้ตามต้องการ ชอบอันไหนก็อัพอันนั้น
-สามารถเลือกสายการเล่นได้อิสระ สามารถผสมคอมโบของท่าอาวุธแต่ละอย่างมาใช้ร่วมกันได้ เช่นพระเอกของเราใช้คอมโบท่าดาบ+กับท่าหมัดหรือท่าค้อนร่วมกันได้ หรือเทียร่าใช้ท่าธนูร่วมกับท่าดาบก็ได้
- คำสั่งพิเศษเฉพาะตัวละคร เป็นคำสั่งพิเศษที่จะเกิดผลด้านต่างๆเฉพาะตัวละครนั้นๆ บางตัวมีผลส่งถึงมอนด้วย

[h1]ข้อดีของเกม		[/h1]
- ภาพสวย
- ได้ความสนุก
- ตัวเกมเล่นได้ไหลลื่น ไม่มีสะดุด
- ราคาถูก
- ตัวละครสาวๆน่ารัก
- มีตัวละครให้เลือกเล่นเยอะ
-เพลงประกอบต่างๆของเกมฟังดูสนุก น่าตื่นเต้นมากๆ โดยเฉพาะตอนรวมร่างกับFury และพูดว่าแฟอะไรซ์ เป็นอะไรที่สุดยอดมากๆ และก็เพลงประกอบตอนเข้าหอคอย เป็นอะไรที่สุดยอดมากๆด้วย และยิ่งฉากซึ้งนี้ยิ่งซึ้งตามเลย

17388341.review:
The PC port of Fairy Fencer F is a great PS3 port unlike other ports that are 1:1 ports without PC exclusive features. Resolutions up to 4K and possibly higher are supported! There are options to enable AntiAliasing in the FairyFencer.ini not only that but it can run at any FPS your pc can handle so those with 144Hz monitors can change the 60fps cap to 144 via the FairyFencer.ini located at the games root. Older video cards can disable shadows and effects to gain an fps boost (also found in the .ini). 

Performance aside the game is quite fun to play! The translation wasn't screwed over, the combat system is great and the characters actually develop as the story goes. I have played through this game 8 times and exp grinded like hell and i'm still not burned out!

Overall this was a hell of a good game. Would I recommend? What kind of silly question is that? Of course I recommend!!

17388223.review:
This review is based on what i have played on PC for Fairy Fencer F (フェアリーフェンサーエフ)
Fairy Fencer F (フェアリーフェンサーエフ) is a 2013 fantasy role-playing game developed by Compile Heart's for the PlayStation 3, which will take around 45-50 hours to complete 1 playthrough, depends on individual.

[h1] For PC port [/h1]
[u] For PC it works perfectly fine for me at 60 FPS and no bugs. [/u]
[i] For people who expierence low FPS on windows 8.1 i suggest you to update it to windows 10 beacuse after doing that it increase my FPS from 43 to 60. [/i]

[u] Hope this helps because i saw some people having trouble with the FPS they have in game. [/u]

[h1] A brief overview of the Story [/h1]
A long time ago there was a conflict between a goddess and a evil god. The two deities didn’t fight directly, but created a large number of special weapons imbued with their godly energy, each containing the life force of a fairy for others to use. Eventually, these powers sealed each other and the power vanished from the world. Going into modern times, warriors that wield the powers (Furies) are known as "Fencers."
Fairy Fencer F places you in the role of Fang reluctant hero that is more interested in his next meal, becomes a Fencer—warrior chosen by The Goddess to become companions to fairies, who are magical beings who can transform into a variety of weapons called "Furies" and warriors that wield them are "Fencers".
Fury weapons are said to be incredibly powerful, so Fencers constantly scramble to acquire them. By a strange coincidence, fang finds himself rescuing a young woman named Tiara, who is also a Fencer as well. This fateful encounter between two Fencers has dire consequences, and Fang soon finds himself involved in the ongoing conflict between the Goddess and Vile God.

[h1] Gameplay and important elements[/h1]
Unlike most JRPGs, you don't equip any new weapons in Fairy Fencer F. Since each Fencer is bound to one fairy partner, you instead upgrade your fairy to increase its capabilities and powers which is unique. (Unless you have the DLC weapons then equipping weapons will affect stats)

[u] The combat system is close to Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth 1 and 2. So hyperdimension fans you can feel at ease getting this game as you should be familiar with it. [/u]

The dialogue and voice acting are both well done, and the soundtrack is really nice as the soundtracks blends perfectly with the action going on in your screen.
As for the combat the characters special attacks have flashy animations. It is like watching a really cool anime. For example, Fate franchise.

To sum it up Fairy Fencer F is a enjoyable way to spend 45-50 hours for 1 play through, and would definitely recommend it to, JRPG fans, Anime lovers or those who want to try somethwing new.

[h1] Official website links [/h1]
http://www.compileheart.com/fairyfencer_f/        -japanese website
http://nisamerica.com/games/fairyfencerf/#/top  -english website

17388106.review:
Новая jrpg (ну не совсем новая) от знакомых нам разработчиков такой линейки игр как Hyperdimension Neptunia. 
Первое, что можно подметить ГГ парень (фантастика). Боевая система схожа с Hyperdimension Neptunia victory 2 (хотя наверное наоборот фейри же раньше вышла). У монстров нет защиты, только полоска хп (у боссов несколько таких полосок) и это очень радует. 
Можно заметить их режим фьюри схож с трансформацией нептунии (так же усилена атака и защита??). 
Картинка радует глаз. Музыка успокаивает. И я естественно всем советую эту игру. 
P.S Но если уж трогаю нептунию и фэйри, то тут отличительная черта (мне она в худшую сторону). Это прокачка уровней, основного состава (3 человека), запас у нас вагон. И бывают такие моменты когда твой напарник по сюжету отошел (ну кто его знает, погулять там) А ты уже под 30 лвл и тут вылезает наш вагончик уровня 10+. Ну вот и весь минус.

17387378.review:
惯例的福利时间：
妖精剑士F 全CG （1920x1080大图 转自贴吧） 预览：
http://ww2.sinaimg.cn/large/720e6a07gw1eur5i11db1j20sg0g00y5.jpg
http://ww1.sinaimg.cn/large/720e6a07gw1eur5hv8vj9j20sg0g00zi.jpg
http://ww3.sinaimg.cn/large/720e6a07gw1eur5i87citj20sg0g0tes.jpg
百度云： http://pan.baidu.com/s/1bnDGmcf 密码：gp67

[h1]评测如下：[/h1]

首先满60帧没有锁帧，我这破机子第一次开游戏只有30多帧，后来某次我在窗口/无边框/全屏来回换了几次，最后换到全屏发现变成60满帧了。不过就算是30帧玩着其实没啥大影响，跟之前讨鬼传那种30帧痛苦到死不一样，一来这是RPG那是ACT，二来光荣一向是锁刷新率，当你帧数不足时会降低演示速率（即慢动作），掉帧还能玩，慢动作玩个蛋……

画面应该算是比海王星稍微好一点吧？UI做的比海王星精致，感觉敌人的建模也比海王星的敌人用了更多的面数（主角就不用说了，海王星的女神建模一样不错）

三位主角的声优也演出的不错。这里多提一点，跟遍地玩梗的海王星不同，尽管日译英水准一如既往的渣（想想著名的球系列的文本的汉化后的效果吧，日语和印欧语系的互译实在是很难正常表达出原文风格和语气），但这游戏的对白姑且算是简单易懂，日文语音英文字幕完全没压力，所以各位只要稍微有点听力阅读基础就可以让机翻组的玩意儿滚蛋了——不过我相信能花钱买这游戏的人平时搞其他日呆玩意儿也不会少。

剧情不说了，RPG的标准王道剧情。PS4有续作或者算是重制版会在11月左右发售，包括更长的剧情。不过说到底，这个故事并没有特别大的悬念。

这个价格肯定是物有所值。其实说实话IF社就算是首周-10一样能卖，不过他们这样首周-50二个月-75也确实是有效的策略。夏特前海王星1代销量是8.5万，2代是3.5万；现在1代是16万，2代是6万，分别涨了近1倍（这些数值还只是被统计到的），即便按照全部为首周/特惠时期购买计算累计也有超过300万美元的收入了，对比JRPG的移植成本也是赚了个爽，也难怪IF社磕了药一样高速移植——下一部移植作品是神次元V世纪，不跳票的话是10月底发售。

[h1]最后，强烈建议买PS4版的妖精剑士F重制版，那个才算是妖精剑士的完整版[/h1]
